Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002712
Reply.text: Comrades, this moment has finally arrived. We've been waiting for you for a long time. Tell those filthy bloodsuckers that we will never agree to their terms. They'd better come here and kill us. That's the only thing that'll satisfy them...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002713
Reply.text: I'm sorry, but I don't know what you're talking about.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002714
Reply.text: Wait, so you're not a delegate of these invaders?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002716
Reply.text: Who are you, then? And how did you end up here?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002717
Reply.text: My name is Lisa, I came here with my friend from the far south through a tunnel. We couldn't open the gate, but my car managed to squeeze through a small gap in the wall.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002718
Reply.text: Please forgive us our inhospitality, but times are such that we have to build walls at every entrance. You never know where a new danger will come from.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002719
Reply.text: Tell me what's going on here.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002720
Reply.text: In a few words, we were attacked by our neighbors. We had a very strained relationship before, but recently everything collapsed entirely. And the main driving force of this attack was their best militarized clan, the Adepts of the Red Torch. Madmen and murderers who will fight with anyone for money.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002721
Reply.text: Why did they attack you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002722
Reply.text: They are convinced that we are a threat to them. Funny, we don't even have the means to cross the icy wilderness that separates their lands from ours. The attack was sudden - taking advantage of our helplessness, they took over all our major cities pretty quickly. They claim not to harm civilians, but I have seen for myself what happened to those who in any way condemned their actions or openly called for peace. It's horrible, I tell you...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002723
Reply.text: So you're at war with them?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002724
Reply.text: We are hiding. We can't fight with them. We don't have the strength or the resources to do so. They keep sending emissaries asking us to surrender, but we always refuse. I don't think it can go on much longer. Everyone here knows they will be here soon. It's only a matter of time.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002725
Reply.text: But you can't just sit here and wait for these murderers to show up and kill you all!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002726
Reply.text: What else can we do?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002727
Reply.text: You have to attack first! If they are sure you are weak and helpless, they certainly don't expect an attack!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002728
Reply.text: I will not sacrifice people. And that is out of the question.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002729
Reply.text: Well, at least I tried. And yes, I dare to ask: can you open the gate for my friend? Since you don't care now.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002730
Reply.text: We care, none of us want to die. But we are ready for it. I don't know why, but I believe you. We will open the gate for your friend. But the key to that gate was left in Malinovka. We left this village for fear of an attack; it was all very messy, and we left quite a lot of valuable supplies there. You'll have to go there first.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002731
Reply.text: Okay, I'll do it. Where exactly should I look?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002732
Reply.text: In my house, right in the middle of the road arc. It would be good if you could get some food, water and warm clothes from there, too. And watch out for patrols: there have been too many of them in the area lately.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002733
Reply.text: Okay, I get it. Key, provisions and clothes. I'll be right over.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002734
Reply.text: ...So as soon as I found out that the girl had been captured and that the key to the gate had been irretrievably lost, I ordered Mikolka to take some dynamite and blow up the hinges. By the way, why did you come to these lands in the first place?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002735
Reply.text: I'm looking for a composite. Or rather, I was looking. Right now my first priority is saving Lisa.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002736
Reply.text: Composite... I think I've heard that word many years ago... What was the name of that traveler, it had completely slipped my mind...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002737
Reply.text: Ivan Go?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002742
Reply.text: Yes, that's right, Ivan. He was passing through here about twenty years ago and was also looking for a composite. I sent him to the wise men who lived in the mountains, and he passed all their challenges and came back with the material. At that time, of course, it was much calmer here than it is now, and the bridge to the wise men's lands was open.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002743
Reply.text: Is that bridge gone now?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002744
Reply.text: It's still there, thank the gods. But you can't get close to it anyway - the Adepts have captured it, and now their pillboxes shoot anyone who comes within firing distance of it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002745
Reply.text: This is going to sound strange, but I'm used to this kind of difficulties. But I have to free Lisa at first. Do you have any thoughts on the best way to do this?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002746
Reply.text: This may sound paradoxical, but the best thing you can do is to go straight to them. They've been sending messengers to us all the time, and they probably expect us to do the same. And now there's a good reason.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002747
Reply.text: Okay, since there are no other options anyway...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002748
Reply.text: Well, well, well, this is interesting.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002749
Reply.text: You know why I'm here.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002750
Reply.text: Straight to the point, huh? I like that. Okay, so here's the deal: you came here from far away, you have no ties to this place, and you have absolutely no regard for the locals. Plus we have your girlfriend. You don't seem to have much of a choice. You see where I'm going with this?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002751
Reply.text: I'm starting to guess.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002752
Reply.text: The primary goal of our group is to disarm the locals. Bloodshed, torture and murder are, of course, all very wonderful and great for stirring up blood, but our command is kind of "for all the good and against all the bad," and they are extremely unhappy with the number of civilian casualties, and if we also slaughter their last villages, they will be furious at all. And I don't need that; I'm getting a pretty good reward for the success of the operation.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002753
Reply.text: And what you're doing in captured cities doesn't seem to bother your command.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002754
Reply.text: Let's just say they don't mind. And sometimes they're very much in favor of it. But I've already said too much, so that's all you'll get from me. So, I'll continue. It's very undesirable for us to kill civilians as part of our military operation, but you... You don't have to follow orders, you have nothing to do with the locals, and you're practically impossible to be court-martialed. And we got your girlfriend. You never know what could happen to her...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002758
Reply.text: If I do this, in addition to freeing Lisa, you will also open a bridge to the Mountains of the Wise.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002759
Reply.text: Yes, we can arrange that.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002760
Reply.text: It's a tempting offer, but I need to think it over.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002761
Reply.text: Think fast. Don't forget, we have deadlines, too.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002762
Reply.text: All right, all right.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002755
Reply.text: What do you think you're doing! I would never kill innocent people!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002756
Reply.text: That's not the answer I want to hear from you. Perhaps I'll give you time to think about it. But don't take too long, because it won't do any good to wait. For anyone.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002757
Reply.text: All right, all right. [I'm not going to wait! I must warn the locals right away!]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002763
Reply.text: Well? Have you thought about it?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002827
Reply.text: Not yet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002764
Reply.text: It's a rotten job, but I'm used to it. Do you have a plan?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002765
Reply.text: Yes. We'll send a messenger to the locals and ask them to meet us at this spot. I don't think they'll go there armed to the teeth, so it won't be difficult at all to capture them. Then we will pay a visit to their village and ask them to surrender. If they surrender, you get Lisa and the way to the mountains.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002766
Reply.text: And if not?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002767
Reply.text: Then you'll get a new order.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002768
Reply.text: All right, I'm on it.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuestIfTaken('CivilOrAdept2'); CompleteQuestIfTaken('CivilOrAdept3'); TakeQuest('KillStar1_Quest'); TActivate('KLRolikStart'); SetTolerance(1100, 1088, RS_ENEMY); SetTolerance(1100, 1091, RS_ALLY); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002769
Reply.text: Well? What did they say?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002770
Reply.text: They agreed to let Lisa go and free the way to the Mountains of the Wise. But only if I lured you into their ambush. I couldn't agree to that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002771
Reply.text: In vain. Our days are numbered anyway, what difference does it make whether we die now or in a few days.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002772
Reply.text: Is there really no way out of this situation?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002773
Reply.text: There is one. To be more exact, there was one. Until the Adepts took over Moska. You see those boats over there?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002775
Reply.text: If we could get some details, we could repair the engines and use those boats to ferry people and provisions to that battleship over there and then sail as far away as possible. But everything we could use is in Moska.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002776
Reply.text: Yes, the situation is not so bright. Is there nowhere else you can find them?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002777
Reply.text: We looked almost everywhere. A day ago, Serafima, my only daughter, went to check out the last place, an abandoned industrial plant, but she still hasn't come back. Do me a favor and see if she's had any trouble.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002778
Reply.text: I'll check it out.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002779
Reply.text: Thank you so much for saving Seraphima! They didn't manage to hurt her and she's fine. The fact that she found the blueprints is wonderful! But there's some bad news as well...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002780
Reply.text: What news?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002781
Reply.text: No engine details were found at the plant. So they are all in Moska.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002782
Reply.text: Well, then, we don't have much of a choice. It's either certain death or actions. Of course, they can also lead to death, but it's definitely worth a try.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002783
Reply.text: Do you already have a plan?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002784
Reply.text: We don't need a plan. What are our options? We don't have the advantage, we don't have any serious combat equipment. All that's left is the element of surprise. We should at least take Kateberg.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002785
Reply.text: Are you suggesting an attack on Kateberg?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002786
Reply.text: Do you have any better suggestions? Your people are desperate. We have to act now, before they lose their nerve. Besides, with these blueprints, our chances of success are much greater. And this grader is going to be a big help to us.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002787
Reply.text: I guess you're right. But wouldn't such a bold move hurt your friend?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002788
Reply.text: Let's hope not. At least the locals will help her.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002789
Reply.text: Okay, if that's the case. I need time to work out a plan of action. Get some rest, and then go to the meeting place.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002790
Reply.text: That's what I'll do. Maybe it won't work, but at least we'll try.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002791
Reply.text: We did it! I can't believe it! Kateberg is ours now!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002792
Reply.text: To be honest, I didn't think we'd make it. It's too bad about the men who died, they were very brave warriors.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002793
Reply.text: It is truly grief, but at least their deaths were not in vain. Now we can counter the invaders with a substantial force. But it won't last long; they've probably already asked for reinforcements and will knock us out very soon.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002794
Reply.text: So we need to act quickly to get the engine parts and find Lisa. I hope she escaped.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002795
Reply.text: [Toward the radio] Yes, over... Got it, I'll tell him right now... |I have just received information that adepts have attacked two of our villages. They say they are looking for some escaped prisoner.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002796
Reply.text: It's definitely Lisa! She managed to escape after all! I must find her before they do!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002797
Reply.text: Then you should definitely hurry. If she has run away somewhere, she can only hide in one of our villages.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002798
Reply.text: But you said there were no more villages left.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002828
Reply.text: I lied to you. I didn't know back then who you were or what your motives were, but you've proven you're willing to fight on our side, so give me the map, and I'll mark where the rest of our villages are. I won't have any more secrets from you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002829
Reply.text: Thank you for your trust. And now I have to go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002799
Reply.text: Your friend told me about the situation in the Adept's capital.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002801
Reply.text: And you already have a plan?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002802
Reply.text: She has. And you won't like it. You know, you better discuss it with her.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002800
Reply.text: Don't even try to convince me not to do it!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002804
Reply.text: You know, I haven't heard your plan yet, but I don't like it already.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002805
Reply.text: Everyone in Moska is on their ears after the capture of Kateberg. They've got so many weapons in the ground depots there, that we'll never get them. We couldn't even get close to them.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002806
Reply.text: And what do you suggest?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002807
Reply.text: Take advantage of their superiority. There's literally an entire city full of ammunition. You know what would happen if something went wrong? A spark goes off and that's it. Better yet, the vehicle explodes. Just to be sure.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002808
Reply.text: What about the engine parts? They will be destroyed along with the city.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002809
Reply.text: They won't. They are all in an armored warehouse under the city, nothing will happen to them.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002810
Reply.text: But how are we supposed to blow up a vehicle inside the city?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002811
Reply.text: Well, look. Their pillboxes shoot at all unknown vehicles. They'll shoot at your car, any local car. But not mine. They know me. All the more so if the guns are taken off. We'll load explosives in my car and activate the detonator when it's inside the city.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002812
Reply.text: No! Out of the question! You're going to die! You said it would blow up!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002813
Reply.text: Listen to me! No one is talking about me being in this car myself!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002814
Reply.text: Who's going to drive her then? It's not going to drive itself, is it?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002815
Reply.text: Velimir will.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002816
Reply.text: But he's going to die!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002817
Reply.text: Unfortunately, yes. He told me that he is terminally ill and that his hour is near. He hid it from everyone so that his men would not lose courage, but he could not go on like this for long. Even if it all worked out, he would not survive the trip across the ocean and would be a burden to everyone.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002818
Reply.text: So that's how it is...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002819
Reply.text: He made the decision himself, and he's not going to discuss it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002820
Reply.text: In that case, we just have to do everything in our power to make sure that his sacrifice will not be in vain.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002821
Reply.text: And we will do it. The plan is as follows: first he arrives in Moska in my car and activates the detonator, and then you and the locals clean up the surviving soldiers of the adepts. Don't worry about the captured civilians: tonight Dimitry and Seraphima will evacuate all the civilians and prisoners. We leave tomorrow. In the meantime, we'd better get some rest.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002822
Reply.text: Yeah, that's a good idea.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002830
Reply.text: So, about my plan...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002831
Reply.text: I'm all ears.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002832
Reply.text: With Dimitry's help, I managed to get the blueprints of Moska and Kateberg, and with your help we now have the grader. Our chances of success increase considerably, don't they?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002833
Reply.text: That's right. What do you suggest?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002834
Reply.text: To attack Kateberg. You, Mikolka on the grader and a couple more of our fighters will attack the city from the outside and take out the pillboxes and the outer guard, while others will use these blueprints to get inside the city through the sewers and hit it from the rear. Such tactics should minimize civilian casualties.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002835
Reply.text: What about Lisa's escape?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002836
Reply.text: I will tell Dimitry that she should run away exactly when we hit Kateberg. There will be turmoil in Moska, and it will be much easier to escape under such conditions.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002837
Reply.text: It's a reasonable plan. All that's left is to get it to your father.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002838
Reply.text: My God, it's you! I was afraid they have found me... Thank you for not leaving me!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002839
Reply.text: How did you manage to escape?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002843
Reply.text: Dimitry helped me. Not only did he tell me exactly when to run, but he also fixed my car, otherwise I wouldn't have been able to start it!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002844
Reply.text: I'm glad he didn't deceive me! Listen, it's not safe for you to stay here - follow me to Kateberg and we'll discuss there what to do next.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002823
Reply.text: The locals were much more clever than we thought. They skillfully tricked us into believing that Severka was their only village.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002840
Reply.text: And what other villages are there?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002841
Reply.text: We don't know yet. The key word is "yet." Our men have captured the daughter of their headman in the old factory and are about to interrogate her. Go to them and assist.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002842
Reply.text: I'm on my way.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002824
Reply.text: So you're the enterprising volunteer who is helping us to smoke out the locals? Well, you're not bad.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002845
Reply.text: You sound like I'm doing it of my own free will.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002846
Reply.text: Oh, yeah, we got your friend, I almost forget about it. Don't worry, she's fine. We'll bring her back safe and sound as soon as we're done with the locals. Now listen carefully: we've managed to get the location of the powerful military vehicle that they have, as well as the location of their other two villages.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002847
Reply.text: Powerful military vehicle? Where did they get it from?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002848
Reply.text: We can only guess. The good news is that there are no weapons on it yet. I'll give you the coordinates, first go there and destroy it. Then attack their villages with our troops. We could launch preemptive strikes, but then there would be many casualties, which is still undesirable. They have pillboxes there, but they're not very strong, and you should have absolutely no trouble dealing with them. Here, take this map. It marks all the settlements that are here in the region.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002849
Reply.text: After that, will you let Lisa go and open the bridge?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002850
Reply.text: Yes. And we'll also express our gratitude to you and pay you some money. Ha-ha-ha! That's it, go, time is of the essence!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002851
Reply.text: I'll do it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002825
Reply.text: Masterfully done. And how slowly it went to the bottom - look at that beautifulness!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002852
Reply.text: Where's Lisa?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002853
Reply.text: There she is, alive and well. Take our thanks and 150000 coins as a reward. We've opened the bridge, the pillboxes won't attack you. I don't know what you want to find there, but good luck! I hope you won't regret your efforts.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002854
Reply.text: I already regretted it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002826
Reply.text: What the hell did you do?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002855
Reply.text: I saved you, actually...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002856
Reply.text: By killing innocent locals?! By burning down houses with women and children inside?! By shooting unarmed vehicles?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002857
Reply.text: I did it to save your life! I am not proud of these actions, but I believe I chose the lesser evil in this situation.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002858
Reply.text: Lesser evil?! I had a plan of escape worked out from the very first day I was in this town! I had everything under control, I would have had help from the locals who were disgruntled with the Adept regime! But you killed them all. What can I say, good for you, you solved the problem! I'm disgusted to even look at you!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002860
Reply.text: Shut up! That's enough of that. My car won't start, I think some component of the engine is out of order becouse of the cold, so I'll go with you. I need to think it over, so don't even try to talk to me, I still haven't forgiven you. And I don't think I ever will... Finish your mug and come over. I'll be waiting for you in the car.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002861
Reply.text: Well... |But I wanted to do better...
Reply.scriptResult: TActivate('OpenTheBridge'); TActivate('triggerExitToMap15'); TActivate('triggerExitToMap14'); AddHistory( 'r5_AdeptWin' ); AddFadingMsgId( 'fm_history_got' ); AddQuestItem('Lisa_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_poput', 'Lisa_P'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002862
Reply.text: Skillful, cold-blooded, professional! How good you were! If you were my subordinate, I'd be sure to promote you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002863
Reply.text: I've done everything you wanted me to do! Now keep your promises! Free Lisa and open the bridge!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002864
Reply.text: Yes, we will do that. But first, one last errand.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002865
Reply.text: It better really be the last one!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002866
Reply.text: We found out that the locals were going to steal boat engine parts from us, put them on their boats, and swim to a big warship that ran aground near Severka. We mined that ship and trapped the remnants of the local resistance in it. I thought it would be symbolic if you pressed the detonator button.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002867
Reply.text: What?! Are you serious?! I have enough trouble deciding to kill unarmed and innocent people, and now you want me to drown them?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002868
Reply.text: If you are at war, fight to the last man. Only then will you see your friend and the road to the mountains. Now go.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002869
Reply.text: [What a bastard...]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002883
Reply.text: Greetings, fellow traveler! Come in, make yourself at home!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002887
Reply.text: Thank you! Very unexpected to hear such words, because in all the time of my travels I am used to rudeness and distrust, and here is such a welcome!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002888
Reply.text: We don't judge people by their appearance or their past actions; we only care about your current attitude toward us. And so far we have nothing to reproach you for.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002889
Reply.text: I'm glad to hear that. I think I've finally found some normal people.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002890
Reply.text: I saw that you came from Lidencloud. I haven't heard from them for a long time. Tell me, if you don't mind, how are things there?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002891
Reply.text: Bad. Some Red Torch Adepts attacked the locals and blocked the bridge, so none of them could get here. I had to intervene in the conflict by taking the side of...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002892
Reply.text: Don't say another word! Like I said, we're not interested in your past actions. Everyone who comes here starts his life with a clean slate, discarding his past.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002893
Reply.text: Okay. |I would like to ask the wise men a question. I need to find one thing, and they can help me a lot.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002894
Reply.text: Our wise men can do anything. But will they help you? It's only up to them. Go to Volozh, that's where they live.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002895
Reply.text: Thank you for your help.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002884
Reply.text: Hello, dear guest.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002896
Reply.text: Hello. I would like to talk to some of the wise men.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002897
Reply.text: Some wise man is standing in front of you. What do you want to know?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002898
Reply.text: I am looking for a composite, and I have information that one person was able to find one here in this lands.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002899
Reply.text: Well, we do have the necessary ore, and we are indeed ready to smelt it for you. But in order to do that, you have to prove that your intentions are pure.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002900
Reply.text: Okay, I need this material in order to...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002901
Reply.text: No, no, no, I'm not interested in what you need it for. I only want you to prove that your intentions are pure, and that can only be proved through your ability to help.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002902
Reply.text: I don't quite understand...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002903
Reply.text: Help the three inhabitants of these lands, and then come back here for one last challenge. If you pass, we will give you this material.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002904
Reply.text: I get it now. Which inhabitants need my help?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002905
Reply.text: You have to find people who need help yourself. Try asking around the surrounding villages.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002906
Reply.text: All right.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002907
Reply.text: You go ahead, and I'll stay here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002908
Reply.text: Don't you want to take part in exploring this area? That doesn't sound like you...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002909
Reply.text: I don't know, I feel so good here... Such nice people... I have an overwhelming desire to stay here... Forever...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002910
Reply.text: Lisa, are you okay?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002911
Reply.text: Y-yeah, everything is just fine...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002912
Reply.text: All right, you stay here, and I'll try to finish up quickly. It seems like being in this place for a long time is not good for you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002967
Reply.text: It is good to see you again, stranger. Your generous assistance to the people of our land has not escaped my eyes, and now you have one last challenge to face.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002968
Reply.text: I'm ready.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002969
Reply.text: To the north, there is an underground tunnel that leads to Lidencloud. I will give you a key with which you can open it. It will take you inside the locked train station, which you can also open with this key. Then activate the remote control and press the green button. The rest is up to you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002970
Reply.text: Let's see what the challenge is.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002973
Reply.text: You're back.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002974
Reply.text: I have finished all the errands of the wise men except the last one, for which I will have to go to Lidencloud. Will you come with me, or will you stay here?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002975
Reply.text: I... I don't know. I really want to stay here as long as possible, it's so nice here...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002977
Reply.text: No, it's not right! This place is unnatural! It's like it's erasing my memories! Get me out of here! If I stay here any longer, I'll go crazy for sure!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002978
Reply.text: Strangely, I don't feel anything like that. Nevertheless, odd things are happening here. All right, get in a cab and let's get out of here.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002979
Reply.text: Hello, fellow traveler! Is there anything you want to know?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002980
Reply.text: Yes. Were there any cars that passed through town in the last few days to the northeast?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002981
Reply.text: Let me remember. I think Tikhomir passed in that direction two days ago, but I didn't see him coming back. I was like, "Why the hell would he want to go there, there's nothing but an abandoned farmhouse," but I didn't think much of it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002982
Reply.text: Thanks, I'll check out this farm.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002983
Reply.text: Hello again, fellow traveler! Our council was very impressed with your passage through the Labyrinth. You now know our history and are considered a full member of our community. During your journey, we melted the necessary amount of composite for you. It will be loaded into your truck shortly.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002984
Reply.text: Thank you, of course, but you could have warned me that the last challenge was deadly dangerous!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002985
Reply.text: Life, death... These are just relative concepts. How can you know if you are living now or not?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002986
Reply.text: What do you mean? Well, here I am, alive! I breathe, I talk to you, I influence events in the world.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002987
Reply.text: So that's what "life" is to you? That's interesting. Very interesting.|The composite has just been loaded into your car. Now you can leave these lands with a clear mind and continue your journey. At first I thought you were an ordinary pilgrim, but it seems that fate has something more in store for you. Good luck on your journey! I hope you succeed where others have failed.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002988
Reply.text: I don't quite understand what you're talking about, but thanks for the wishes. And for the composite. Now I have to go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003058
Reply.text: If you don't mind, stop by farmer Hieronymus' house before you leave. Perhaps his problem might interest you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003059
Reply.text: I will.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003174
Reply.text: Hello, fellow traveler! Is there anything you want to know?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003175
Reply.text: Felix?! You?! Here?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003176
Reply.text: Yes, I'm Felix. And who are you?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003177
Reply.text: Don't you remember me?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003178
Reply.text: No, should I?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003179
Reply.text: How's that? Krai, Glukhoe, Lisa... You and me on the road...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003180
Reply.text: Oh, you must be talking about my past deeds and actions.|In that case, I must disappoint you: as soon as I came here, all my previous actions ceased to be important. I have renounced my past and live in harmony with the world, and I wish you the same, fellow traveler.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003181
Reply.text: Well, no, there's definitely something wrong with this place... Okay, in that case, can you tell me if any unknown cars have passed through town in the last few days?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003182
Reply.text: Let me remember. I think Tikhomir passed in that direction two days ago, but I didn't see him coming back. I was like, "Why the hell would he want to go there, there's nothing but an abandoned farmhouse," but I didn't think much of it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003183
Reply.text: Thanks, I'll check out this farm.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003385
Reply.text: Anything else?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003386
Reply.text: Are you sure you don't remember me?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003387
Reply.text: Young man, if I've done you any harm in the past, I'm sorry. But it has nothing to do with me now. I can only offer you my deepest apologies and assure you that it will never happen again.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003388
Reply.text: Wow, even a bandit can change for the better... Miracles do happen, even in our world. Okay, good luck with your new life.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003389
Reply.text: All the same to you, good man.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003390
Reply.text: And I'm going to go check out that farm.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002885
Reply.text: Hello, traveler! Make yourself at home!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002913
Reply.text: Greetings. One of the wise men ordered me to help each of the towns near Volozh.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002914
Reply.text: So that's how it is... Well, we never ask for help ourselves, but we never refuse help offered. In fact, you can help us.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002915
Reply.text: What do I have to do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002916
Reply.text: Our town is the only industrial center in the county. Until recently, it supplied a variety of products to every single settlement, but that's all changed now.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002917
Reply.text: What happened?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002918
Reply.text: The city of La Belle has stopped supplying us with the raw materials they used to mine, and without the raw materials our factories are absolutely useless.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002919
Reply.text: Why did it stop supplying you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002920
Reply.text: I don't know that. As I said before, we never ask for help ourselves.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002921
Reply.text: I see. All right, I'll go and look what's happened there.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002927
Reply.text: Did you find out what happened?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002928
Reply.text: Yes. There was a mine collapse, all the men died, leaving only the women alone with some Hermits.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002929
Reply.text: Well, bad things happen sometimes. I assume you helped them solve all their problems?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002930
Reply.text: Yes, I did what I could. And I brought some raw materials for you so that your factories could start working again.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002931
Reply.text: Wonderful news! Now you have helped our town, too. I will send a messenger to Volozh right now to inform the Supreme Wise Man about it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002932
Reply.text: Great, two of three towns done. There's only one left.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002886
Reply.text: Good day, traveler!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002922
Reply.text: Same to you. One of the wise men told me to help the settlements around here. I heard that you had stopped supplying raw materials to Rinolsk, and I came here to find out what had happened.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002923
Reply.text: A great sorrow has occurred! All of our men working in the sweat of the mines were killed. The piers collapsed and they were all buried under the rubble. Until we clear the rubble, we can't deliver metal to Rinolsk.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002924
Reply.text: Can I help you with that somehow?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002925
Reply.text: Yes. We never ask for help ourselves, but we never refuse help offered. It's hard to ask you this, but could you go down there, clear the rubble with these explosives, and bring their bodies to the surface? We'd do it ourselves, but the hermits won't let us relax even for a minute. As soon as we're about to leave the village, they always attack us.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002926
Reply.text: All right, I'll help you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002933
Reply.text: You're back already...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002934
Reply.text: Yes, I've done everything. Now the entrance to the mine is free, I lifted the bodies of the workers. It would be better to bury them properly, they should not lie by the elevator like that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002935
Reply.text: Don't worry about that, we'll do it. Yes, we'll do it right now. And you stay in the village and protect it from the hermits. They won't miss their chance to take advantage of our absence.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002936
Reply.text: Okay, I can do that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002937
Reply.text: We'll leave a couple of fighters behind to support you. And never mind that they are women: they can shoot better than all the local men put together!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002938
Reply.text: Thanks, I could use the help!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002939
Reply.text: Thank you, fellow traveler, for everything!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002940
Reply.text: You're welcome. And who were those people who attacked you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002941
Reply.text: I can't tell you that; you'd better ask in Volozh. The wise men will decide for themselves whether to share this information with you or not.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002942
Reply.text: Okay, maybe I will...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002943
Reply.text: Here, take it - we brought some ore from our husbands' last shift. Take it to Rinolsk; it's not right for such large factories to stand idle. And we'll tell the Supreme Wise Man that you helped us.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002944
Reply.text: Goodbye, good luck to you!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002945
Reply.text: My respects, fellow traveler! What are you looking for in our village?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002946
Reply.text: Looking for people who need help.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002947
Reply.text: Well, we never ask for...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002948
Reply.text: Yeah-yeah, I've heard that before. So does anyone need help?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002949
Reply.text: Yes. We always need it. Go to that house over there and ask Vsevolod, he'll tell you everything.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002950
Reply.text: Okay, thank you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002951
Reply.text: Welcome, dear guest, make yourself at home. My home is your home.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002952
Reply.text: Thank you. I heard that you need help.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002953
Reply.text: Yes. We never ask for help ourselves...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002954
Reply.text: [How many times have I heard that already? Do they memorize this phrase by heart or what?!]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002955
Reply.text: ...but we never refuse help offered. My only daughter, Dobroslava, is missing. A few days ago she went for a walk with her boyfriend and never came back.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002956
Reply.text: It looks like a deliberate kidnapping, but I don't know the area very well yet. Any idea where they might have gone?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002957
Reply.text: Absolutely none at all. However, along with Dobroslava is also missing my old map of the area, which shows the exits, which are now no longer exist.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002958
Reply.text: So I'll check those exits first. Can you show me on the map where they are located?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002959
Reply.text: Sure. Here, here and here. And this is the one that's working, which is probably how you got here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002960
Reply.text: Okay, this is interesting. Two of them are very close, but to get to the third one, you have to go through Volozh. I'll start with the first two.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002961
Reply.text: Good luck!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002962
Reply.text: You too. [Strange man... His daughter was kidnapped, and he doesn't even bother... Anyway, it's none of my business.]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002963
Reply.text: Have you found my daughter?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003250
Reply.text: I'm sorry, but I didn't make it in time. I followed them all the way to Lidencloud, but then I lost them. I'm not sure I could find them in the current post-war devastation.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003251
Reply.text: So Dobroslava has left us. I'll report it to Volozh. And that you helped me, too.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003252
Reply.text: Helped?! But I didn't even...|Well, all right then. Good luck to you. It's time for me to have a word with the Supreme Wise Man.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002964
Reply.text: Yes, there she is, safe and sound.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002965
Reply.text: Thank you so much! I'll be sure to let Volozh know how you helped me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002966
Reply.text: Wait, aren't you curious about what happened to the kidnapper?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002989
Reply.text: And why would I want to know about it when everything is already back to normal?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002990
Reply.text: Well, as you wish. Now it's time for me to have a word with the Supreme Wise Man.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003017
Reply.text: Hello, traveler. Would you like to buy a detailed map of the surrounding lands from me? Only 25000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003019
Reply.text: Not now.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003018
Reply.text: Sure. Here's the money.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003060
Reply.text: Hello, fellow traveler!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003061
Reply.text: Greetings. Are you Hieronymus?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003062
Reply.text: Yes, Hieronymus is me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003063
Reply.text: I was told that something happened to you. Something very interesting.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003064
Reply.text: That's right. We never ask for help ourselves, but we never refuse help offered. Something bad has happened to my fields...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003065
Reply.text: I've dealt with this kind of thing before. Believe me, you're not the first to be affected.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003066
Reply.text: And what should I do about it?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003068
Reply.text: I don't know. I said your problem is not unique, but I have no idea how to help you. So long.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003067
Reply.text: Nothing. I'll take care of it myself. I know who and where to report it to. Show me where your fields are.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003069
Reply.text: Right here. For once I decided to plant winter crops, and here it is...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003070
Reply.text: Let's see what it is this time.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003303
Reply.text: Hey, kid, don't pass by. Help a good man!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003304
Reply.text: Well, if you are really a good man, I'm listening.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003305
Reply.text: You see, the thing is, I have a vital need for one aggregate that I'm missing a few parts for.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003306
Reply.text: Do you need money to buy them?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003307
Reply.text: No! All these parts are there, well, I mean, I don't have them, but they exist...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003308
Reply.text: Are you suggesting that I steal them from someone?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003309
Reply.text: Why are you in such a hurry? You don't have to buy or steal anything. I'll just tell you where the parts are, and you'll find them and bring them to me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003310
Reply.text: Why don't you go get them yourself? Do I look like an errand boy?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003311
Reply.text: Have mercy, good man! My eyes are no longer the same, legs are no longer walking and the truck is falling apart - what would I do in the dazzling mountain snow?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003313
Reply.text: It's all too weird, I'm not going to be a part of it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003312
Reply.text: I have a feeling that you're not telling me the whole truth. But all right, I'll bring you what you're asking for. Where can I find your parts?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003314
Reply.text: Give me your map, I'll show you. Here, here and here. But these are just approximate directions - they're pretty well hidden, so you have to look harder there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003315
Reply.text: Hidden?! What the?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003316
Reply.text: Well, it's time for me to go! Good luck, young man!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003317
Reply.text: Oh, I wish I had known that beforehand...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003318
Reply.text: So? Did you find them?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003319
Reply.text: I did. Here, take it. I don't know why you need them, and I don't want to know actually, but tell the Supreme Wise Man that I helped you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003320
Reply.text: S-s-supreme Wise Man? M-maybe I can do something else?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003321
Reply.text: What's the problem? I knew I shouldn't have gotten into this!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003322
Reply.text: There's no problem at all! It's just that our Supreme, how should I put it... He doesn't tolerate idleness. Some people put up with it, but I'm not one of them!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003323
Reply.text: So that " aggregate" that you vitally needed was...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003324
Reply.text: Exactly! The ananaga moonshiner! Not long ago there was a rumor that I am making the best ananaga in Rinolsk, and the Supreme himself came here and raided my place. I got cold feet at that time and hid the main parts in various places under cover of night. I drank a couple of bottles to get my courage up, and the next morning I realized that I had absolutely no memory of where I had hidden them.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003325
Reply.text: That's why you decided to lie to an unsuspecting stranger.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003326
Reply.text: I am ashamed, my dear friend, very ashamed! But this passion is stronger than I am. So, may I ask you not to denounce me to the Supreme?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003329
Reply.text: No way! First you make me search waist-deep in the snow for your scrap, and now you dare ask me to silently tolerate it? The Supreme Wise Man will know about this immediately!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003340
Reply.text: Please, have mercy...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003341
Reply.text: Don't even think about it. Better go and hide your parts again while you still have time.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003328
Reply.text: I won't tell anyone about this, don't worry.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003338
Reply.text: Thank you very much!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003339
Reply.text: So long.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003327
Reply.text: Maybe. Especially since I have an interesting suggestion for you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003330
Reply.text: I'm listening.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003331
Reply.text: It happens that during my long journey I have acquired two rather interesting recipes. Would you mind taking a look?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003332
Reply.text: Let me see...|My goodness! That's what I've been missing all these years - a decent recipe and the peculiarities of aging. Do you have any idea what kind of elixir we would get if we'll combine your recipes with my "resting" method?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003333
Reply.text: Resting? It's a little early for me to rest, you know.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003334
Reply.text: No, no, you don't understand! The "resting" of the alcohol. First the cooking, then the aging, and then the most important stage, the "resting". You have no idea what resting in the icy snow on one of the slopes here can do to even a mediocre ananaga, and if we cook everything according to your recipes... Man, that would be my magnum opus!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003335
Reply.text: Sounds perfect. What do I need to do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003336
Reply.text: Absolutely nothing, I'll take care of everything myself. You do your own thing, and I'll give you the bottle when it's ready.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003337
Reply.text: Well, good. I hope you don't deceive me.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003342
Reply.text: Finally, I knew I'd find you here!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003343
Reply.text: It's already done? So fast?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003344
Reply.text: Yeah, it's done. But why so fast? It's been months!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003345
Reply.text: Hold on, what?! Months?! But...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003346
Reply.text: Well, yes, a few months. Seventy-three days, to be exact.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003347
Reply.text: I can't get my head around it... But I came here a few days ago...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003348
Reply.text: And they say I'm the one who drinks too much! All right, man, don't worry so much. What difference does it make: a day, a month, a year? It's all nonsense! Take the bottle, though.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003349
Reply.text: Oh, yes, of course. Thank you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003350
Reply.text: Thank you! I'll remember until the end of time how you have helped me, both with the parts and with the recipes. Well, good luck to you!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003351
Reply.text: You too.|A few months... It can't be...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003352
Reply.text: Anything else?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003353
Reply.text: Yes, I was in Rinolsk and a worker there asked me to help him to assemble an ananaga moonshiner.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003354
Reply.text: I knew that he is still doing it! You didn't help him, did you?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003355
Reply.text: Unfortunately, I did. When he asked me to get him these parts, he did not say a word about their true purpose.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003356
Reply.text: What a liar! But, honestly, I expected something like that from him. Thank you, fellow traveler. I'll go to Rinolsk immediately and resolve this issue drastically.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003357
Reply.text: No problem. I don't like to be taken for a fool.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003253
Reply.text: What to do?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003255
Reply.text: Kill Tikhomir and bring Dobroslava home.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003254
Reply.text: Let Tikhomir and Dobroslava go.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N01
Reply.text: Come in, make yourself comfortable. We have a very long conversation ahead of us.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N02
Reply.text: Give me one good reason why I shouldn't kill you right now! Tell me what happened to Ivan! Why did you attack him in Minin? And why did you burn down his house in Hel? And why the hell did you pretend to be a merchant in Sowth? Answer me!

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N03
Reply.text: I understand your indignation, but you don't have to yell. I'll tell you everything, I promise. But first, can I ask you to drive forward a little bit and look at one thing?

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N04
Reply.text: How dare you?!

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N05
Reply.text: Trust me, it will make our conversation a lot easier. Please. I'll wait for you here.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N06
Reply.text: It better be something really important.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N01
Reply.text: Well, now you've seen everything.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N02
Reply.text: What is this place?

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N03
Reply.text: If you don't mind, I'll start this story from the beginning. A long time ago, at the very end of 2011, on December 31st, the Gadad City Military Command Center detected an unidentified flying object slowly approaching our planet. After a short meeting, the leadership of the center decided to launch a missile strike on the object.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N04
Reply.text: But there was no urgent need for such an aggressive reaction!

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N05
Reply.text: The situation in the region at that time was very tense: it was dangerous to be in that country because of the fight against terrorists, so at that time such a reaction seemed the most justified step. But we were wrong at the time. We were very badly mistaken.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N06
Reply.text: What happened?

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N07
Reply.text: As soon as the downed object hit the ground, the most developed nations sent their research teams to the crash site. When they managed to get inside the alien ship - and it was undoubtedly the alien ship - there was euphoria. What prospects awaited us: new medicines, heavy-duty materials, revolutionary technology ... But all we found was death.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N08
Reply.text: I think I'm starting to understand.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N09
Reply.text: Workers died under the wheels of machinery, three leading scientists committed suicide in two days of research. But the worst thing happened when they opened the sealed chamber in the central compartment...

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N10
Reply.text: They shouldn't have done that. How can they ignore such clear warning signals?!

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N11
Reply.text: They are scientists. Superstitions are not for them. I'll continue: apparently, the automatic system that had been asleep up to that point turned on. Something unimaginable began to happen: the scientists' bodies literally exploded, and a strange humming sound was heard in other people's heads. Many died, and those who survived later woke up in this camp. The radio was silent. Then they realized that a disaster had occurred.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N12
Reply.text: So some bunch of people ruined the whole world just to satisfy their curiosity?!

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N13
Reply.text: What's done is done. There is no going back.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N14
Reply.text: Wait, how do you know all this? After all, these were all events of two hundred years ago!

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N15
Reply.text: I'm not the first person to have been to this camp. And I am sure that I won't be the last. I have reconstructed these events from the documents and records of the people who were here at that terrible time.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N16
Reply.text: But then what are you doing here? And who are these people standing in front of the ship?

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N17
Reply.text: And here we come to the most interesting part. As you've noticed, you're not the only one who's been searching for the truth in this cursed place. There have been many brave and courageous people here before you, but they were all taken by the "Overlord".

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N19
Reply.text: That's how I call this fallen monster. We gotta call it somehow, right? I don't know how it works, but it literally burns your brain out. Once you get close to the ship, you can't control yourself. Your body doesn't listen to you, you stop having any physiological needs. And you just stand in front of that ship, unable to move and walk away. I've seen that a lot.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N22b
Reply.text: And Ivan... Was Ivan among them? Among those who were taken by that thing?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003079
Reply.text: Yeah, probably. So many people have been here that it's hard to remember them all.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003080
Reply.text: You're lying! You know exactly who is Ivan! Why else would you have attacked Minin and burned down the house in Hel?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003081
Reply.text: Don't overestimate the importance of your father. I was just covering his tracks so that no one else could get here using his notes. That's what I always do. I don't want this thing to consume any more human souls.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003082
Reply.text: But I never said Ivan was my father!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003083
Reply.text: Well... Um... Believe me, it was very easy to guess. Who else would a man like you cross halfway around the world for? Only a close relative, most likely a father. You don't have to be smart to figure that out.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003084
Reply.text: What about the attack on Glukhoe? Was it your order?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003085
Reply.text: It was my mistake, not my order. The madmen you fought before I came along sometimes have uncontrollable fits of aggression. Sometimes so intense that they might even cross the desert in their impulse. I have power over them, and I always turn them back before they've done anything bad. But this time I just didn't get there in time.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003086
Reply.text: And why did you have to pretend to be a trader in the Sowth?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003087
Reply.text: It was much easier to control the situation around the Desert and prevent the spread of information about the Overlord. You know perfectly well that the publicity of such details would have the most unpredictable consequences.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003088
Reply.text: I find that very hard to believe. But your words do make sense.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003089
Reply.text: I see you're out of questions.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003090
Reply.text: There's only one left. Why am I talking to you now, and not standing with my brain scorched by this ship? You told me that no one had ever escaped its influence.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003091
Reply.text: No one. Until today. I don't know what it is about you that makes you so special, but you can resist the Overlord! That's the furthest we've ever gone!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003093
Reply.text: I mean the human race as a whole.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003094
Reply.text: But you're here now, too. And there's nothing wrong with your mind. So I'm not the only one after all.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003095
Reply.text: There's one problem: I can't get too far away from this place. Hel was my maximum. And even now, I probably can't even get to the Krai anymore. Once I get too far away, I begin to weaken and experience the same symptoms as when I get too close. Once again, I don't know how it works, but in my case, it's the opposite. While the Overlord destroys other people at once, he's put a sort of leash on me. I exist comfortably next to him, but become weaker when I leave his sphere of influence.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003096
Reply.text: So that's how it is...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003097
Reply.text: So it turns out that you're still the only person who can resist him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003098
Reply.text: What do I do now? How can I stop a contagion entering the atmosphere? You've been in this place so long, you must have some kind of plan by now!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003099
Reply.text: We don't have many options. Either shut off the source of the contagion, as you put it, or destroy it. But neither you nor I don't have the resources to do that.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003100
Reply.text: But I know who does. It's time to pay another visit to the Oracle.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003167
Reply.text: Wait! Here, take this - it's a duplicate of the device you used to activate the Sea Gate in different parts of the world. I don't need it anyway, but you obviously will.|By the way, it was very noble of you to give it to that engineer from Kef.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003169
Reply.text: What?! How do you know about that?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003402
Reply.text: This is my lands, after all. It is my duty to know what goes on here.|Be careful. And may you be successful where others have failed. It's unlikely that we'll see each other again.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003101
Reply.text: Be careful. And may you be successful where others have failed. It's unlikely that we'll see each other again.

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_CrazyBook1_1_N01
Reply.text: Foreigner! You have not yielded to the great call, so I want to give you one thing.

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_CrazyBook1_1_N02
Reply.text: What's the great call? What's this thing?

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_CrazyBook1_1_N03
Reply.text: Quick! They are watching. This is the last copy of the book that tells us what is happening to our world...

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_CrazyBook1_1_N04
Reply.text: Stop, you madman! Where are you running...

Reply.name: r4_Racers_Men_1_N01
Reply.text: Today is the ultra-fast car championship. Anyone can take part!

Reply.name: r4_Racers_Men_1_N02b
Reply.text: I'm not interested.

Reply.name: r4_Racers_Men_1_N02a
Reply.text: I'd like to participate.

Reply.name: r4_Racers_Men_1_N03a
Reply.text: You have to pay a fee of 10000 coins, of which 5000 is the deposit for the car.

Reply.name: r4_Racers_Men_1_N04aa
Reply.text: What car? What are you talking about?

Reply.name: r4_Racers_Men_1_N05aa
Reply.text: We'll give you an expensive race car, and if you wreck it, we'll cover out repairment cost from the deposit.

Reply.name: r4_Racers_Men_1_N06aac
Reply.text: I don't have that much money.

Reply.name: r4_Racers_Men_1_N06aab
Reply.text: Nah... I am not satisfied with such terms.

Reply.name: r4_Racers_Men_1_N06aaa
Reply.text: Great, I'm in.

Reply.name: r4_Racers_Men_1_N07aaa
Reply.text: The rules are: false start - you lose, crashed the car - you lose. 1st place: 40000, 2nd place: 20000, 3rd place: 10000. At the end of the race we return the deposit for the car without repairment cost, so do not complain if you do not get all your money back.

Reply.name: r4_Racers_Men_1_N08aaa
Reply.text: I got it. LET'S GO!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002580
Reply.text: Oh, you made it to the desert already! Things are going pretty fast, I can't even keep up with you.
Reply.scriptCondition: IsQuestComplete('r4m1_KNO_BringOil') and IsQuestComplete('MrShlyapa3_Quest') and GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() == 0 and not(QuestStatus('r4m2_TalkWithScientific')==Q_COMPLETED)

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002581
Reply.text: I've seen you so often in the last times that I'm not even surprised anymore.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002582
Reply.text: I'm glad to hear it, it means that soon we will finally be able to talk.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002583
Reply.text: What's stopping you from talking now?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002584
Reply.text: You're not ready yet. But you will be very soon. You know what to do - give me the map. Go to this place and look at the very top.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002585
Reply.text: I'm starting to get tired of it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002586
Reply.text: Stop whining, that's the last thing I'm asking you to do. I won't be able to accompany you from here, so you'll have to do this on your own. And if all goes well, we will finally talk. Now, I must take my leave.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002587
Reply.text: Just tell me what’s going on here!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003359
Reply.text: And yet he’s not real. Yeah, well, he can’t be real. Nonsense.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003032
Reply.text: Hello, traveler. Would you like to buy a detailed map of the surrounding lands from me? Only 30000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003034
Reply.text: Not now.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003033
Reply.text: Sure. Here's the money.

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_npc_000007
Reply.text: What have we done to you, stranger? Why are you following us?

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_pl_000008
Reply.text: I didn't mean to kill you, I want answers! A few weeks ago you crossed the desert, attacked a defenseless village, and killed all its inhabitants! I want to know who ordered you to do such a thing!

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_npc_000009
Reply.text: Calm down, brother. We don't touch anyone, we fight the madmen who destroy our cities. We don't care about our distant neighbors!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002408
Reply.text: I have a witness of the attack who saw your car at the scene of the crime! You were there!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002409
Reply.text: I don't understand... Me? But I never left the desert... That village... The screams, the flames... And the blood... But it was a dream. Yes, it couldn't have been real! It was just a bad dream. Only madmen are real. You are one of them. Prepare to die!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002410
Reply.text: I will gladly terminate your worthless existence!

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_N01
Reply.text: We are glad to see you in our beautiful city, dear guests! What can I do for you?

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_P02
Reply.text: Dear guests?! Didn't your troops open fire on us near the city?!

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_N03
Reply.text: What are you talking about? We always welcome guests and never allow ourselves unwarranted aggression. That's why the gardens and fountains of our glorious city have been praised by the greatest poets!

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_P04
Reply.text: But there are no gardens or fountains...

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_N05
Reply.text: Argh!!! It is the vicious rakshases who raid our dwellings, destroying everything in their path! Almost every single day we have to repel their attacks! That is why we have no time to keep the cultural monuments in proper condition. What a pity...

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_P06
Reply.text: Is that why you attacked me? Because you thought I was one of them?

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_N07
Reply.text: What? What are you talking about? We're always happy to have visitors! Have you seen the central fountain? If you haven't, you must see it, it's indescribably beautiful!

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_P08
Reply.text: [What the hell is going on here?! All right, I'd better get straight to the point.]|May I ask you about the events of twenty years ago?

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_N09
Reply.text: Why are you interested in the past when there's a wonderful present?

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_P10
Reply.text: And yet, can you remember a person who passed through these lands twenty years ago?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002357
Reply.text: We don't keep records of newcomers, we don't need to. Only elders could help you, but they're all gone.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002359
Reply.text: I don't know... Try asking at Kef, it's further down the road.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002360
Reply.text: Okay, thank you for that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002353
Reply.text: This place creeps me out.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002354
Reply.text: I'm also worried. Everyone here seems strange.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002355
Reply.text: What town did he talk about? Kef? Let's get over there. I don't want to stay here too long.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002356
Reply.text: Of course. You don't have to ask me twice.

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N01
Reply.text: Good afternoon, traveler! What are you looking for in this faraway land?

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N02
Reply.text: Greetings! A man from Gadad told me that I could find the answer to my question here.

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N03
Reply.text: Well, since our friends in Gadad think so, I'd love to help you. What's on your mind?

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N04
Reply.text: There was a man, Ivan, who visited your country many years ago. He didn't come home, and we're very concerned about that. Is there anyone in your town who remembers times past?

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N05
Reply.text: Sadly, no. Our elders, the memory keepers, got together one day and just left in an unknown direction. We are trying to find them, but so far without success.

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N06
Reply.text: Why did they leave you?

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N07
Reply.text: Because of war. The constant attacks have exhausted us, made us forget about beauty and reverence for our ancestors. Now all our energies go into surviving.|But is it worth living when beauty is gone? You've hurt my soul, stranger!

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N08
Reply.text: Who are you at war with?

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N09
Reply.text: With the goddamn rakshases from Gadad, they won't let us make a step without a fight!

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N10
Reply.text: But... I thought you have peaceful relations with Gadad, they sent me to you...

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N11
Reply.text: With Gadad? Of course, we're very good friends! And I really hope it stays that way forever.

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N12
Reply.text: [This conversation is starting to scare me, and I need to end it as soon as possible, before he decides to finish me and Lisa off as well.]

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N13
Reply.text: In any case, we are constantly sending expeditions in search of our elders and have had considerable success in doing so. One of our expeditions should return soon. While we wait, could you help us in our trouble?

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1_N13a
Reply.text: [I have a feeling in my heart that I should not refuse him.]|I'll do everything I can. What happened?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002361
Reply.text: Oil is literally our blood. Without it, the machines will stop working and we will be defenseless against attackers!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002362
Reply.text: It's hard to argue with that. I assume something happened to your oil?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002363
Reply.text: The source of the precious liquid has dried up! Until recently, we were supplied by the people of Kazif, but no one dares to go there anymore: it has become too dangerous to leave the city walls.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002364
Reply.text: So you want me to bring you a tanker of oil?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002365
Reply.text: Yes. We'll give you a tanker truck, while your car will be safely parked here..

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002366
Reply.text: I need to think about it. Give me a few minutes.

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_2_N01
Reply.text: You brought us oil after all!

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_2_N02
Reply.text: "After all"?

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_2_N03
Reply.text: Lever mind...|Yeah, everything is fine... Completely fine...

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_2_N04
Reply.text: Well, has your expedition returned?

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_2_N05
Reply.text: Not yet.You'll have to wait a little longer.

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_2_N06
Reply.text: All right, if that's the case...

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_2_N07
Reply.text: What a misery! There's nothing we can do about the oil you brought in!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002381
Reply.text: Our only oil engineer had disappeared. And our equipment will not work on raw oil!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002382
Reply.text: Disappeared? For no reason and in broad daylight?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002383
Reply.text: Yes! Absolutely for no reason at all! Bring him back.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002384
Reply.text: Me? Don't you think it would be much easier for one of the locals to convince him to come back?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002385
Reply.text: No way. He won't even listen to us.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002386
Reply.text: It's kind of weird. All right, I'll try to search for him.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002387
Reply.text: He was last seen near the village of Alikham.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002388
Reply.text: I'll talk to him, but I don't promise anything.

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1a_N01
Reply.text: You dare to do that? Will you bring us oil?

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_1a_N02
Reply.text: Yes, I will. What truck were you talking about?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003001
Reply.text: It is already prepared and parked on the left side of town. You can leave your car there as well.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003002
Reply.text: All right.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002367
Reply.text: What are you up to?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002368
Reply.text: Lisa, just calm down.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002369
Reply.text: I am calm. I'm as calm as nobody else in this goddamn place. It's your tone that worries me. So what are you up to?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002370
Reply.text: Lisa. I understand that you feel uncomfortable about this long ride, and the desert, as you said, "is crushing your mind"...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002371
Reply.text: Get to the point, why are you beating around the bush!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002372
Reply.text: I want you to stay in town and watch for my car.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002373
Reply.text: No. Out of the question!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002374
Reply.text: Lisa, listen...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002375
Reply.text: No way! I won't stay alone surrounded by these madmen!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002376
Reply.text: Lisa! Think straight! They'll give me a light-armed truck at most. And I'll leave you here in my heavily armed vehicle. You know how to drive and shoot. Just think, if something happens, where will you be safer? My car or theirs?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002377
Reply.text: Yeah... yeah... It'll probably be safer...|Please come back soon!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002378
Reply.text: Sure. I'll try not to stay too long.

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Man1_1_N01
Reply.text: What are you looking for?

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Man1_1_N02
Reply.text: Did an oil engineer from Kef come through here?

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Man1_1_N03
Reply.text: He did. Just a few minutes ago. He was kind of strange, disheveled.

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Man1_1_N04
Reply.text: Where did he go?

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Man1_1_N05
Reply.text: Further down the road.

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N01
Reply.text: I beg you, don't hurt me!

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N02
Reply.text: Why would I hurt you?

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N03
Reply.text: How should I know why people torture and kill each other! Leave me alone!

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N04
Reply.text: What happened to you?

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N05
Reply.text: I saw their true nature...|No... I won't say anything!

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N06
Reply.text: This fellow seems to have lost his mind. I'll have to bring him back like that, though I don't think he can help the people of Kef.

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N07
Reply.text: You wouldn't dare! Let me go! I want to know if there are any living people left in the world. If not, there's no point in me fighting. But I won't go back to them! I won't go back!

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N07a
Reply.text: So I have to use force.

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N08a
Reply.text: Better to die!

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N09a
Reply.text: Then so be it!

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N07b
Reply.text: Tell me, what happened to you?

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N08b
Reply.text: A terrible truth has been revealed to me. I'm not sure I can live with this knowledge. No, I cannot bear it! Everything is a lie!

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N09b
Reply.text: I am not quite sure what you mean, but you seem to have realized that there is something strange going on with the locals, too.| Do you know a place to hide?

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N10b
Reply.text: Yes, I know an unremarkable place. It's right here.

Reply.name: r4m1_SomeWhere_Engineer_1_N11b
Reply.text: Go there and hide. As soon as I find a way to get you out of here, I'll come back for you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002379
Reply.text: Thank you. But your kindness is suspicious... What if you're as insane as they are?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002380
Reply.text: I understand your worries, but in this case you'll just have to take my word for it. Anyway, you don't have much of a choice. When I find the best way for you to escape, I'll be there. If I don't find you there, you're on your own.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002411
Reply.text: You're finally back!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002412
Reply.text: You have to hurry, time is limited! Take this device, go to the port, and use it to summon a boat to take you from here to other lands.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002413
Reply.text: I can't believe how lucky I am!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002414
Reply.text: Can you get to the port yourself?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002415
Reply.text: Yes, I know some secret trails. Thank you, good man.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002416
Reply.text: It's too early to thank.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002417
Reply.text: Will you come with me?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002418
Reply.text: No, I have some unfinished business here.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002419
Reply.text: Whatever you're up to, be careful!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002420
Reply.text: Yes. And so are you. Now get going before those madmen find you.

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_3_N01
Reply.text: I don't see an engineer with you, did you find him?

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_3_N02
Reply.text: Unfortunately, I couldn't get him back. He was so scared of something that he killed himself.

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_3_N03
Reply.text: I'm sad to hear about it... But I believe you did everything you could.

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_3_N04
Reply.text: So you will still tell me where to look for the elders?

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_3_N05
Reply.text: Yes, we have located their village. The elders are hiding from everyone on the coast. As soon as we've recovered from another attack, we'll send an expedition after them. It's not right for honorable people to huddle in huts!

Reply.name: Kef_Bar_Customer1_3_N06
Reply.text: Thank you, I will tell them your kind words.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002389
Reply.text: I have a confession to make.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002390
Reply.text: Right now? Can we talk about it on the road?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002391
Reply.text: No. Right now.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002392
Reply.text: All right, I'm listening.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002393
Reply.text: I never told you this, but I know who attacked your village.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003227
Reply.text: Yeah, you told me somehow that it was some nomadic bandits on unusual vehicles. If that's all you wanted...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002394
Reply.text: Yeah, Felix told me, that it was some nomadic bandits on unusual vehicles. If that's all you wanted...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002395
Reply.text: No, you don't understand. I know exactly who attacked your village. I saw this man and his car.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002396
Reply.text: You saw him? Where?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002397
Reply.text: Right here. Over there, you see?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002398
Reply.text: Yes. Are you sure it's him?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002399
Reply.text: Absolutely. I remember the unusual design of his car very well. And the cargo number. It's definitely him!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002400
Reply.text: What do you suggest? Kill him? I don't think that's a good idea.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002401
Reply.text: Not to kill, but to follow him. Don't you wonder who was behind this reckless attack? And why it was committed?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002402
Reply.text: Wouldn't it be better to go to the elders now and ask them about Ivan?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002403
Reply.text: What makes you so sure that the elders will tell you where to look for Ivan? That is the main question. And these murderers might know something! I don't think they just attacked your village for nothing.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002404
Reply.text: I agree, it's strange. But the option of following him is also very risky.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002405
Reply.text: I've already said it all. The choice is yours.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002407
Reply.text: I don't think it's worth it. Whoever they are, they were following somebody else's order, and I doubt they know anything about Ivan. Better go see the elders.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002406
Reply.text: You're right, the elders aren't going anywhere, and these guys can give us important information. Let's follow them.

Reply.name: Buhara_Outside_Leader_1_N01
Reply.text: They found us, run for your lives!

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_pl_000072
Reply.text: Hold on! I come in peace.

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_npc_000073
Reply.text: (To the side) He seems quite normal...|How did you find us?

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_pl_000074
Reply.text: A nice man from Kef pointed me in the right direction. He said a rescue expedition would be sent for you soon.

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_npc_000075
Reply.text: This moment has finally arrived. Brothers, we can no longer hide. We will fight and die if we have to.

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_pl_000076
Reply.text: What are you talking about? They are...

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_npc_000077
Reply.text: Don't you understand anything? I think we have a little more time. Come in and listen to our story.

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_pl_000078
Reply.text: Explain to me, at last, what is going on here?

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_npc_000079
Reply.text: Many years ago our region was a blooming garden. We recovered from the Catastrophe and began to rebuild our lives. Then we began to notice that people behaved strangely at times. Sometimes there was an insane joy in their eyes, and sometimes there was a black anger.

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_pl_000081
Reply.text: I think I'm starting to understand.

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_npc_000082
Reply.text: At first everyone kept their emotions in check, but one day it all came crashing down. A good man attacked his family and had no memory of it. He was executed, and fear settled in our hearts. It was no longer possible to trust the people closest to us. It was impossible to trust ourselves.

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_pl_000083
Reply.text: So there are no elusive bandits.

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_npc_000084
