Reply.text: That's how they fill up their ranks. They must have told you what a tough warrior you are and offered you the chance to become one of them.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz516
Reply.text: Yes... That's the way it was... They're not as simple as I thought.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz517
Reply.text: Unfortunately, we can't provide troops to support the operation. You'll operate alone.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz518
Reply.text: It's not my first time. Get my medals ready!

Reply.name: Senat_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Your progress against our common enemy have not gone unnoticed. By your successful actions you have disrupted the military plans of the bandits. The time has come to entrust you with a task that could turn the course of the war in our favor!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000432
Reply.text: Glad to try!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000433
Reply.text: Our spies report that dissatisfaction with the tyrant is growing in the enemy camp. Your task is to get in touch with the rebels and find out everything you can about the vulnerabilities of the enemy's defenses. We've been preparing for this for a long time. Do not fail us.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000434
Reply.text: I'll do it right! How will I find the rebels?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000435
Reply.text: Meet their contact in a Toskana bar. Password: "The night is long", recall: "But the dawn is near".

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000436
Reply.text: I remembered.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002131
Reply.text: If you manage to get him out of the clutches of the Crimson Dawn, take him to Tuzz, where I'll interrogate him myself.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002132
Reply.text: Yes, sir! I'm moving out right now!

Reply.name: Senat_hellodlg1
Reply.text: The rebel you rescued gave us very important information. One of Axel's generals will be passing through this place with a small guard. Capturing him alive will give us a source of valuable information about the enemy.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000438
Reply.text: He will be caught. But this operation will require a considerable military force.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000439
Reply.text: We had thought of that - military vehicles are already on their way to the place of the ambush. Once you capture the general, take him to Rotorsk, as there is a good chance that Helvetia and Tuzz will be attacked by Axel's best men, who would be tasked with freeing the general.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000440
Reply.text: It's nice to work with prudent people. I won't let you down.

Reply.name: Senat_hellodlg2
Reply.text: Truly, you have brought us luck, stranger. Not only did the general tell us how to get to Axel himself, bypassing the enemy defenses, but he also gave us the location and access codes to his underground city.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000442
Reply.text: I don't even want to think how you made him tell you that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000443
Reply.text: You don't need to. Now, while we distract the enemy, you will infiltrate enemy territory again to kill Axel. He's not likely to sit around waiting for us to get to him, so you'd better meet our agent in Toskana again. By the time you get there, he'll already have information about Axel's current whereabouts.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000444
Reply.text: Victory seems to be close at hand.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000445
Reply.text: Don't start celebrating prematurely. I'll draw a safe path on your map; it starts right here. Now you won't have to fight your way through Marezzia. Remember, the main thing is not to expose yourself. After the signal to start the operation, maintain radio silence.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000446
Reply.text: Let's do it!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003391
Reply.text: What will I choose?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003393
Reply.text: Attack alien invaders.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003392
Reply.text: Deliver the blocker.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002230
Reply.text: Well-well, people like you are a rarity in these lands. Usually people come here either to kill for money or for ideological reasons.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002235
Reply.text: Once again, I don't care about the local division of power, I just want...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002236
Reply.text: Yeah, I get it. Okay, you can relax. What kind of man are you looking for?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002237
Reply.text: There's a wayward lady who thinks she can put her own interests ahead of anyone else's. They say she's friends with a guy named Axel...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002238
Reply.text: Wow! You never cease to amaze me! Axel?! Seriously?! Well, I wish you the best of luck in your search!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002239
Reply.text: Is it that bad?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002240
Reply.text: Yeah, man, it couldn't be worse. Do you even know who Axel is?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002241
Reply.text: Enlight me.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002242
Reply.text: The head of one of the warring countries. You must have met his fighters when you came out of the tunnel. They told you what a great warrior you are, and offered to come and join them in Marezzia. Did they?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002243
Reply.text: They did... But you said "one of the warring countries". It's strange to hear that from a CIT citizen. Shouldn't you be agitating me to fight on your side?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002244
Reply.text: Oh, trust me, under different circumstances I'd tell you where you should put your childish ideas about war, but it wouldn't do any good...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002245
Reply.text: So you're not a patriot?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002246
Reply.text: Just the opposite. You haven't met a true patriot like me yet. And that's why I don't support this war. Neither does anyone else here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002247
Reply.text: I don't really get it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002248
Reply.text: Of course you don't. You're an outsider, and you don't care about the people who go and die in this war just because two big shots couldn't divide spheres of influence.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002249
Reply.text: But it says in the brochure that these were your neighbors who...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002250
Reply.text: Leave that nonsense alone, there's a lot written on the fence, too. There's no truth in these pamphlets. But you know what's really scary? That if you repeat even the most ridiculous lie over and over again, sooner or later you start to genuinely believe it. That is exactly what is happening to my country right now, and that is why we created the Anti-Militarist movement.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002251
Reply.text: So you are against all wars?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002252
Reply.text: We are against the senseless loss of life. We are against stagnation and the impunity of the politicians in charge of our country. This war has been brewing for years, and to deny it is as foolish as to deny the rain. But the fact that it could not be prevented does not mean that it cannot be ended quickly and with minimal losses.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002253
Reply.text: I think I'm beginning to get your point.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002254
Reply.text: I never doubted you. To be honest, our movement could use someone like you. Our goals may be different, but each of us would still benefit. You'll get to Axel and find your mysterious thief, and we'll finally have the Librium we've always dreamed of. So will you join us?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003381
Reply.text: You won't even give me your brochure?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003382
Reply.text: You're not really a tourist, are you? Or do you enjoy driving through cities and collecting pamphlets while people around you give their lives for nothing?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003383
Reply.text: Sorry, stupid question.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002258
Reply.text: I need to think, weigh the pros and cons.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002255
Reply.text: I'm with you! I don't want to kill other people just because they weren't lucky enough to be on the other side.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002256
Reply.text: And you won't regret your decision. And straight to the point - in Tuzz, there are now active measures to send people to war by force. In Marezzia, the Crimson Dawn is methodically destroying the opposition. It is clear that we cannot save all of them, but some people with especially valuable knowledge must be rescued from these cities. That will be your first task.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002257
Reply.text: Why me?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002259
Reply.text: Because no one there knows you. Here, take this.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002260
Reply.text: "Military ID"? What do I need it for?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002261
Reply.text: This is not a simple military ID card. Only professional mercenaries are issued such a document. It guarantees that with all the lawlessness going on, no one in the cities of the CIT would dare touch you. But don't wave that piece of paper around in the capital, because they have their own laws, and you can't get rid of their guards that easily.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002262
Reply.text: That's how it works. I see.|All right, I'll do it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002263
Reply.text: Go to Tuzz first, everything is already prepared there. Our transport will be waiting for you nearby.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002264
Reply.text: Will do.
Reply.scriptResult: TakeQuest('d_FindVerbInAM_Quest'); FailQuestIfTaken('d_FindVerbInSNG_Quest'); FailQuestIfTaken('d_FindVerbInAR_Quest'); CompleteQuestIfTaken('d_GetSupportOneOfTheBands1_Quest'); CompleteQuestIfTaken('d_FindVerbInAM_Quest'); TakeQuest('Podderzhka_Quest'); AddHistory( 'r2_AM_00' ); AddFadingMsgId( 'fm_history_got' ); SetTolerance(1100,1083,RS_ALLY); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002267
Reply.text: So, have you thought it over?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002270
Reply.text: Not yet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002268
Reply.text: I'm with you! I don't want to kill other people just because they weren't lucky enough to be on the other side.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002285
Reply.text: A wise man once said that the real feat in any war is not killing another man, but, on the contrary, saving him. You've done a terrific job, but it's too early to relax. Now it's time for us to make ourselves known.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002286
Reply.text: What should I do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002287
Reply.text: Our reconnaissance team reported that Crimson Dawn has recruited its best fighters to attack a caravan carrying humanitarian aid to the CIT villages. This way they are going to cause hunger and, accordingly, discontent in the enemy's rear. You know that we can't let that happen.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002288
Reply.text: Shoot the bandits robbing the caravans? I can do that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002289
Reply.text: Remember, however, that the CIT must clearly understand that it was us who helped them, not the reinforcements from Tuzz. You'll get 11000 coins for your work. I've already mapped the caravan route on your map. Get to it!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002290
Reply.text: You don't have to ask me twice.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('Podderzhka3_Quest'); TakeQuest('Zashita_Quest'); TActivate('trBeforeCaravanAM'); RemoveQuestItem('MarezziaEscapist_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_them_poput', 'MarezziaEscapist_P') EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003363
Reply.text: There must be some mistake! I'm a completely useless fighter, what good would I do on the battlefield? I'm an ordinary mechanical engineer! Everyone else here is just a common workers, not a military men.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003364
Reply.text: What's going on here?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003365
Reply.text: This is not your concern, citizen.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003366
Reply.text: [Show ID]|On the contrary, everything that happens here concerns me directly. I have orders to bring these men to the capital in order to strengthen its infrastructure in case of a sudden enemy sabotage. And you seem to intend to obstruct me?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003367
Reply.text: No, not at all! Here, take them. And I'll... I'll find more volunteers. No problem.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003368
Reply.text: Now we're talking. You can be free for now.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003369
Reply.text: Please, kind man, have mercy, we have families and children at home. And in Helvetia, you know how it is...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003370
Reply.text: Actually I don't. And I'm not a mercenary at all. Get in my car, there should be plenty of room for everyone. I'll take you to a place where you'll be safe for a while.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003371
Reply.text: It seems we have no choice anyway.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003372
Reply.text: You have. But I bet it's never been more obvious in your life.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('Podderzhka1_Quest'); TActivate('trTuzzEscapistsCarsCreate'); GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount(2); AddQuestItem('TuzzEscapist_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_many_poput', 'TuzzEscapist_P'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003373
Reply.text: Good man, help us! Get us out of the town!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003374
Reply.text: That's why I'm here. The anti-militarists said...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003375
Reply.text: Shh, not another word! Their men are everywhere, raiding and grabbing everyone they can reach!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003376
Reply.text: Then it is all the more necessary to leave this town as soon as possible!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003377
Reply.text: Who are you? Stop right there, you're coming with us!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003378
Reply.text: What the?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003379
Reply.text: Damn, they're already here. Come on, hurry up!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003380
Reply.text: Run after me, my car is right at the gate!
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('Podderzhka2_Quest'); TActivate('MarezziaClose'); TActivate('trMarezziaHuksExit'); SetVar('MarezziaCutscene', 1); GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount(2); AddQuestItem('MarezziaEscapist_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_many_poput', 'MarezziaEscapist_P'); LeaveTown()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002295
Reply.text: Are you that brave soldier who took people out of Argen risking your life? Hmm, I imagined you to be more... big.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002296
Reply.text: And I imagined you as a man. There are miracles in the world.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002297
Reply.text: Brilliant answer, I'm starting to like you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002298
Reply.text: Wonderful news, when do we go on a date?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002299
Reply.text: When the war is over. And not a second before.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002300
Reply.text: So let's speed up the process. What's my next assignment?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002301
Reply.text: To destroy the Crimson Dawn from the inside.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002302
Reply.text: Ha-ha, yeah, great plan, I'll go and destroy it now, wait a minute or two.|Wait, are you serious?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002303
Reply.text: As never before. The man you rescued told us that the power in Argen does not belong to Axel, but to the highest church representatives. And Axel is just a puppet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002304
Reply.text: An unexpected twist. How am I supposed to pull this off?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002305
Reply.text: You have to infiltrate deep into enemy territory and meet our contact there in Toskana. Password: "The old pig was breeding gilts". Don't even ask.|He will lead you to people who are capable of destroying the dictatorship of the church. You will act alone. And yes, be careful, both in Argen and here. It seems that the CIT is finally beginning to take us seriously.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002306
Reply.text: I won't let you down.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002341
Reply.text: Brilliant work! To say I'm impressed is to say nothing! It was a masterful operation!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002342
Reply.text: Well, the Crimson Dawn is defeated, the war is over. Now all that remains is to establish a dialogue between the two countries, and peace will come to this region. One thing that worries me is that CIT tried to fire on me on the way to you. There must be some mistake, but...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002343
Reply.text: Guys, you hear him? Mistake! What a joke! You see, the CIT assholes don't want an end to this war. They won't stop until they take over Argen completely. And now, with the devastation there, they have every chance of succeeding. And yes, you can't go to Helvetia now. Almost all CIT forces are now focused on locating us.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002344
Reply.text: Indeed, trouble has come from unexpected places. What shall we do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002345
Reply.text: A blitz attack seems to be the most acceptable in this situation. And you will play a decisive role in it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002346
Reply.text: I'm listening.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002347
Reply.text: Our allies in Argen will concentrate their troops on the border with Librium. You, on the other hand, will have to break the security of the tunnel to Vaterland. After that, we expect the CIT leadership to leave Helvetia and settle down where no one would think to look. This is their standard security protocol. That's where we'll hunt them down and destroy them all. The locals will help us, they don't want to sacrifice their lives for greedy and arrogant leaders either.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002348
Reply.text: Got it. Our victory is close.

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer1_1_N01
Reply.text: What do you want?

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer1_1_P02
Reply.text: Could you help me?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001936
Reply.text: Well, there's no way around it.

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer2_1_N01
Reply.text: Have you ever heard of fishing with bells on?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001931
Reply.text: Fishing with bells on. One of the ways of river fishing.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001933
Reply.text: You grab the fishing rod and wait like a fool for eight hours, watching the bell, and suddenly DING-DING, and you pull as hard as you can!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001934
Reply.text: That's great. Well, I'm out of here.

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer4_1_N01
Reply.text: Hey, stranger, come sit with me.

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer4_1_N02
Reply.text: I'm all ears.

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer4_1_N03
Reply.text: I want to tell you a story. It's very important and very interesting.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001939
Reply.text: All right, I'm listening.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001940
Reply.text: It was a long time ago... And it happened somewhere... No, not there... Although, wait, it definitely happened there! And it was a long time ago, yes... You're confusing me!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001941
Reply.text: But I didn't even say anything.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001942
Reply.text: That's it, get out of here, you're driving me out of my mind!

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer4_1_N04
Reply.text: I don't have time to listen to your stories.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001929
Reply.text: Do you want to buy some fish?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001937
Reply.text: Then don't stand there, you're just taking up space!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001938
Reply.text: Do you sell fish in the village near the ocean? What for? Every second person here is a fisherman.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003276
Reply.text: Actually, not every second, but every first. And why are you still here? You're just scaring away my customers!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003277
Reply.text: What customers? There's no one here. Why do other fishermen need your fish if they can catch their own?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003285
Reply.text: You scared everybody away, that's why there's no one. That's it, I've had enough of this chatter, go bother someone else!

Reply.name: r1m4Random_Bar_Gomer1_N03
Reply.text: In that case, you found him.

Reply.name: r1m4Random_Bar_Gomer1_N05
Reply.text: I'll tell you more: I'm hard to find, and quite easy to lose! Ha-ha-ha.|Why do you need me, by the way?

Reply.name: r1m4Random_Bar_Gomer1_N07
Reply.text: Well, well, well. The whole neighborhood already thinks I'm crazy for telling stories like that, but you seem really interested.

Reply.name: r1m4Random_Bar_Gomer1_N09
Reply.text: Eh, I wanted to ask you for money... But I can see that you're a good man, not like this scum around here. I'll tell you for free!

Reply.name: r1m4Random_Bar_Gomer1_N13
Reply.text: Anyway, listen to this. One day I was looking for something to collect in the neighborhood, and I stumbled upon a very interesting place. It looked like an ordinary junkyard for old cars, except for the monster that guards the junkyard.

Reply.name: r1m4Random_Bar_Gomer1_P02
Reply.text: I'm looking for Homer.

Reply.name: r1m4Random_Bar_Gomer1_P04
Reply.text: Finally! You're a hard man to find!

Reply.name: r1m4Random_Bar_Gomer1_P06
Reply.text: I want to hear the story of the Sea Gate and the metal monster directly from you.

Reply.name: r1m4Random_Bar_Gomer1_P08
Reply.text: That's right.

Reply.name: r1m4Random_Bar_Gomer1_P10
Reply.text: Well, thanks.

Reply.name: r1m4Random_Bar_Gomer1_P14
Reply.text: Wait, monster? Maybe you mean bandits?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001899
Reply.text: No, exactly a monster! A huge long mechanical creature, smoking and baring its teeth. I was drunk at that time, but it scared the hell out of me! I'll be honest with you, kid, I've never run away from anyone so fast in my life.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001900
Reply.text: And what makes you think there's anything important there?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001901
Reply.text: Well, why would a thing like that just stand there?! It's clearly guarding something! Besides, it confirms the local rumors about the Sea Gate.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001902
Reply.text: What kind of rumors?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001903
Reply.text: A long time ago, let me tell you, about twenty years ago, a man showed up here, asking everyone about these very gates. He spent a lot of time here, even rented a room from a local old lady to do all sorts of research there. What was his name...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001904
Reply.text: Is it Ivan?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001905
Reply.text: Ivan! Definitely Ivan! By the way, your voice are very similar to his. Aren't you his son, by any chance?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001906
Reply.text: No matter. What happened next?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001907
Reply.text: One day he just disappeared. I was hanging around Berko all the time back then, so I would have seen if he'd gone south. But his car wasn't on the road, so he must have found this very gate and used it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001908
Reply.text: Or he was killed by bandits.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001909
Reply.text: You wouldn't say that if you saw his car! It's a miracle, not a machine. None of the local bandits could have handled him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001910
Reply.text: Okay, so Ivan was able to find the Sea Gate. Tell me how to get to the place where you saw the monster.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001911
Reply.text: Listen very carefully: behind the village of Cordan there is a swamp. The locals will assure you that it's better not to go into it, but if you drive strictly along the road and don't turn anywhere, you will pass without any problems. But be aware that if you make just one wrong move, you won't be able to get out!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001912
Reply.text: Thank you for your help. Can I talk to the old lady from whom Ivan rented the room?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001913
Reply.text: Of course! If only you know how to talk to the dead. She's been gone for ten years.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001914
Reply.text: What about her house? I'd like to take a look at that room.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001915
Reply.text: It's not so simple with that either. This house was bought by an unusually dressed stranger. He took all of Ivan's equipment out of there, and a day later the house burned down.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001916
Reply.text: It looks like a cover-up. What did that stranger look like?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001917
Reply.text: He was wearing an ample robe, some kind of rag on his head. He spoke with a strange accent, looked around all the time, as if he was expecting an attack.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001918
Reply.text: It can't be... |How long ago was that?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001919
Reply.text: About five years ago.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001920
Reply.text: Sergo... He also showed up five years ago. And he fits the description.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001921
Reply.text: A friend of yours?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001922
Reply.text: You could say that. |Okay, I'll go see your monster.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001923
Reply.text: And I have to go to the village to gut my fish. By the way, could you give me a lift to Saliniom, since you're passing by?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001924
Reply.text: Why not. Get in the cab!

Reply.name: r1m4_RandomBar_Gomer_1_N01
Reply.text: If you came here to ruin my catch, you'd better go right away!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003225
Reply.text: Thanks for the ride! Be careful in the swamp! And watch out for the monster himself!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003226
Reply.text: I will. Believe it or not, death is not in my plans for the near future.
Reply.scriptResult: if CanQuestBeGiven('r1m4_OvercomeMirras') then TakeQuest('r1m4_OvercomeMirras') end; CompleteQuest('r1m3_FindVrata_KnowPlace'); TDeactivate('BolotoChoice'); TActivate('trMorassTeleportBefore'); CompleteQuest('FindGomerNearBereg_Quest2'); RemoveQuestItem('Homer_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_rem_poput', 'Homer_P') EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002652
Reply.text: Hey, I remember you! I see you managed to defeat that mechanical monster! If it's no secret, how did you do it?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002653
Reply.text: Let's just say that a blast wave is much more effective on these things than bullets.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002654
Reply.text: That's how it turns out. Anyway, I wouldn't get within a mile of that thing. By the way, what brings you back to our land?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002655
Reply.text: A desire to listen to you again. Do you know if there is a road further north from here? Where it always snows and is very, very cold.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002656
Reply.text: There is one such road. But, believe me, your words "very, very cold" describe only a tiny fraction of the cold you'll encounter in Lidencloud. But luckily, you're not going to get there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002657
Reply.text: Why is that?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002658
Reply.text: The road to those parts begins with a tunnel in the mountain. Twenty years ago it was blocked with rocks.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002659
Reply.text: No other way?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002660
Reply.text: Nope. It was your friend Ivan who blocked the passage, by the way, if you're interested. He said no locals should go there, planted a charge on top of the nearest rock, and detonated it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002661
Reply.text: So you knew that Ivan, besides the Sea Gate, also rode through that tunnel?! Why didn't you tell me that in the first place?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002662
Reply.text: But you didn't ask.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002663
Reply.text: Well, you could've told me... Never mind.|The blockage can always be cleared away, but what to do about the cold is a big question. Do you have any ideas?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002664
Reply.text: I'm not quite sure how you're going to pull those boulders, but I bet you already have a plan. As for the cold, I think you could use some warm clothes from the storage.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002665
Reply.text: But? Surely something will prevent me from taking these clothes that easily.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002666
Reply.text: You're right. The locals have taken over the storage and refuse to leave it until the traders comply with their demands. It seems the last ones were just looking for a negotiator. Since you're the one who needs it the most, you might try your luck. Go to the administration, they have temporary headquarters there now.
Reply.scriptResult: if QuestStatus('GomerSaliniom')==Q_TAKEN then CompleteQuest('GomerSaliniom') end CompleteQuestIfTaken('GomerOlme'); AddHistory( 'r5_Sklad' ); AddFadingMsgId( 'fm_history_got' );

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003270
Reply.text: Thank you so much, it's the second time you've helped me out.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003271
Reply.text: No problem, you're welcome. But you could have thrown me some money for ananaga, if you're so grateful.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003272
Reply.text: I'm sorry, I'm broke myself. And now I got to go.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002667
Reply.text: Thank you so much. Here, take this and buy yourself some ananaga. Try not to drink it all at once.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002668
Reply.text: I can't promise that, ha-ha-ha!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002669
Reply.text: Allright, have a good day.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer1_1_N01
Reply.text: What brings you to this swamp?

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer1_1_N03
Reply.text: What's there to like about it? The only civilization here is this town. All the other settlements are fishing villages. And believe me, there's only fish and nothing else. There's nowhere to rest for a decent man!

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer1_1_N05
Reply.text: If you only knew what I've tried. |Why are you here?

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer1_1_N07
Reply.text: Ha-ha-ha, really? Homer told you that crap? Oh, Homer did, no one else would!

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer1_1_N09
Reply.text: There's one like that. All fishermen are like fishermen, sitting and catching fish, but this one not only drinks like a pig, but also is always talking some nonsense about a mechanical monster and your Sea Gate.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer1_1_P02
Reply.text: You don't seem to like living here very much, I see.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer1_1_P04
Reply.text: Have you ever tried fishing too? Maybe it'll catch on.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer1_1_P06
Reply.text: I'm looking for the Sea Gate.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer1_1_P08
Reply.text: Who's Homer?

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer1_1_P10
Reply.text: Where can I find him?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001925
Reply.text: Anywhere, he never sits still. Try looking around the fishing villages. Maybe you'll get lucky.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001926
Reply.text: Thank you, I will.

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer5_1_N01
Reply.text: How do you get around here?

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer5_1_N02
Reply.text: Looking for the Sea Gate.

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer5_1_N03
Reply.text: Oh, another lunatic! My advice to you - look for Homer. He's always talking about monsters and sea gates, too.

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer5_1_N04
Reply.text: Where should I look for him?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001953
Reply.text: I can't tell you, he's always moving from village to village. Try your luck!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001954
Reply.text: Thanks for the tip.

Reply.name: r1m4_RandomBar_Customer1_1_N01
Reply.text: What brings you here?

Reply.name: r1m4_RandomBar_Customer1_1_N05
Reply.text: In that case, I wish you luck. It's quite a task you're facing. He hasn't been here in a long time.

Reply.name: r1m4_RandomBar_Customer1_1_P02
Reply.text: Hello, uh, fishermen!

Reply.name: r1m4_RandomBar_Customer1_1_P04
Reply.text: I'm looking for Homer.

Reply.name: r1m4_RandomBar_Customer1_1_P06
Reply.text: So I'll keep looking.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000089
Reply.text: What do you want?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000090
Reply.text: I'm looking for a man, his name is Homer.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000091
Reply.text: Oh, I know him. But he's not here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000092
Reply.text: Do you know where to find him?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000093
Reply.text: I heard he's been drinking in the northernmost village for three days straight. See if you can catch him there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000094
Reply.text: Thanks for your help.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002677
Reply.text: I see you're looking for someone.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002678
Reply.text: Yes, is Homer here?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002679
Reply.text: He was here, but he went fishing an hour ago.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002680
Reply.text: Do you know where?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002681
Reply.text: Yeah. See those rocks over there? Go around them on the right side off-road and drive along the shore to the bridge. He usually fishes there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002682
Reply.text: Thank you for your help.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002692
Reply.text: And here you are again. And you're looking for someone again.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002693
Reply.text: Looking for Homer again. Is he fishing?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002694
Reply.text: No, this time he went somewhere.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002695
Reply.text: And you don't know where, of course?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002696
Reply.text: Nope. But he said something about a northern traders' capital, and there's only one settlement in these lands that fits that description.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002697
Reply.text: I think I understand you. Thank you, goodbye.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_1_N01
Reply.text: Need anything?

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_1_N03
Reply.text: Well, well. We do need a negotiator. But I have to ask: why is an outsider interested in the problems of the locals?

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_1_N05
Reply.text: Well, I can do that. But only on the condition that the storage comes back to us. I'll even pay you some money on top. You ready to go?

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_1_P02
Reply.text: Yes, I heard that you need a negotiator. And I heard what for.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_1_P04
Reply.text: When the storage is free, I'd like to get some warm clothes out of there. And ideally, if I can get something to warm up the cabin.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_1_P06
Reply.text: Yes. What do I need to do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002670
Reply.text: First you have to go to them and ask them what they want. I'll let them know on the open frequency that a negotiator is on his way, so they should have no problem letting you in. After that, come back here and we'll work out a further plan of action.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002671
Reply.text: Okay, let's see what they want.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_2_N01
Reply.text: Well? What are their demands?

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_2_N03
Reply.text: But you weren't hurt, were you? That's all. A negotiator's job is no walk in the park.|Now tell me, did they have hostages?

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_2_N05
Reply.text: That's great! That's all we need to know to start the operation.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_2_P02
Reply.text: They want you to let their leader free. By the way, you could have warned me that you had him. I took a great risk by coming to the storage on your behalf.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_2_P04
Reply.text: No, as far as I know, they were alone.

Reply.name: Olme_Bar_Customer2_2_P06
Reply.text: What operation? What are you talking about?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002702
Reply.text: We do not cooperate with the invaders. All we needed to know was if they had any captured traders. You found out they don't. Well done.|Their leader is being brought here from Saliniom right now. We'll execute him for show, and in the meantime, we'll assemble our forces and hit the storage. We'll wipe out these local troublemakers, and then we'll make some preventative raids on the fishing villages around.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002703
Reply.text: It's a little too radical, I think.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002704
Reply.text: That's none of your business. So, look what we have here. We don't need a negotiator anymore, but a good fighter would be very useful. So either you help us with the cleanup and we let you into the storage, or our partnership ends here. It's your choice.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002706
Reply.text: [First to occupy the land and then to execute the locals? Hell no, I won't let them.]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002707
Reply.text: What's your choice?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002708
Reply.text: Do what you want, I don't want anything to do with it.|[Hell with it, I'll free their leader! Just have to act fast!]

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002705
Reply.text: Since you put it that way... All right, I'll help you.

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N01
Reply.text: Stop! Who's coming?!

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N02
Reply.text: Calm down, I'm not your enemy.

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N03
Reply.text: That's for us to decide. Who are you?

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N04
Reply.text: I have been entrusted with an important mission: to negotiate with you to free the storage.

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N05
Reply.text: Huh, have the traders realized that capturing our leader wasn't their best move, and they're ready to release him?

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N06
Reply.text: They captured your leader? [Why didn't they warn me!]

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N07
Reply.text: We're going through a tough times, you know. This storage is the only way we can dictate our demands to the dirty traders.

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N08
Reply.text: So what are your demands?

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N09
Reply.text: At this time, we want out leader to be free.

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N10
Reply.text: But it won't end there, will it?

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N11
Reply.text: Of course not! We can't just give up, there's too much at stake.

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_1_N12
Reply.text: Tell me more about your conflict.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002698
Reply.text: What's there to tell? We lived quietly, didn't touch anyone, fished and drank ananaga. One day, heavily armed traders came here, forced us deep into the region, and demolished our biggest village and built the town of Olme in its place. We thought that would be the end of it, but we were wrong...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002699
Reply.text: What happened next?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002700
Reply.text: You'll know the rest if you find out where our leader is and bring him here. Yes, yes, and don't look at me like that! No trader's negotiator has such heavily-armed vehicle, which means you're an outsider. I don't know why you need our storage, but I'd love to hear about it from you when our leader comes back here. You tell him you're from Pulkonnen, that's my name. Then he'll believe you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002701
Reply.text: I'll think about it.

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_3_N01
Reply.text: I can't believe my eyes! The stranger has kept his word. Our leader is with us again! How did you convince the traders to let him go?

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_3_N03
Reply.text: You have helped us a lot, and we will not forget it. Now you will always be welcome in any village, and our patrolmen will no longer attack you. Is there anything else we can do for you?

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_3_P02
Reply.text: I could not convince them, so I had to act by force. I attacked their prison caravan, but now they are looking for me all over Hel.

Reply.name: r1m4_Storage_Guard1_3_P04
Reply.text: Yes. In fact, I only got involved in your conflict because I need warm things from this storage.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002672
Reply.text: Well, let it be so. Take as many warm clothes as you think you need. And come back for more if it's not enough.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002994
Reply.text: Hold on. You promised to tell me more about your confrontation with the traders.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002995
Reply.text: Oh, yeah. Where was I?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002996
Reply.text: The traders demolished your village and built Olme in its place.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002997
Reply.text: And then they gradually began to go deeper inside. Or rather, they started trying to. We realized right away what was going on, and we fought back immediately. That's why our patrols attacked you earlier. Their orders were that if you're not ours, you're the enemy.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002998
Reply.text: And how did this conflict end?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002999
Reply.text: It didn't. It's actually still going on! But now we have our leader again, under whose leadership we will finally kick the damned traders out of our lands!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003000
Reply.text: Well, good luck in this war. I'm going to get some warm clothes.
Reply.scriptResult: TActivate('RolikOdezhdaBegin'); RemoveQuestItem('ExtLeader_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_rem_poput', 'ExtLeader_P'); SetTolerance(1100,1014,RS_ALLY); SetTolerance(1100,1084,RS_ALLY); SetTolerance(1100,1010,RS_ENEMY); if QuestStatus('Zachisti3_Quest')==Q_COMPLETED then SetTolerance(1100, 1012, RS_ENEMY) end; AddHistory( 'r5_SkladRybaki' ); AddFadingMsgId( 'fm_history_got' ); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002709
Reply.text: I will. Well, I got to go.
Reply.scriptResult: TActivate('RolikOdezhdaBegin'); RemoveQuestItem('ExtLeader_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_rem_poput', 'ExtLeader_P'); SetTolerance(1100,1014,RS_ALLY); SetTolerance(1100,1084,RS_ALLY); SetTolerance(1100,1010,RS_ENEMY); if QuestStatus('Zachisti3_Quest')==Q_COMPLETED then SetTolerance(1100, 1012, RS_ENEMY) end; AddHistory( 'r5_SkladRybaki' ); AddFadingMsgId( 'fm_history_got' ); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003103
Reply.text: I'm very glad we finally met. I really am. I wish it had happened under different circumstances, but alas, that is not possible. I'm very proud that you made the right choice.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003107
Reply.text: The things that are written in your book... Is that true?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003108
Reply.text: Yes, that's absolutely true.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003109
Reply.text: I don't believe it! I have personally seen other people live peacefully, eat, drink, die... I've been on the verge of death many times myself, got drunk myself... And you are telling me now that all this cannot be!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003110
Reply.text: Seen or wanted to see? Did you experience feelings or a semblance of them that your brain drew from long-forgotten states?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003111
Reply.text: I don't know...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003112
Reply.text: How old do you think you are?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003114
Reply.text: You were twenty-three years old in 2011. And now it's 2234. Though only few of those alive today have any idea.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003115
Reply.text: What are you talking about?! Are you saying that I lived in the old world?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003116
Reply.text: Yes, and more than that: everyone you met lived in the old world. After the catastrophe, the increase in the population of the human species stopped. Those who survived and adapted simply forgot about the old world and began to live as if nothing had happened.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003117
Reply.text: I can't believe it...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003118
Reply.text: I understand. You always refused to believe my words as a child. Until you see it for yourself, you won't believe me. Well, I'll show you proof of my words. I hope it works.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003119
Reply.text: What are you up to?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003120
Reply.text: Let's go to Cordan. I want you to have a drink at the bar.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003122
Reply.text: But there's a little problem with that: I've really messed up my relationship with this clan...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003123
Reply.text: Oh, you mean that misunderstanding? Don't worry, they forgot about it a long time ago.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003124
Reply.text: Forgot? After everything I've done?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003125
Reply.text: Just trust me. Pretend that you're not guilty of anything and go to them safely.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003126
Reply.text: Well, since you're so sure about that.
Reply.scriptResult: SaveAllToleranceStatus(RS_ALLY); TDeactivate('trMorassTeleportBefore'); TActivate('RolikBegin_PlaneOut'); AddQuestItem('AivenGo_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_poput', 'AivenGo_P'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003121
Reply.text: After all I've heard, yes, perhaps I should have a drink.
Reply.scriptResult: TDeactivate('trMorassTeleportBefore'); TActivate('RolikBegin_PlaneOut'); TActivate('trConv'); AddQuestItem('AivenGo_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_poput', 'AivenGo_P'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003104
Reply.text: Here we are. Come on, order something for yourself.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001952
Reply.text: It's good to see you. Again.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001970
Reply.text: You again. But now, in the middle of the day, and in the village bar!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001971
Reply.text: Why can't I go into the bar?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001972
Reply.text: You don't have a head!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001973
Reply.text: And so what? As if that ever bothered anyone.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001974
Reply.text: Why don't others notice you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001975
Reply.text: Too many questions. In fact, I need you to do something.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001976
Reply.text: You're kidding, right? Do I have to do tasks for you now?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001977
Reply.text: Not for me. For you. There's a place right here. Stop at the edge of the cliff and look at the top of the mountain on the opposite bank.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001978
Reply.text: That's all?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001979
Reply.text: That's all. Now if you'll excuse me, I have to go. Nice ananaga, by the way.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001980
Reply.text: Hey, what the?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003297
Reply.text: Disappeared...|What the hell is going on here?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003014
Reply.text: Hello, traveler. Would you like to buy a detailed map of the surrounding lands from me? Only 10000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003016
Reply.text: Not now.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003015
Reply.text: Sure. Here's the money.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003256
Reply.text: Oh, it's you...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003257
Reply.text: Tikhomir! What a meeting! Glad you made it to warm lands. Where is Dobroslava?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003258
Reply.text: I thought I could save her... I thought her numbness would break if I could get her out of this frozen hell. But all in vain... She's dead.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003259
Reply.text: I'm very sorry to hear that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003260
Reply.text: Me too... Me too.|You know, you should have killed me back then. At least one of us would still be alive. But you can't take it back.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003261
Reply.text: Don't blame yourself. You couldn't have seen it coming.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003262
Reply.text: What if I could, but didn't want to?|Leave me alone. Don't stop me from drowning my sorrows in drink.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001927
Reply.text: It's sad here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001928
Reply.text: Tired of fishing?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001944
Reply.text: Tired of living!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001946
Reply.text: I'm sorry, but I can't help you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001945
Reply.text: Stop whining and do something useful. Surely Olme needs a men to guard their trading caravans. If your life is so boring, daily skirmishes with bandits is the best solution for you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001947
Reply.text: You're right! That's a great idea, I'll go there right now. All that's left is to find someone to give me a ride.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001949
Reply.text: I can do it if you pay me.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001950
Reply.text: Thank you so much!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001951
Reply.text: You're welcome. Get in the cab!
Reply.scriptResult: TakeQuest('RybakToOlm_Quest'); TActivate('RybakToOlm'); GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount(1); AddQuestItem('Rybak_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_poput', 'Rybak_P'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001948
Reply.text: Good luck!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002873
Reply.text: Wait, don't shoot! You probably don't remember me, do you? I'm the fisherman from Saliniom you dropped off at Olme.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002874
Reply.text: I remember you perfectly! I'm glad you found yourself in this career.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002875
Reply.text: Yes, I really like it here. And the harder it was for me to make this choice.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002876
Reply.text: What choice are you talking about?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002877
Reply.text: In general, the situation is as follows: after you deceived the traders with the storage, they declared you an enemy and assigned a large sum for your head.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002878
Reply.text: Yeah, it's not a good situation... But I knew what I was getting into.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002879
Reply.text: You did the right thing. Even though I now work for the NPT, I am very grateful to you for not storming the storage with them and freeing our leader. I don't have any money or valuables, so just accept my thanks and warning. Don't even try to go to Olme or Minin, you'll be arrested there right away, or worse... That's it, I have to go, otherwise too long absence from the workplace may cause unnecessary suspicions! Have a good day!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002880
Reply.text: Thank you so much for the information! Good luck!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002971
Reply.text: Here we are. Thanks for the ride, I owe you one.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002972
Reply.text: Good luck finding a job!

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer3_1_N01
Reply.text: Hi. Sit down and have a shot of ananaga with me.

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer3_1_N02b
Reply.text: Thank you, but I'm busy.

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer3_1_N02a
Reply.text: Why not.

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer3_1_N03a
Reply.text: Well, what do you think?

Reply.name: r1m4_UnknownBar_Customer3_1_N04a
Reply.text: Not bad, not bad at all...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001955
Reply.text: Yeah! The best!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001963
Reply.text: You don't say. Well, your ananaga is good, but I have to go. So long!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001956
Reply.text: I'm not agree with that one!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001957
Reply.text: Wait, are you telling me you've tasted better ananaga than mine?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001958
Reply.text: Sure I have! In the far south, where I'm from, the local bozo, Petro, makes ananaga that you wouldn't even dream of!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001960
Reply.text: I'll be damned if I'm lying right now! The aroma is mild, the taste is pleasant, but the effect is deadly. Three cups and you're done.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001961
Reply.text: Maybe you have a recipe for this miracle drink, too?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001962
Reply.text: I do, but why should I show it to you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001964
Reply.text: You shouldn't. But if you show me and this thing impresses me, I'll share with you a description of a very interesting technology.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001965
Reply.text: What kind of technology?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001966
Reply.text: The technology of aging alcohol. You see, it's not enough just to make ananaga: it has to be aged. Only then it will acquire a truly magnificent taste.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003360
Reply.text: What kind of stupidity is that? What's the point of aging? You're trying to trick me, that's what! No recipe for you!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003361
Reply.text: Aging is not a stupidity! But you are stupid, that's for sure. All right, it's up to you. Just don't come complaining to me later, when you make everything according to your recipe, but you get a total mess.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003362
Reply.text: Not a chance!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001967
Reply.text: You convinced me. Here's the recipe.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001968
Reply.text: Really impressive. Here you go. Combine your recipe and this technology and you have a drink worthy of the gods. All the best to you!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001969
Reply.text: Good day to you too!

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_1_N01
Reply.text: Young man, I'm in trouble.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_1_N02
Reply.text: What happened?

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_1_N03
Reply.text: My husband went to the market and disappeared. He probably sold the goods and got drunk. I need to find him.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_1_N04b
Reply.text: It's your problem, solve it yourself.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_1_N04a
Reply.text: I can help you find him.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_1_N05a
Reply.text: Thank you, young man. If you find him, bring him to my house. I will not be stingy with a reward.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_1_N06a
Reply.text: At least tell me your husband's name. And describe his appearance.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_1_N07a
Reply.text: Oh, of course! His name is Filimon. Curly, with a bandage on his forehead. He likes to say "get up and out of here", and he is also attracted to pink blouses.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_1_N09a
Reply.text: I got it. I'll go to the local bars and look for him.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_2_N01
Reply.text: Did you bring me my husband?

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_2_N02d
Reply.text: No. Look for him yourself.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_2_N02c
Reply.text: Still looking.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_2_N02b
Reply.text: I found him. He's in the village...

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_2_N02a
Reply.text: There he is, safe and sound.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_2_N03a
Reply.text: Oh, I don't even know how to thank you. I have some wares to sell, so I'll give them to you.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_OldWomen1_2_N04a
Reply.text: Thank you. Goodbye.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002623
Reply.text: You again! I hope you didn't come all this way just to get that money out of me.
Reply.scriptCondition: QuestStatus('q_FH1')==Q_TAKEN and IsQuestComplete('WorkGiver_Quest1') and GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() == 0 and GetVar('FarmerDickRejection').AsInt==0

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002624
Reply.text: Money? What money?|Ah, I remember you. No, shove those coins in your... under your mask, I'm not here about that. Do you know where Filimon is?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002625
Reply.text: What do you want?
Reply.scriptCondition: QuestStatus('q_FH1')==Q_TAKEN and not(IsQuestComplete('WorkGiver_Quest1')) and GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() == 0 and GetVar('FarmerDickRejection').AsInt==0

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002626
Reply.text: I'm looking for Filimon.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002628
Reply.text: What the hell do you need him for?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002629
Reply.text: It's none of your business.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002630
Reply.text: Allushka hired you, I can feel it in my gut! I won't tell you anything, I'm not going to betray my friend! Unless...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002627
Reply.text: Unless you buy me a drink! But keep in mind that I don't drink any liquor, but quality drinks, and they don't come cheap. 700 coins a bottle.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002674
Reply.text: Well, no, you won't get a coin from me.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002675
Reply.text: So that's how it is! Well, then, Allushka won't be seeing her husband today.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002676
Reply.text: We'll see about that.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002673
Reply.text: It's a bit expensive, I don't have that much yet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002632
Reply.text: Here you are. Now tell me where Filimon is!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002683
Reply.text: Filimon was indeed here, drank a bottle of the local ananaga, and afterwards left for the sacred hill to lead a round dance near the fir tree.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002684
Reply.text: Are you serious right now?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002685
Reply.text: Of course I am! That's right! Round dancing is a very old tradition in these area, and every fisherman would consider it an honor to go to Sacred Hill and go a couple of circles around a spruce tree.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002686
Reply.text: Where is this sacred hill located?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002687
Reply.text: Further down the road. There are no forks, so you won't get lost.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002688
Reply.text: Let's see those roundels of yours.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002689
Reply.text: So, are you ready to buy me a drink now?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002691
Reply.text: I don't have the money yet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002690
Reply.text: Here you go. I hope it's worth it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003288
Reply.text: So what's up with Filimon? Ha-ha-ha!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003290
Reply.text: None of your business!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003289
Reply.text: I'm stumped...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003291
Reply.text: And I told you that you couldn't find him yourself! How much did I ask for, I think it was 700 coins? Forget it. The new price is 1500.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003292
Reply.text: How much?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003293
Reply.text: And that's just so you don't show off too much. You want to find Filimon, you pay. You don't, you know where the exit is.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003295
Reply.text: Forget about it!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003294
Reply.text: Eh, what else is left... Take your money.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N01
Reply.text: What do you want from me, dear man?
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuestIfTaken('q_FH1'); if QuestStatus('q_FH3')~=Q_TAKEN then TakeQuest('q_FH3') end

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N02
Reply.text: Filimon, your wife is looking for you, and you're doing the round dance here!

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N03
Reply.text: I'm tired of her! Let me rest, let me walk around the tree!

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N04
Reply.text: No, let me walk you home.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N05
Reply.text: I don't want to go home! Besides, I'm sick of you, so why don't you get up and out of here?

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N06
Reply.text: You'd better go with me.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N07
Reply.text: Look, why don't I give you some money and you'll leave me alone?

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N08b
Reply.text: No, I promised I'd bring you home!

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N09b
Reply.text: There's nothing to do, let's go. I'm sick of you already.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N10b
Reply.text: Get in the cab.

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N08a
Reply.text: All right, I'll have mercy on you. How much?

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N09a
Reply.text: Is 500 coins enough for you?

Reply.name: r1m4_SomeWhere_Husbent1_1_N10a
Reply.text: I didn't expect more from you. Give it to me.

Reply.name: KonnyBlide_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Young man, don't pass by, help two good people in trouble.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001080
Reply.text: What's your trouble?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001863
Reply.text: We are a young married couple, Connie and Blyde. My wife needs to get home to her sick mother right away, and our car broke down. Can you give us a ride?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001864
Reply.text: Why not, where is your home?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001866
Reply.text: Hmm, strange...|According to the map, there is no settlement here.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001867
Reply.text: Your map is wrong, there's actually a small town in this place. So, will you give us a ride?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001869
Reply.text: Yes, get in the car.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001868
Reply.text: No, you're suspicious.

Reply.name: KonnyBlide_hellodlg1
Reply.text: Here we are.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001083
Reply.text: But there's no house here...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001085
Reply.text: That's right, boy, because this is a robbery! Don't you move and give me all your money if you don't want to end up with a bullet in your head!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001872
Reply.text: Over my dead body! You'll get nothing!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001086
Reply.text: [Raise hands and step away from the car]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001870
Reply.text: Well, well, what a rich booty we have today! Now get out of here!

Reply.name: CrazyMan_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Hey, man, you interested in gambling?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001091
Reply.text: No, it's not for me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001088
Reply.text: Go on.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001241
Reply.text: There's an Entertainment Center around here owned by a very enterprising woman. It has everything you need: betting, gambling, booze, even girls! And at very reasonable prices. I can tell you how to get there for only 150 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003008
Reply.text: I don't have that much money yet...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001875
Reply.text: That's expensive. I'll better find the Entertainment Center myself.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001244
Reply.text: Interesting, here's the money.

Reply.name: ArchitectorMinin_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Young man, could you do me a favor and help an old man?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001098
Reply.text: I'll help in any way I can. What do you need?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001873
Reply.text: There are ruins nearby that are of great cultural value. I really want to explore them, but the mayor refuses to provide a person to take me there. Don't worry, I'll pay for your time.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001876
Reply.text: I'm sorry, but I don't have time.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001874
Reply.text: All right, I'll take you there, but I won't be guarding you. I have other things to do besides that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001893
Reply.text: Thank you very much, young man.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001894
Reply.text: You're welcome.

Reply.name: ArchitectorMinin_hellodlg1
Reply.text: Here we are. Thank you, good man, here is your payment.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001243
Reply.text: Good luck with your research!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003394
Reply.text: Oh, how good to see you again, young man! I've finished all my research and now I have to show it to my colleagues in Midgard. Will you drive me there?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003396
Reply.text: To Midgard? It's a long way...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003397
Reply.text: Yes, I understand, and I'll pay a pretty decent amount of money for this inconvenience. Do we have a deal?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003401
Reply.text: I'm sorry, but that's too much of a detour for me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003400
Reply.text: Now we're talking! Get in the cabin.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003399
Reply.text: Why not. Besides I have some unfinished business in Midgard myself.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003395
Reply.text: Thank you very much, young man! Now our team will finally be able to complete an architectural project. Here, take this sum as payment for your work.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003398
Reply.text: Thank you, too. Good luck with your research.

Reply.name: Labirint_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Are you a bounty hunter?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001100
Reply.text: No, but I still can shoot a gang of bandits. What do you need?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001104
Reply.text: There was an Entertainment Center down the road where the whole village used to have fun. Not long ago it was set on fire. We knew right away who did it, and we killed everyone involved, but the leader of the gang has gone on the run, and we can't seem to track him down.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003005
Reply.text: The Entertainment Center?! But I was told in Pesht that it was working! I also paid money to have the way there drawn on the map.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003006
Reply.text: It's not surprising. What for one person is a sorrow, for another - an opportunity to earn money. It's a wild place, after all...|But to hell with the manners, they're about the same everywhere. But we have to do something about that fugitive.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003273
Reply.text: Do you want me to find him?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001105
Reply.text: And you want me to find him?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001877
Reply.text: To find and kill, because we do not have time for search, we have to work in the fields!|We have unconfirmed information that he is hiding in the City of the Dead.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001878
Reply.text: Creepy name...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001879
Reply.text: Some fool came up with this name, and the others picked it up. In fact, it's just a huge ruin of the old world, you must have noticed it when you drove here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001880
Reply.text: Yes, I remember. How much are you paying for his head?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001881
Reply.text: 500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001883
Reply.text: I don't feel like climbing over ruins for such low price. If only it were a little higher...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001884
Reply.text: Fair enough. You are good, I see! 700 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001886
Reply.text: No, still not enough.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001887
Reply.text: That's all I can offer. If you refuse, we'll find another mercenary.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001889
Reply.text: All right, I'll do it for 700 coins!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001888
Reply.text: Good luck with that.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001885
Reply.text: Now we have a deal!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001882
Reply.text: I agree.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001890
Reply.text: Changed your mind?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001892
Reply.text: I just got the wrong door.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001891
Reply.text: Yes, I'm on it!

Reply.name: Circus_hellodlg1
Reply.text: Sorry, buddy... You probably came here to have fun and win money at our Entertainment Center, but it's not going to work out... The local gangsters lost a lot of money and started smashing everything up so that no stone was left unturned... All the bandits had already been killed, but unfortunately my Entertainment Center wasn't rebuilt from that...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001242
Reply.text: That's a pity...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001298
Reply.text: Wait, let me at least give you a riddle. Pay 500 coins, and if you get the answer right, you get twice as much.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003224
Reply.text: I don't have that much money.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001300
Reply.text: No, I don't think so. Bye! Good luck with rebuilding.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001299
Reply.text: That's something. Here's the money.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001301
Reply.text: Listen very carefully.|One day in Minin's bar there was such a conversation:|Drunkard: "Yesterday I was told that Klaus, the son of the superintendent, bought himself a Grasshopper and painted it in red.|His drinking buddy: "Hell, no. You got something wrong! The superintendent's son's name is Mikkel, and he painted his Grasshopper in green".|Bartender: "You both need to stop drinking! The whole town knows that the superintendent's son drives a blue Grasshopper, and his name isn't Klaus".

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001302
Reply.text: So, what's the question?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001304
Reply.text: You have to determine the name and color of the son of the superintendent's car, assuming that everyone at the bar was right about either the name or the color of the car. Are you ready to give your answer yet?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003210
Reply.text: Yes, I'm ready.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003211
Reply.text: So what's your answer?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003217
Reply.text: Klaus, red Grasshopper.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003216
Reply.text: Mikkel, blue Grasshopper.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003215
Reply.text: Klaus, green Grasshopper.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003214
Reply.text: Mikkel, red Grasshopper.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003218
Reply.text: That's correct! Here's your money.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003219
Reply.text: It wasn't that hard. See you soon, and good luck rebuilding!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003213
Reply.text: Mikkel, green Grasshopper.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003212
Reply.text: Klaus, blue Grasshopper.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003222
Reply.text: Wrong! But don't worry, I'll spend the money you lost exclusively on rebuilding this place.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003223
Reply.text: Stupid riddle! Who ever buys a Grasshopper in such a times?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001306
Reply.text: Can I hear the riddle again?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003220
Reply.text: Okay, but only for the last time.|One day in Minin's bar there was such a conversation:|Drunkard: "Yesterday I was told that Klaus, the son of the superintendent, bought himself a Grasshopper and painted it in red.|His drinking buddy: "Hell, no. You got something wrong! The superintendent's son's name is Mikkel, and he painted his Grasshopper in green".|Bartender: "You both need to stop drinking! The whole town knows that the superintendent's son drives a blue Grasshopper, and his name isn't Klaus".

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003221
Reply.text: Okay, I'm ready.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001308
Reply.text: I have nothing else to entertain you, I'm sorry.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001309
Reply.text: That's okay, I think I'll go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003193
Reply.text: Hello again. So, did you find what you were looking for up north?
Reply.scriptCondition: (IsQuestComplete('d_GiveMoneyToBase_Quest') or GetVar('QuickWayAlt').AsInt==1) and IsQuestComplete('r1m3_FindThiefFromFatherHouse') and not(QuestStatus('Disk2OrakulLisa')==Q_COMPLETED) and GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() == 0

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003194
Reply.text: You could say that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003195
Reply.text: By the way, I asked around about this Sergo of yours, and, quite expectedly, no one could remember him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003196
Reply.text: It's very strange.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003197
Reply.text: I thought the same thing, and then I decided to ask around not specifically about Sergo, but just about unusually dressed strangers who spoke with a noticeable accent. And then one of the workers remembered something.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003198
Reply.text: I'm all ears.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003199
Reply.text: About twenty years ago there was a most successful attack on our town. Many civilians died then, including Ivan Go's wife. And this attack was commanded by a certain "evil-looking fellow in a baggy robe and rags on his head".

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003200
Reply.text: It can't be...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003201
Reply.text: It gets more interesting. When the worker told Ivan about it, he got very frightened and left town in a day, along with his son. No one has seen him since.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003202
Reply.text: Well, that explains his rush. Thank you, for the information!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003203
Reply.text: Wait a minute! I see that you are able to fight for yourself. And the weaponry on your truck is pretty good.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003204
Reply.text: Get to the point, what do you want?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003205
Reply.text: We're forming a heavily armed squad here to help another trade coalition defeat the bandits who took over Pesht, and bring the town back under their control. And you would be very useful there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003207
Reply.text: Sounds great, I'm in. The only thing is...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003208
Reply.text: Don't worry, you'll be paid. 25000 coins for the success of the operation. Meet the army commander here, he'll tell you everything.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003209
Reply.text: I'm on my way.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003206
Reply.text: No, I'll pass. Solve your own problems.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003011
Reply.text: Hello, traveler. Would you like to buy a detailed map of the surrounding lands from me? Only 7000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003013
Reply.text: Not now.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003012
Reply.text: Sure. Here's the money.

Reply.name: PeshtGuardian_hellodlg0
Reply.text: The passage is closed!
Reply.scriptCondition: IsQuestTaken( 'd_MoveToPesht_Quest' ) and not(IsQuestTaken( 'd_RideAcrossBase_Quest' )) and not(IsQuestComplete( 'd_RideAcrossBase_Quest' )) and not(IsQuestTaken( 'd_GiveMoneyToBase_Quest' )) and not(IsQuestComplete( 'd_GiveMoneyToBase_Quest' ))

Reply.name: PeshtGuardian_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: Excerpt from order number 54/2-GO7: "Prohibit the passage across the bridge of any vehicles not belonging to residents of the city until the threat to safety has been eliminated".

Reply.name: PeshtGuardian_hellodlg0_2
Reply.text: I'm not supposed to talk about it.

Reply.name: PeshtGuardian_hellodlg0_3
Reply.text: No! I'm not supposed to talk about it.

Reply.name: PeshtGuardian_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: Okay, I get that. What's the threat?

Reply.name: PeshtGuardian_hellodlg0_P1_2
Reply.text: But you will, won't you?

Reply.name: PeshtGuardian_hellodlg0_P1_3
Reply.text: Okay, let me put it another way. How else can I go north?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001754
Reply.text: Only two roads lead to the north. The first is through our town. The second is across the bridge, which belongs to dangerous bandits from the powerful Brigade clan.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001755
Reply.text: And what makes it so powerful?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001756
Reply.text: They own an old world military base. Not long ago they opened up the lower floors, and now they have at their disposal the most powerful weapons, which they will surely use to take over a certain towns in the area.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001757
Reply.text: Your town in particular?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001758
Reply.text: I'm not supposed to talk about it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001759
Reply.text: Okay, I understand about the safety threat. Now I just need to figure out how to eliminate it. What can you suggest?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001760
Reply.text: I'm not supposed to talk about it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001761
Reply.text: You're so square! I want to help your town, and you're trying to get in my way!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001762
Reply.text: Blow up the bridge.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001763
Reply.text: Truly, human stupidity is not...|Wait, did you say something? What bridge?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001764
Reply.text: The bridge to their base. If you blow it up, they won't be able to move heavy military equipment across the river and the security threat will be eliminated.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001766
Reply.text: I don't know. Maybe I can somehow negotiate with the bandits.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001769
Reply.text: It's up to you. But if you change your mind, you can buy explosives in Asgard. It's just west of here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001770
Reply.text: We'll see.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001765
Reply.text: Good idea, I like it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001767
Reply.text: You will need a lot of explosives. The best place to buy them is in Asgard. It's right here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001768
Reply.text: Okay, let's see what I can do.

Reply.name: PeshtGuardian_hellodlg2
Reply.text: I heard the explosion even from here! And when the waves came down the river, I knew immediately that you had kept your promise.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d174
Reply.text: The bridge is gone, which means there's no safety threat either. Will you let me through the town?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001771
Reply.text: Of course. Moreover, I spoke with the city officials, and they agreed to give you a free ride across the river.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001772
Reply.text: Thanks for that, though. Well, I'm off!

Reply.name: BaseGuardian_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Look who's here!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_den191
Reply.text: Uh... Guys, I need to pass here...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_den192
Reply.text: Ha-ha-ha, that's funny! That means that you couldn't pass through Pesht. So they're afraid! They're right to be afraid. Soon Pesht will belong to us!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_den193
Reply.text: I sincerely wish you luck, but can I still get through?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_den195
Reply.text: You know, as soon as you got here, I wanted to kill you. But now I don't, you made me laugh so much.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_den196
Reply.text: Does that mean you'll let me through?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001773
Reply.text: No, it means you stay alive. And if you want to pass, pay us 10000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001775
Reply.text: Take the money.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuestIfTaken( 'd_RideAcrossBase_Quest'); CompleteQuest( 'd_MoveToPesht_Quest'); TakeQuest('d_GiveMoneyToBase_Quest'); CompleteQuest( 'd_GiveMoneyToBase_Quest'); AddPlayerMoney( -10000 ); GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount( 1 ); TActivate('BASEATTACK'); TDeactivate('trQuickWay'); TActivate('trPeshtCapture'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001774
Reply.text: Maybe I can find another way.

Reply.name: BaseGuardian_hellodlg1
Reply.text: Look! There's our funny guy. You want to tickle your nerves again? This time we won't let you go so easily!
Reply.scriptCondition: IsQuestTaken('d_GiveMoneyToBase_Quest') and (GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() > 0) and not(IsQuestComplete('d_GetBomb_Quest')) and not(IsQuestComplete('d_GiveMoneyToBase_Quest')) and not(IsQuestFailed('d_GiveMoneyToBase_Quest')) and not(IsQuestFailed('d_GetBomb_Quest'))

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_den1198
Reply.text: Wait! I'm willing to pay for the passage.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_den1199
Reply.text: Calm down, I've almost earned the money...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_dd2200
Reply.text: But what's stopping us from taking all your money and killing you?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_dd2201
Reply.text: Uh... intelligence, honor and conscience?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_dd2202
Reply.text: That's what I love about the guy, his sense of humor! All right, pay up and go. But know that if you ever show your face around here again, I'll personally kill you!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_dd2203
Reply.text: Phew... Almost got into trouble.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest( 'd_MoveToPesht_Quest'); CompleteQuest( 'd_GiveMoneyToBase_Quest'); TActivate('BASEATTACK'); AddPlayerMoney( -10000 ); TDeactivate('trQuickWay'); TActivate('trPeshtCapture'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: BaseGuardian_hellodlg2
Reply.text: Pay up! The price to go over the bridge is 1500 coins!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d180
Reply.text: Take the money.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d181
Reply.text: The price is too high for me.

Reply.name: BanditPeshtGuardian_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Bah, who do I see! Boy, your considerable monetary contribution helped us a lot! As you can see, we managed to buy the necessary equipment, and we blocked a major thoroughfare for the local merchants!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d184
Reply.text: That's not a good thing...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001776
Reply.text: Good or bad, history will tell us later. You probably expect a discount when passing the bridge since you've helped us, right? Ha-ha-ha, no, you don't get it! You'll pay the same as everyone else. That's it, and now get out of my sight!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001777
Reply.text: Enjoy it while you can. Nothing lasts forever!

Reply.name: NonBomber_hellodlg0
Reply.text: I am listening to you carefully.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_dd2156
Reply.text: I need explosives.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_dd2157
Reply.text: How much do you need exactly?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_dd2158
Reply.text: Well, I don't even know...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_dd2159
Reply.text: So, let's start with, what do you need explosives for anyway?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_dd2160
Reply.text: Um, well... I have a passage to clear in one place, and the barrier looks extremely durable... and... that's why I don't know how much I might need.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_dd2161
Reply.text: May I ask on behalf of which city governor you are doing this?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_dd2162
Reply.text: G-governor? Well... um... Pesht! Yeah, I was sent by the governor of Pesht.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001778
Reply.text: Pesht, you say? As far as I know, the city of Pesht is now in a dense state of defense and is certainly not going to clear any passage. You know, I think you are hiding from me the real reason why you need explosives and are planning to use them to commit some kind of sabotage or worse. Therefore, I strongly recommend you to leave the store.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001779
Reply.text: No, wait! I want to help Pesht in the confrontation with the Brigade! Give me the explosives, and I'll make it impossible for the bandits to reach the town!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003239
Reply.text: No more lies! Now leave the store immediately, or I'll call security!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003240
Reply.text: All right, all right, I'll go out myself.

Reply.name: Bomber_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Sorry, buddy, all the jobs are busy at the moment. Come back later.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_dd2164
Reply.text: I didn't come here to get a job. I need explosives.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_dd2165
Reply.text: Ah! Another destitute who's been turned away from Asgard! It's not for nothing that we pay our share to their bartender to bring all the "singles" to us. How much do you need? Tell me honestly, I don't care what you'll use it for.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_dd2166
Reply.text: Enough to blow up a bridge.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_dd2167
Reply.text: Let me see...|Well, you need a little bit of that. Just plant it at the piers, and the whole bridge will collapse like a house of cards! Ha-ha-ha!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_dd2168
Reply.text: How much do I owe you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001791
Reply.text: Well, let's see... 100 coins per gram, so... |Damn it!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001792
Reply.text: What's going on?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001793
Reply.text: Bandits are attacking again, and all the fighters are in the mine! Boy, I'll give you the explosives for free if you shoot those scumbags down!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001794
Reply.text: Sounds like a good deal! I'll teach them!

Reply.name: Bomber_hellodlg1
Reply.text: Wow, that was amazing! Where did you learn to fight like that?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_dd2170
Reply.text: On a big road, I guess.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001795
Reply.text: Now they won't come to us for a long time! Here's your explosives, free, as promised.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001796
