Reply.text: Aren't you even going to ask which bridge I'm going to blow up?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001797
Reply.text: The less I know, the less I will tell the sheriff from the northern traders.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001798
Reply.text: Thanks again. You don't have to worry about the sheriff. No one is going to mourn these people.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest( 'd_BombShahtsReturn_Quest' ); FailQuestIfTaken('d_RideAcrossBase_Quest'); SetTolerance(1100, 1012, RS_ENEMY); TeamCreate('OhranaBridge',1012,CVector(5365,224,1440),{'r1m3_bug01', 'r1m3_molokovoz01'}, nil, 1); TakeQuest('d_DestroyBridge_Quest'); AddQuestItem('quest_explosive'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_thing', 'quest_explosive'); TActivate('preBOOOM'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: MininMer_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Another one! When are you going to stop! What do you want?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d215
Reply.text: Sharky sent me to help with the problem.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d217
Reply.text: There are no problems in our city.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d218
Reply.text: Is that so? But the workers say just the opposite. Why have all deliveries to the north been suspended?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d219
Reply.text: We've finished.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d220
Reply.text: I can help with problems!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d222
Reply.text: Now, either you get out by yourself, or I'll call security!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d223
Reply.text: All right, take it easy! Consider me gone.

Reply.name: MininWorker2_hellodlg0
Reply.text: There you are! We have already prepared the truck, all that's left is to load the oil barrels into it. We'll leave as soon as we finish loading. Follow the caravan and you won't get lost.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d249
Reply.text: I hope now you will be able to solve all the problems in your town.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001095
Reply.text: I hope so too.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001096
Reply.text: Do you happen to know a trader named Sergo? I'd like to see him before I leave.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001842
Reply.text: Sergo? Doesn't ring a bell. Are you sure he's from the "Northern Way"?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001852
Reply.text: Yes, I'm quite sure. He's been staying in Sowth for the last five years, and a few days ago he informed me that you wouldn't be sending any more caravans to those parts.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001853
Reply.text: This is all the more strange.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001855
Reply.text: Because we've never traded with Sowth, and we don't have and never had a trader named Sergo. I don't know who you've been trading with all these five years, but that man has nothing to do with us.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001856
Reply.text: That's a hell of a thing...|Are you sure there were no caravans to Sowth?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001857
Reply.text: Man, I've been working here for fifteen years. If caravans were being sent, I'd know about it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001858
Reply.text: But why would someone pretend to be a trader in your clan for five years?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001859
Reply.text: I have no idea, but you intrigue me. I'll ask around and check the lists of our traders. Sketch me what he looks like on this paper, see if anybody remembers what he looks like. Next time you'll be passing through, stop by and see me. See what I can find out.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001860
Reply.text: Thank you for everything.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001861
Reply.text: You are always welcome. The caravan is loaded, which means you have to go. Good luck on your journey.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001862
Reply.text: See you soon!
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('d_MoveCanistraToMinin_Quest'); if IsQuestComplete('d_TalkAboutVrataInMinin_Quest') then TakeQuest('MorskieVrata2_Quest'); TakeQuest('d_FindVrata_Quest') end; AddBook('r1_book_travel_kupchina2'); TActivate ('CARAVANTOR1M4'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002077
Reply.text: Hello again. So, did you find what you were looking for up north?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002078
Reply.text: You could say that. I was informed that you wanted to see me.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002430
Reply.text: Yes, I do. I asked around about this Sergo of yours, and, quite expectedly, no one could remember him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002474
Reply.text: It's very strange.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002531
Reply.text: I thought the same thing, and then I decided to ask around not specifically about Sergo, but just about unusually dressed strangers who spoke with a noticeable accent. And then one of the workers remembered something.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002532
Reply.text: I'm all ears.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002533
Reply.text: About twenty years ago there was a most successful attack on our town. Many civilians died then, including Ivan Go's wife. And this attack was commanded by a certain "evil-looking fellow in a baggy robe and rags on his head".

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002534
Reply.text: It can't be...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002535
Reply.text: It gets more interesting. When the worker told Ivan about it, he got very frightened and left town in a day, along with his son. No one has seen him since.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002536
Reply.text: Well, that explains his rush. Thank you, for the information!

Reply.name: WorkerForMoney_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Are you looking for a wage labor?
Reply.scriptCondition: IsQuestTaken('d_PayWorkersMoney_Quest') and not(IsQuestComplete('d_PayWorkersMoney_Quest')) and not(IsQuestTaken('d_TrueAboutMer_Quest')) and GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() == 0

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d251
Reply.text: Yes. I need workers on the oil derrick near Minin.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d252
Reply.text: Are you crazy? It's been occupied by bandits for months! Are you trying to kill us?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d253
Reply.text: There are no more bandits there. I can take you there right now to make sure it's safe. If you don't want to work there, I won't talk you into it. There're plenty of volunteers.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d254
Reply.text: Wait. If you're telling the truth, consider that you have my best crew. But I'll need an advance. 2500 coins would be enough.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001835
Reply.text: I need time to get the money.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d255
Reply.text: Okay, here you go.
Reply.scriptResult: AddPlayerMoney( -2500 ); TakeQuest('d_PayWorkersMoney_Quest'); CompleteQuest('d_PayWorkersMoney_Quest'); FailQuest('d_FindWorkersToOilMine_Quest'); TakeQuest('d_MoveFreelancersToOilMine_Quest'); AddQuestItem('Brigada_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_poput', 'Brigada_P'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001836
Reply.text: Did you get the money?
Reply.scriptCondition: IsQuestTaken('d_PayWorkersMoney_Quest') and not(IsQuestComplete('d_PayWorkersMoney_Quest')) and not(IsQuestTaken('d_TrueAboutMer_Quest')) and GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() > 0

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001838
Reply.text: Not yet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001837
Reply.text: Yes, here it is.

Reply.name: OilMineWorker_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Is it you I have to thank for having a job again?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d247
Reply.text: It appears that yes.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001833
Reply.text: You're lucky, for some reason the bandits didn't loot the storages, and there are barrels of oil for three caravans at least. The truck can leave even today.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001834
Reply.text: That's great news. Is there anything else I need to do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003268
Reply.text: Nothing, we'll take it from here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003269
Reply.text: Well, good, then I'm off.

Reply.name: UnknownFromTunel_hellodlg0
Reply.text: What do you want? Well, it doesn't matter. Buy me a drink, then we'll talk!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz467
Reply.text: Sounds good to me. Bartender!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz468
Reply.text: To what do I owe this generosity?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz469
Reply.text: To the fact that I have no one to drink with.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002121
Reply.text: I see. Well, I don't mind anyway! Let's drink to the bottom!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002122
Reply.text: What brings you to our land?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002123
Reply.text: Um... Well... I brought some goods for sale from distant lands, maybe I'll be able to sell them at a profit.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002124
Reply.text: You don't look like an ordinary merchant. More like a military man.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002125
Reply.text: And you don't look like a drunk, but I don't ask you unnecessary questions! Let's have another drink!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002126
Reply.text: Listen, can I take a look at your merchandise? Maybe I'll buy something.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002127
Reply.text: You can't yet. I have a rule: regular customers choose what they want first, and then everyone else.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002128
Reply.text: That's a pity. Nevertheless, let's have another mug, then.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002129
Reply.text: I wouldn't say no to that! Just a second, I need to leave...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002130
Reply.text: [He's already drunk! And he left his jacket here. Let's check his pockets.|There's the key, and no one got hurt! Now, before he comes back, hurry to the tunnel!]
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('d_BarForTunel_Quest'); TakeQuest('d_OpenTunel_Quest'); TActivate( 'TRIGGER_TUNNELOPEN' ); AddQuestItem('quest_key_for_tunnel'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_thing', 'quest_key_for_tunnel'); SetVar('ZasadaAR',1); TActivate('trZasadaAR'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002633
Reply.text: There you are! You thought I wouldn't notice how my key magically disappeared from my pocket right after talking to you!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002634
Reply.text: I'm sorry, but I don't understand what key you're talking about.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002635
Reply.text: It was a pathetic attempt.|You know, I didn't care much for that key, I could get a dozen of them, but that day you really messed me up, because I didn't have a spare one with me. Do you know how long I was stuck in that hole?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002636
Reply.text: Don't exaggerate, the drinks in Asgard are not that bad.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002637
Reply.text: You're a funny guy! That's good, I like when someone makes me laugh. That's why I'll give you a choice. I see you have a good fighting vehicle. Not as good as ours, of course, but still. And nice weapons, I always wanted that gun over there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002638
Reply.text: What is your point?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002639
Reply.text: Give us all your weapons and money, and we'll let you go. You'll be morally humiliated, of course, but at least alive. Or you can keep your weapons, but then we'll kill you and take them all ourselves. So, what's your choice?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002641
Reply.text: All right, I'll give you the guns and the money.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002642
Reply.text: That's great, now get out of here before I change my mind.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002643
Reply.text: Okay-okay, I'm out of here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002640
Reply.text: You now what, I'll choose the third option. Prepare to die!

Reply.name: AboutThief_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Did something happen?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000624
Reply.text: Someone robbed Ivan's house!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000623
Reply.text: I knew it! Some strange and suspicious man has been hanging around here lately. I think he had something to do with the robbery!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000625
Reply.text: Have you seen where he went?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002055
Reply.text: I think he went toward the bandit base.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002056
Reply.text: So I'll have to follow him. That's not good...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002057
Reply.text: Wait, you're not going there alone, are you?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002058
Reply.text: Well, what else can I do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002059
Reply.text: I ask you to take part in our military operation. The "Northern Way" has allocated powerful military equipment, with which we will be able to capture their base! It must be done urgently, before they move their own forces on our glorious city! And with you, our chances of success are greatly increased!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002060
Reply.text: I agree. I have no other choice anyway.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002061
Reply.text: Our fighters are already on the way, but I'll give them orders to wait for you. The meeting place is the entrance to the bandit bridge. It's right here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002062
Reply.text: Got it, I'm on my way!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002063
Reply.text: Did something happen?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002064
Reply.text: Someone robbed Ivan's house!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002065
Reply.text: I knew it! Some strange and suspicious man has been hanging around here lately. I think he had something to do with the robbery!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002066
Reply.text: Have you seen where he went?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002067
Reply.text: I think he went toward the bandit base.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002068
Reply.text: So I'll have to follow him. That's not good...

Reply.name: Thief_hellodlg0
Reply.text: And who are you? I don't know you!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000627
Reply.text: Sir, you have insulted the honor of my family! You have stolen my family treasure... I have the displeasure of speaking to you and ask you to return this thing, which does not belong to you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000628
Reply.text: What? I don't understand.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000629
Reply.text: I am outraged. Now I'm going to kill you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000630
Reply.text: Catch up first!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000631
Reply.text: Sir, you are a dead man.

Reply.name: BanditVyshkadlg
Reply.text: Stop, don't shoot! I surrender!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001843
Reply.text: Put your hands forward. I'll tie you up and take you to Minin. They'll figure out what to do with you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001844
Reply.text: Where the hell did you come from?! That bastard mayor promised us that no one would hire people to kick us off the derrick!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001845
Reply.text: Wait, did Minin's mayor promise you that no one would bother you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001846
Reply.text: Yes, that's right. We often helped him sell stolen government property, and one day he offered us a good deal. We captured an oil derrick and demanded a ransom, and he stopped any attempt to hire a headhunter to beat us out of it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001847
Reply.text: For a share of the ransom, I suppose?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001848
Reply.text: Exactly. But now it seems that his plans have changed.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001849
Reply.text: This changes things fundamentally. I'll take you to Minin, and you'll tell them everything.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001850
Reply.text: Since we're both kind of the victims in this case, why don't you untie me?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001851
Reply.text: No way! Don't forget you tried to shoot me a minute ago, and there's no guarantee you won't do it again! Now shut up and get in the truck!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002069
Reply.text: How did it go?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002070
Reply.text: We succeeded in knocking the bandits out of the base.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002071
Reply.text: I'm very glad to hear that. Did you find the thief who robbed Ivan's house?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002072
Reply.text: Yes, I did. And I got back what was rightfully mine.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002073
Reply.text: Well, that's good. Here's a reward for your greatest contribution to the expansion of our trade guild. From now on you will be welcome in each of our towns.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002074
Reply.text: Thanks, I appreciate it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002075
Reply.text: By the way, our caravanner also wanted to see you. He says he has some information for you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002076
Reply.text: All right, I'll go see him.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002079
Reply.text: You look worried. Looking for someone?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002080
Reply.text: Yes! There was supposed to be a girl passing through here!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002083
Reply.text: There were a lot of girls passing through here. Could you at least describe her?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002084
Reply.text: About this height, hooded coat, fast blue car. Should have been passing through here a few minutes ago.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002085
Reply.text: Yes, she did drive by, looking extremely excited. Was it your ex-girlfriend? My advice to you, don't even try. Your silly attempts won't make her feel anything but pity to you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002086
Reply.text: None of your business! Where did she go?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002087
Reply.text: How should I know? I'm a bartender here, not an interrogator! All I know is that she definitely crossed the bridge.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002088
Reply.text: Damn it! What should I do next?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002089
Reply.text: Even though it's none of my business, but in such situations women usually seek support from people close to them. But just be careful, what if her father hates you as much as she does?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002090
Reply.text: Father...|Ben! Surely he knows where she might have gone! Thanks for your help!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002091
Reply.text: Why don't you at least drink some ananaga? For courage.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002092
Reply.text: No time! So long!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002425
Reply.text: So, what's my choice?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002991
Reply.text: Stay away.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002426
Reply.text: Attack the Oracle.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003127
Reply.text: Bartender, bring me ananaga! Will you have some?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003128
Reply.text: I guess not, why waste a drink. So now you know the truth about the masks. Drink up.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003129
Reply.text: With a great pleas... What the hell?! But the design of my mask does not allow me to eat and drink! But how have I been eating and drinking all this time?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003130
Reply.text: Very, very easy. Look around you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003131
Reply.text: They just take the mugs and pour the contents on the floor? Seriously?! And that's what everyone does! And with the food... But why didn't I notice this mess on the floor when I came in here?! Why didn't I ever notice it at all?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003132
Reply.text: Do you now believe my words to be true?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003133
Reply.text: I can't get it all into my head...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003134
Reply.text: Okay, we're in no hurry. Let's take a ride to Minin.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003136
Reply.text: But there's a little problem with that: I've really messed up my relationship with this clan...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003137
Reply.text: Oh, you mean that misunderstanding? Don't worry, they forgot about it a long time ago.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003138
Reply.text: Forgot? After everything I've done?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003139
Reply.text: Just trust me. Pretend that you're not guilty of anything and go to them safely.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003140
Reply.text: Well, since you're so sure about that.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003135
Reply.text: Well, let's go then.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003142
Reply.text: It's fascinating! They really forgot what I did and didn't open fire on me... But how is that possible?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003143
Reply.text: Their offense against you existed only in your head. You yourself understood that for your actions they would declare you their enemy, and your thoughts were somehow transmitted to them as well. I wish I could tell you more about it, but, frankly, I don't understand how it works myself.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003144
Reply.text: Thought transmission? That's the most insane thing I've ever heard in my life!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003145
Reply.text: Do you have any other explanation for the fact that they forgot what you did right after I convinced you there was nothing to be afraid of?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003146
Reply.text: No, I don't. But still it all sounds like nonsense!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003151
Reply.text: Then you'll just have to trust me. I hope you'll soon realize that. Now let's look around here. Do you see the sign?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003152
Reply.text: I see. "Due to food shortages, the daily quota for all town residents is limited to half a serving a day. Commuters are not served".

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003153
Reply.text: Now let's wait until the caravan arrives from Forgotten. It is from this village that Minin gets his food.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003154
Reply.text: Well, let's wait.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003168
Reply.text: Then you'll just have to trust me. I hope you realize that soon. Now go ahead and order yourself something.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003166
Reply.text: Well, now let's look around here. Do you see the sign?

Reply.name: AsgardBarman_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Is there anything you're interested in?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz447
Reply.text: Besides your city, where else can I buy explosives?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz450
Reply.text: Let me think.|Yes, there is one more place.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz451
Reply.text: Also a store?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz452
Reply.text: Not really. It's a mining camp that buys explosives from here. There's a lot of crooks among them who will gladly share their supplies for not a lot of money.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz453
Reply.text: And how do I get there?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz454
Reply.text: Well, you have two options: either pay me and drive directly to that village, or try to find it yourself, which would be extremely difficult. The choice is yours.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz455
Reply.text: I knew you'd try to get money out of me! How much?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001780
Reply.text: 7000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001785
Reply.text: I don't have that much money.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001782
Reply.text: No way! I'll find it myself without your help!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001781
Reply.text: Here you go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001783
Reply.text: It's nice to do business with a reasonable person. The village is located here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001784
Reply.text: So close?! Eh, I should have looked for it myself!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001786
Reply.text: You again? I won't give you a discount. You want to know where to go, you pay 7000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001788
Reply.text: I haven't collected the money yet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001787
Reply.text: Here you go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001789
Reply.text: It's nice to do business with a reasonable person. The village is located here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001790
Reply.text: So close?! Eh, I should have looked for it myself!

Reply.name: AsgardBarman_hellodlg2
Reply.text: Changed your mind? In case you forgot, the price for the key is 15000.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz457
Reply.text: All right, take it.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('d_FindKeyInTunel_Quest'); FailQuestIfTaken('d_FindZasadaInTunel_Quest'); TakeQuest('d_OpenTunel_Quest'); TDeactivate ('ZASADATUNEL'); AddPlayerMoney( -15000 ); AddQuestItem('quest_key_for_tunnel'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_thing', 'quest_key_for_tunnel'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz465
Reply.text: No, I don't think so. I'm going to go broke with this kind of shopping.

Reply.name: AsgardBarman_hellodlg3
Reply.text: Greetings! What do you want to drink?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001800
Reply.text: Vodka, a hundred grams.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001799
Reply.text: There you go. The first one is on the house.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001801
Reply.text: Thank you. I was wondering...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001802
Reply.text: That's why I'm here! What do you want to know about?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001803
Reply.text: I heard that there is a tunnel near the city that leads far beyond the mountains.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001804
Reply.text: Yes, there is one. As you leave town, take the first turn to the right.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001805
Reply.text: So easy? Your vodka is free, your information is also free...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002113
Reply.text: Young man, you don't have to teach me how to do business.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002114
Reply.text: I didn't even think about it! And by the way, thanks for the drink.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001806
Reply.text: It's you again.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001807
Reply.text: Thanks for the information about the tunnel, of course, but I'm a little confused about how to open it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001808
Reply.text: By the key.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001810
Reply.text: I guessed that, but where do I get it?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001811
Reply.text: I don't know. Unless I can share a duplicate with you...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001812
Reply.text: Eh, nothing new... |How much?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002115
Reply.text: 15000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002116
Reply.text: Why so expensive?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002117
Reply.text: If you knew what opportunities this key would open for you, you wouldn't be surprised at its price. In any case, I'm not going to bargain with you. So, what's your choice?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002120
Reply.text: I need time to collect the money.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002119
Reply.text: It's a fishy deal. Maybe I can get the key somewhere else...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002118
Reply.text: I hope the opportunities are really worth it. Here you go.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('d_FindKeyInTunel_Quest'); FailQuestIfTaken('d_FindZasadaInTunel_Quest'); TakeQuest('d_OpenTunel_Quest'); TDeactivate ('ZASADATUNEL'); AddPlayerMoney( -15000 ); AddQuestItem('quest_key_for_tunnel'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_thing', 'quest_key_for_tunnel'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: MininWorker_hellodlg0
Reply.text: You've come a long way, I see! Are you here on business or looking for adventure?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d176
Reply.text: I have been told that once upon a time an explorer named Ivan Go lived in this town. I would like to visit his house.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d177
Reply.text: Ivan... That name sounds familiar. Very familiar. But I can't remember for sure...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d178
Reply.text: Maybe a few coins will help?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d208
Reply.text: Oh, of course! Ivan! Who doesn't know Ivan!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d209
Reply.text: Tell me everything you know about him.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d210
Reply.text: He lived nearby with his family. Or should I say, his family did. He rarely came here, spending most of his free time traveling, collecting data for his research.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d211
Reply.text: What happened then?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d212
Reply.text: One night bandits attacked the town. I don't remember much about the attack, but people told me that a lot of locals were killed. His wife was among the victims, too. The only good thing was that none of the bastards got away with their lives.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d213
Reply.text: And what happened to Ivan?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001816
Reply.text: As soon as Ivan found out about it, he took his son and left. I never saw him again. I was pretty upset back then. I loved hearing his stories: about mechanical giants, about lights in the sky, about the realm of eternal cold.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001817
Reply.text: Did you mean to say "fairy tales"?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001818
Reply.text: He persisted in calling them "stories". I believed him. After all, he was an explorer and I'm just a working man.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001819
Reply.text: May I look at his place?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001820
Reply.text: You can, but don't take anything from there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001821
Reply.text: I promise I won't. Thanks for the story.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001813
Reply.text: You won't get money from me.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001814
Reply.text: No money - no information.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001815
Reply.text: Don't go anywhere, I'll get some coins.

Reply.name: MininWorker_hellodlg15
Reply.text: So, how's my motivation?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d206
Reply.text: Here's 100 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d207
Reply.text: I'll pay you later.

Reply.name: MininWorker_hellodlg1
Reply.text: So, what do you think of Ivan's shack? By the way, what do you need it for? After all these years?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d191
Reply.text: I want to find him and get answers.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d192
Reply.text: Find him?! After twenty years?! It's up to you, of course, but nothing good will come of your idea.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d193
Reply.text: That's for me to decide. In the meantime, can you give me some advice?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d194
Reply.text: Feel free to ask.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d195
Reply.text: Do you know where the road to the north starts here?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d196
Reply.text: Of course I know that! But the way to the north is long and very tricky, and you won't be able to get to the inhabited lands by yourself.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d197
Reply.text: And what do you suggest?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d198
Reply.text: The only option for you is to go north with our caravan. Then you won't get lost.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d199
Reply.text: That's a great idea. When is the next car leaving?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d200
Reply.text: And this is where the problems begin. Currently, all deliveries to the north are stopped, as the town is experiencing difficulties in the production sphere.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d201
Reply.text: How about a little more specific?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d202
Reply.text: You know what, you better go to our mayor. Tell him Sharky sent you to help with the problem.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001822
Reply.text: All right, let's see what kind of mayor you have here.

Reply.name: MininWorker_hellodlg2
Reply.text: How'd it go?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d232
Reply.text: The derrick has been released. Moreover, I followed one of the bandits and discovered their base.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d233
Reply.text: I assume you found something interesting there?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d234
Reply.text: Bingo. One of the bandits told me about the person who was in charge of capturing the tower. It was your own mayor.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d235
Reply.text: Son of a bitch! It all makes sense now! I can't believe I didn't see it before! His sudden disappearances, his ridiculous excuses, his unwillingness to solve problems... He is up to his neck in it!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d236
Reply.text: What are you going to do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d237
Reply.text: I'll tell everyone about it, then that scumbag will be in trouble for sure!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d238
Reply.text: Hold on. Do you think anyone will believe you? These are very serious accusations, just the word of a bandit is not to be trusted.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d239
Reply.text: Yeah, you're right. I just remembered, he goes out almost every day in the middle of the job hours. It's suspicious, isn't it?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d240
Reply.text: There is such a thing. Stay here, I'll be right back.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001839
Reply.text: The derrick has been released.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001840
Reply.text: That's good news. But not for you. My team will not work there!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001841
Reply.text: You don't have to. The tower is free of bandits now, and I'm sure there are plenty of people who want to work there. You stay here with your strike. But just keep in mind that soon there won't be any work for you to do at all.

Reply.name: MininWorker_hellodlg3
Reply.text: Did you find out anything?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d242
Reply.text: You want to throw the mayor out of office? Then you got a green light. I found his stash. Stolen government property, bags of money, there's plenty of it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_d3d243
Reply.text: We are all very grateful for your help. We're our own bosses now, which means the strike is over. Hey, boys! Get in the truck with him! We're going back to work!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_d3d244
Reply.text: This way, guys! The strike is over!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001823
Reply.text: How did it go?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001824
Reply.text: He kicked me out as soon as I started asking about the town's problems.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001825
Reply.text: That's his style. As soon as you start telling him about the problems, he either gets angry right away, or he finds a hundred or two reasons to end the conversation.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001826
Reply.text: So we'll have to solve problems without him. What do I have to do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001827
Reply.text: First of all, bandits have occupied the oil derrick and are demanding huge sums of money for its release. The mayor is not going to pay them, but he is in no hurry to kick them out by force.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001828
Reply.text: To kill the bandits at the oil well. Sounds easy. What's the second thing?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001829
Reply.text: And secondly, we're on strike here!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001830
Reply.text: A strike? Against what?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001831
Reply.text: Against slave labor conditions! The work is hard, the pay is low. So we refuse to work! Or rather, we refused until the tower was captured. Now the strike has lost its meaning.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001832
Reply.text: Okay, let's start with the bandits, and then we'll see what to do.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003039
Reply.text: You again. What brings you here this time?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003229
Reply.text: I see you're no longer on strike. Were you able to force the mayor to improve working conditions?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003230
Reply.text: Well... Since you knocked out the bandits and then kindly hired another crew, our strike has completely lost its purpose. You can't imagine the tricks I had to go through to get the mayor to hire us again! Well, let's not speak of old times... |What are you doing here?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003231
Reply.text: In our first conversation, you mentioned the realm of eternal cold that Ivan had told you about. I'd like to know more about it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003040
Reply.text: In our first conversation, you mentioned the realm of eternal cold that Ivan had told you about. I'd like to know more about it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003041
Reply.text: And I'd like to have a nice drink at the bar tonight. You know what I mean?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003043
Reply.text: I don't have any money yet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003042
Reply.text: Yes. Here's 1000 coins, which should be enough for a "nice drink".

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003044
Reply.text: What do you want to know?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003048
Reply.text: What exactly did Ivan say to you? Tell me in every, even the smallest detail.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003049
Reply.text: He told me that there is a place in the world where all year round and all day long the sky is covered with thick leaden clouds, and the earth is always covered by a thick layer of strange flakes coming almost constantly from the sky.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003050
Reply.text: It doesn't make any sense... Lead clouds, flakes coming out of the sky... Is this area real?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003051
Reply.text: Of course not! Even though he said it is possible to get there through some passage in Hel, I didn't believe it at all, even then! I couldn't believe the idea of flakes coming out of the sky. That's crazy. Everybody knows that only water can do such a thing.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003052
Reply.text: I got it, thanks for the information.|Now it's time to go see Homer. I hope he's still in Saliniom.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003045
Reply.text: You got the money?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003047
Reply.text: Not yet.

Reply.name: Anticwar_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Would you like to help a group of archaeologists?
Reply.scriptCondition: not(IsQuestTaken('DestroyRuins_Quest')) and not(IsQuestTaken('HelpRuins_Quest')) and not(IsQuestComplete('DestroyRuins_Quest')) and not(IsQuestComplete('HelpRuins_Quest')) and not(IsQuestFailed('DestroyRuins_Quest')) and not(IsQuestFailed('HelpRuins_Quest')) and not(QuestStatus('d_FindRealFatherRoom_Quest')==Q_COMPLETED) and GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() == 0

Reply.name: Anticwar_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: What exactly do I need to do? And will it be paid?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001729
Reply.text: We're not rich people, but we'll pay for the work. One rascal doesn't want us to excavate a mountain range not far from the city, he keeps showing up and asking for a fee. Every day he becomes more and more insistent, and very soon he will turn to aggressive actions.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001731
Reply.text: It's up to you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001730
Reply.text: I'll deal with him.

Reply.name: Antisincer_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Hey, buddy, you interested in an easy, but dirty job?
Reply.scriptCondition: not(IsQuestTaken('DestroyRuins_Quest')) and not(IsQuestTaken('HelpRuins_Quest')) and not(IsQuestComplete('DestroyRuins_Quest')) and not(IsQuestComplete('HelpRuins_Quest')) and not(IsQuestFailed('DestroyRuins_Quest')) and not(IsQuestFailed('HelpRuins_Quest')) and not(QuestStatus('d_FindRealFatherRoom_Quest')==Q_COMPLETED) and GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() == 0

Reply.name: Antisincer_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: It depends on what needs to be done.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001732
Reply.text: There's a group of archaeologists nearby digging for treasure, and they won't pay me any protection money! Not only that, but they threaten to hire a port thug as a guard.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001733
Reply.text: Do I have to kill them?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001734
Reply.text: No, of course not! Why go to such extremes? Destroy their transport and capture their leader, then take him here. Hand him over to me and you'll get your share.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002588
Reply.text: No, I'm not going to help you with that kind of stuff.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001735
Reply.text: Sounds simple. Wait for me with the leader.

Reply.name: Antisincer_hellodlg0_P1_2
Reply.text: No, I don't want to get dirty.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001736
Reply.text: Here you are. How did it go?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001737
Reply.text: Not without casualties, but the goal is achieved. Take the prisoner and give me my cut.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001738
Reply.text: You did a good job! Here's your cut, I'll take it from here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001739
Reply.text: So long. I hope you're not going to kill him.

Reply.name: Kollizey1_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Greetings. Who do you want to bet on?

Reply.name: Kollizey1_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: Oh, that's wonderful news. I will tell everyone in town about it right away.

Reply.name: Kollizey1_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: No one. The new director of the Colosseum asked me to tell everyone that the arena is working again.

Reply.name: Kollizey1_hellodlg0_P1_2
Reply.text: That's great.

Reply.name: Kollizey2_hellodlg0
Reply.text: You didn't come here to gamble, did you?

Reply.name: Kollizey2_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: I smell big money! Thanks for telling me, man, but now I gotta go! There's so much more to do.

Reply.name: Kollizey2_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: No, I want to tell you about the opening of the Colosseum.

Reply.name: Kollizey2_hellodlg0_P1_2
Reply.text: So long.

Reply.name: Kollizey3_hellodlg0
Reply.text: What do you want?

Reply.name: Kollizey3_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: Well, that's great, I guess. I'll let the locals know when I have time.

Reply.name: Kollizey3_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: I want to tell you about the opening of the Colosseum. The arena behind the Olympic will soon begin to perform battles again.

Reply.name: Kollizey3_hellodlg0_P1_2
Reply.text: That'd be very kind of you.

Reply.name: Professor_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Young man, you wanted to see me?
Reply.scriptCondition: IsQuestTaken('TalkProfessor_Quest') and not(IsQuestComplete('TalkProfessor_Quest')) and not(IsQuestFailed('TalkProfessor_Quest')) and GetVar('MidgardCutscene').AsInt == 0

Reply.name: Professor_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: Yes, I am. What did you see?

Reply.name: Professor_hellodlg0_P1
Reply.text: Yes. Are you the one paying for information about strange phenomena?

Reply.name: Professor_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: Mysterious signs appeared in the field near Eastern, residents of the nearby village are frightened.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001712
Reply.text: Well, well, that's interesting... You say signs on the fields... Well, this information matches up with my recent research. Here's your money, I think that's enough. If you see anything else like this, report it to me immediately.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001713
Reply.text: Will you pay for it?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001714
Reply.text: Of course.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001715
Reply.text: That's great. All the best!

Reply.name: Professor_hellodlg1
Reply.text: Calm down, young man. Tell me why you wanted to see me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000553
Reply.text: There is a field in a village near Toskana where large signs periodically appear!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000554
Reply.text: Very good. We will send our people there and study the phenomenon. Here is your reward. Please inform us of similar cases if you come across one of them.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000555
Reply.text: No problem, if you keep paying.

Reply.name: Professor_hellodlg2
Reply.text: Young man, you look worried. You seem to have something to tell me, don't you?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001273
Reply.text: That's right. I was on Oracle Island and saw strange signs on the fields.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001274
Reply.text: That's a very interesting observation! I am in the process of researching this question. You say, Ignott. That's a long way off... But there's a logic to it. Wish I had more information! By the way, here's your reward.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001275
Reply.text: If I see anything like this anywhere else, I'll surely let you know.

Reply.name: Professor_hellodlg3
Reply.text: Young man, you have helped my work tremendously. I used the coordinates you gave me to calculate the exact location of the next visit! I am so excited!
Reply.scriptCondition: IsQuestComplete('Signs_Quest') and IsQuestComplete('r2m2_Znaki2Midgard_Quest') and IsQuestComplete('q_PlaceWithSign') and IsQuestComplete('RPGSigns_Quest') and (GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() == 0)

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001277
Reply.text: You want me to protect you on the road?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001278
Reply.text: Oh, no! Not at all. I can take care of myself. However, the outcome of this case can be completely unpredictable, and I would like to leave you an interesting document for you to keep.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001279
Reply.text: What does that have to do with me? You have archives.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001280
Reply.text: To be honest, my recent research has somewhat damaged my reputation... My colleagues stopped taking me seriously. But you've seen these signs for yourself! You'll understand. Say no more. And I beg you to accept this money as a reward for your work. I will not need them anymore.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001281
Reply.text: All right, give me your document. I'll read it whenever I have a time.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003071
Reply.text: Oh, old familiars. What is it this time?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003072
Reply.text: Same thing. Signs. Except the location is pretty exotic. You wouldn't believe me...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003073
Reply.text: You tell me first, and then I'll think whether to believe it or not.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003074
Reply.text: All right. There's a tunnel in Hel that leads to some very cold lands. And if you drive deeper, across the bridge into the mountains, there, near the town of Volozh, is a field of some winter crops spoiled by these very signs.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003075
Reply.text: Unbelievable... Both about the signs and the fact that there are inhabited lands beyond Hel...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003076
Reply.text: I told it like it really is.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003077
Reply.text: That's amazing.... Here, take this money and thank you so much for your hard work!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003078
Reply.text: You're welcome. Always happy to help. And especially for the reward.

Reply.name: Signer_hellodlg0
Reply.text: What, you come to see the lost one, too? Well, look! Here I am! Marked by the devil!

Reply.name: Signer_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: You're not from around here? Don't answer, I can see that myself. If you were a local, you wouldn't ever walk near me.

Reply.name: Signer_hellodlg0_2
Reply.text: Mysterious signs have reappeared in my field! This is the second time! I don't know what to do anymore... Maybe you can at least dare to go and see what is there?

Reply.name: Signer_hellodlg0_P1
Reply.text: I don't know what you're talking about. I was told you had some kind of problem with the fields here.

Reply.name: Signer_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: So what's the problem with you?

Reply.name: Signer_hellodlg0_P1_3
Reply.text: If I get paid, yes.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001709
Reply.text: I can't pay you, but the scientists of Midgard would probably give you a pretty good sum of money for this information.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001711
Reply.text: Sounds good, let me see what exactly do you have in your field.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001710
Reply.text: No, it's too shady. Deal with your problems yourself.

Reply.name: Director_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Young man, I have a business proposition for you.

Reply.name: Director_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: I'm all ears.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001716
Reply.text: Once upon a time, the ruins behind the village were used as a battle arena, where the best of the best fought to the death for glory and money. Then hunger came to this region and the battles in the arena were shut down.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001717
Reply.text: Thanks for the historical overview, but what does it have to do with me?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001718
Reply.text: The situation in the region has been normalized for several years now, but nobody is going to restore the Colosseum. Except for me! I have already collected all the licenses and the necessary amount of money, but the problem is that no one knows about it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001719
Reply.text: What do you want me to do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001720
Reply.text: Visit the three nearest major cities - Porto, Midgard and Eastern - and tell the locals about the opening of the Colosseum. Come back here, when you've done.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001722
Reply.text: I think I'll pass. It's too much work.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001721
Reply.text: It doesn't sound complicated, I'm in.

Reply.name: Director_hellodlg1
Reply.text: Your work is already paying off. More and more people are coming to the village to take part in the fights in the arena. All that remains is the first demonstration fight, and then everything will go on as planned.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000588
Reply.text: Well, good luck with that! And I have other things to do.

Reply.name: Director_hellodlg1_P1_1
Reply.text: I would like to take part in the first fight.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001723
Reply.text: Brilliant! We already have another participant. I'll call the audience right away. Go to the arena, it's all ready!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001724
Reply.text: Let's go!

Reply.name: Director_hellodlg2
Reply.text: Wow, man, you're a born warrior. How about becoming a regular fighter in the Colosseum? A steady salary and comfortable home is guaranteed!

Reply.name: Director_hellodlg2_P1_1
Reply.text: Thank you, but I'll refuse. I'm just passing through.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001725
Reply.text: Well, how about this: the Colosseum has already made a profit, but it still needs an investment. Put 10000 coins into the firm's account, and when you're back in these lands, you'll get five times that amount. Deal?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001728
Reply.text: I don't have that much yet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001727
Reply.text: I'm not interested.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001726
Reply.text: A risky investment... But I'm in.
Reply.scriptResult: AddPlayerMoney( -10000 ); GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount( 5 ); CompleteQuest('ReturnToDirector2_Quest'); TakeQuest('BuyKollizey_Quest'); CompleteQuest('BuyKollizey_Quest'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Director_hellodlg3
Reply.text: So, did you get the money?
Reply.scriptCondition: IsQuestTaken('BuyKollizey_Quest') and not(IsQuestComplete('BuyKollizey_Quest')) and not(IsQuestFailed('BuyKollizey_Quest')) and not(IsQuestComplete('Disk2OrakulLisa'))

Reply.name: Director_hellodlg3_P1_1
Reply.text: Yes, here it is. I hope you aren't a fraud.

Reply.name: Director_hellodlg3_P1_2
Reply.text: No, I don't have it yet.

Reply.name: Director_hellodlg4
Reply.text: Greetings, buddy. You helped me out so much last time. You literally saved my business. Here you go. That's your share of the profits.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001271
Reply.text: I'm glad you didn't lie to me.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001613
Reply.text: I'm glad you finally came.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003228
Reply.text: What the hell?! How is that possible?! You're not real, are you?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001614
Reply.text: Yeah... I shouldn't have tasted that granny's brew. You're not real, are you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001615
Reply.text: Touch me if you have any doubts.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001616
Reply.text: No, I think I'll pass.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001618
Reply.text: So... what are you doing here?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001620
Reply.text: For who?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001621
Reply.text: For you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001622
Reply.text: Okay, this is all very strange. What do you want from me?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001623
Reply.text: I want you to accept the fact that I exist. That's all for now.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001624
Reply.text: You know, I'd better go and forget this place like a bad dream.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001625
Reply.text: See you later.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001626
Reply.text: I hope not.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003007
Reply.text: Hello, traveler. Would you like to buy a detailed map of the surrounding lands from me? Only 5000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003010
Reply.text: Not now.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003009
Reply.text: Sure. Here's the money.

Reply.name: Fermer_hellodlg0
Reply.text: What the heck do you want from me, punk?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz276
Reply.text: Are you that rude to everyone? Or is it just that my appearance seems harmless to you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz277
Reply.text: Ah, you know, forget it... You look normal. Have a seat since you're here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz278
Reply.text: This is much better.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz279
Reply.text: You're not from around here, I can tell. What do you want from me?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz280
Reply.text: I need to find someone, and your friend in the Sowth said you could help me with that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz281
Reply.text: Holy moly! Dronn himself sent you! Haven't seen him in ages, how is he?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz282
Reply.text: He's okay, I guess.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz283
Reply.text: He so wanted to have a family and a little bar where everyone could find company and have fun. Please, tell me that he made it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz284
Reply.text: Partially. If you leave out the part about the family.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz285
Reply.text: And that's a bad thing, really! Anyway, who are you looking for?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001530
Reply.text: Ben The Throttle. He's an explorer.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001531
Reply.text: Holy moly...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001532
Reply.text: What frightened you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001533
Reply.text: These explorers... There is a rumor that they are in the service of the devil, and that demons and witches serve them!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001534
Reply.text: Ha-ha-ha, that's ridiculous! Do you really believe that?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001535
Reply.text: We're all religious people here, and we don't keep any explorers!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001536
Reply.text: You're kidding me now, aren't you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001537
Reply.text: I'll tell you what: if you need an explorer, go to Locus. That's where the witch was last seen. Now I have to go.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001538
Reply.text: Apparently, he wasn't joking after all...

Reply.name: Karavanshik_hellodlg0
Reply.text: You have no idea how grateful we are to you. With the help of this equipment we will finally be able to establish shipping trade. I don't know what Midgard promised you for this, but here's 200 coins personally from me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz306
Reply.text: Thank you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz312
Reply.text: We've unloaded the truck. Are you leaving right now, or do you still have things to do here?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz314
Reply.text: I have one more thing to do.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz313
Reply.text: There's no point in waiting, let's go.

Reply.name: Karavanshik_hellodlg1
Reply.text: Are you ready to go now?

Reply.name: Citizen_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Hey, hey! What are you doing here, weirdo?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz297
Reply.text: I'm talking to you. Who let you in here?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz298
Reply.text: Well, I... There was nobody at the entrance, so I thought it is okay to come in.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz299
Reply.text: There they go again, those security guards, sitting in the bar instead of working! I'll deal with them later, at first I'll get you out of here!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz300
Reply.text: What's the problem? Why can't I visit the museum?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz301
Reply.text: Boy, have you ever seen yourself in a mirror? Dirty, poorly dressed, ugly chumps have no place in the holy of holies of cultural rest.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001629
Reply.text: [Hit him]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001630
Reply.text: Ouch! Did you just hit me?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001631
Reply.text: [Hit him again]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001632
Reply.text: Guards, guards!!! I was attacked!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001633
Reply.text: Hey, hey, hands off!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001634
Reply.text: Throw this psychopath out of the city walls and never let him into again!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001635
Reply.text: I think I shouldn't have done that...
Reply.scriptResult: GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount( 1 ); SetVar('MidgardCutscene', 1); TActivate ('RolikBegin_OutOfMidgard'); TActivate ('trMidgardCloses'); FailQuest('d_FindBenInMidgard_Quest'); TakeQuest ('FindBenMZ_Quest'); LeaveTown()

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz302
Reply.text: All right, I'm not going to take any more of your insults! I need help finding someone, and if you're so useless that your only function in this town is to kick people out of the museum, I'll go to someone who can actually help me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001628
Reply.text: So long!

Reply.name: Citizen_hellodlg1
Reply.text: Our city is extremely grateful to you for your help. Here's your money. And I managed to find out where Ben lives now. Let me mark it on your map.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz318
Reply.text: Thank you so much.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz317
Reply.text: I hope you'll find what you're looking for. And if you ever need anything special, you should know that the most advanced technology is only in our city. All right, now go.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz319
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('d_CaravanToMidgardBen_Quest'); TakeQuest('d_FindHouseOfBen_Quest'); AddHistory( 'r1_Before_Ben_00' ); AddFadingMsgId( 'fm_history_got' ); TActivate ('trCaravanToMidgardRemove'); SetVar('FindBen',0); TActivate('tr_THEBEN'); SetTolerance(1100,1009,RS_NEUTRAL); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Zavhoz_hellodlg0
Reply.text: What's your issue, young man?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz292
Reply.text: You've got some crazy guy running around the museum and forcing out everyone whose clothes he doesn't like. Is there anything you can do about it?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz307
Reply.text: Damn it, he's at it again... How many times have I told him to do something useful, and he's still like a brick wall. All right, young man, I'll take care of it. Anything else?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz308
Reply.text: Yes. I'm looking for one man, Ben The Throttle. I was told he used to live here.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz309
Reply.text: Ben The Throttle... That name sounds familiar. As compensation for the inconvenience, I'll make inquiries about him. In the meantime, could you help the town? Not for free, of course.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz310
Reply.text: I'll do my best. What do you need?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001636
Reply.text: It is urgent to deliver a load of high-tech equipment to Porto. We will transport it in a separate car. Your job is to escort this car to the port and back, destroying anyone who decides to interfere. I think 700 coins would be a fair price for such a risk.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001637
Reply.text: Okay, I agree. There's nothing to do anyway, while I'm waiting for information about Ben.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001638
Reply.text: Caravan can leave right now. Or do you need to get ready?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001640
Reply.text: I need a time to get the truck ready.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001639
Reply.text: I'm ready.

Reply.name: Zavhoz_hellodlg1
Reply.text: Ready to hit the road now?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002576
Reply.text: I need a little more time.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002520
Reply.text: Yes, I'm ready.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003035
Reply.text: You've come back too early.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003036
Reply.text: Unfortunately, I failed to protect the caravan. I was only distracted for a second and...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003037
Reply.text: Couldn't protect it?! Any fool could have done it! You blew the whole delivery! Get out! Get out of my sight! Guards, get him out of town!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003038
Reply.text: Wait, what about Ben's place?!
Reply.scriptResult: GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount( 1 ); TActivate ('RolikBegin_OutOfMidgard'); TActivate ('trMidgardCloses'); TActivate('tr_THEBEN'); CompleteQuest('CaravDead_Quest'); TakeQuest ('FindBenMZ_Quest'); LeaveTown()

Reply.name: Staruha_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Who knocks at my door?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz288
Reply.text: Are you a witch?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz293
Reply.text: You little punk! Get out of here, and I never come to my house again!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz294
Reply.text: Oops. I guess I shouldn't have said that straight. What do I do next?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001539
Reply.text: Who knocks at my door?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001540
Reply.text: Hi, Grandma.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001541
Reply.text: Oh, honey, Marco told me everything. I'm so ashamed of my behavior! Come in quick, let me make you my special tea.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001542
Reply.text: That's very sweet, Grandma, but I'd just...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001543
Reply.text: Don't be too shy, my dear, call me Grandma Paula. Come on in. How dare you walk in your shoes on the carpet!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001544
Reply.text: Oops, my apologies.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001545
Reply.text: Strong tea or regular one?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001560
Reply.text: It ran out.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001561
Reply.text: Strong then.|So, there's a man I'm looking for.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001547
Reply.text: You have good taste. Let me make one for you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001548
Reply.text: So, there's a man I'm looking for.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001549
Reply.text: Oh, wait, you, dear, with your man. The tea isn't ready yet. In the meantime, let me tell you something.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001550
Reply.text: Looks like I don't have a choice...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001551
Reply.text: Once upon a time, fifty winters ago, I lived in Midgard, the capital of the region. The world was not yet what it is today. Everyone in that town was trying to make it a better place, from the common laborer to the best explorer. And there was one man that everyone respected. Ben The Throttle. He had a last name, of course, but almost everyone called him Throttle. After the device he'd rebuilt from old blueprints.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001552
Reply.text: Wait, so Ben The Throttle lives in Midgard?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001553
Reply.text: Wow, dear, I see you're interested. Nowadays, kids are rarely interested in stories like that. But when I was young and beautiful...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001554
Reply.text: Grandma, what's up with Ben, anyway?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001555
Reply.text: Oh, right, Ben...|No, he doesn't live in Midgard. After the changes in administration, he couldn't reach an agreement with the new mayor, stopped all of his research, left the city, and settled in the middle of nowhere. Oh, the tea must be boiling. Don't go anywhere.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001564
Reply.text: I think I have everything I need. I've got to get out of here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001556
Reply.text: I don't see anything against drinking this wonderful granny's special tea.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001557
Reply.text: Here you go, honey, your cup. Drink it gently, in small sips. Well? What do you think?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001558
Reply.text: Pretty... unusual.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001562
Reply.text: You drink while I tell you the rest of the story. Well, when I was very young, this Ben...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001563
Reply.text: It feels kind of weird...

Reply.name: Umelec_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Good afternoon.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000590
Reply.text: I need to modify my truck according to this blueprint...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000596
Reply.text: Let me see... yeah... right... It's pretty clear to me. But it's not going to work.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000597
Reply.text: But why?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000598
Reply.text: I need a significant amount of money to buy special tools for the job.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000599
Reply.text: It's not a problem. I have money.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000600
Reply.text: In addition, a rather rare material, composite, would be required. Oh, and radio-shielding covers. And if with the covers everything is quite simple, then the composite is impossible to produce in the existing conditions. But it can be obtained by melting down the existing product.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000601
Reply.text: So, where can I find all this stuff?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000602
Reply.text: They don't deliver the covers directly to Midgard, but I can order them through my channels, which, of course, will take some time. As for the composite... Let me see... I only know of one place where you might be able to find it. Try your luck at the Colosseum. It's not uncommon for fighters there to bet on various rare items, and maybe this material will turn up there too.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003302
Reply.text: I had already been there. Unfortunately, none of the fighters had the composite.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000603
Reply.text: Okay, thanks, I know where to look.

Reply.name: Umelec_hellodlg1
Reply.text: Okay. Composite and covers are there. Now the money issues. 100000 for associated expenses, 15000 for the covers and 90000 for the work itself. Totally 215000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003053
Reply.text: Don't I earn a discount? I've helped this town a little bit in the past.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003054
Reply.text: How's that?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003055
Reply.text: I escorted your caravan to Porto and back, shooting off robbers of all stripes in the process.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003056
Reply.text: Oh, yeah, I think I heard something about that. All right, we can work out a discount. Let's say 20%. Deal?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003057
Reply.text: Yes, of course.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000613
Reply.text: I don't have money yet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000612
Reply.text: Yeah, it's expensive, but the end justifies the means.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000614
Reply.text: Okay then. There's not a lot of the material, only enough for your car.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000615
Reply.text: Yeah, well, at least for my car.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000616
Reply.text: If it's no secret, what do you need such protection for? What places are you going to?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000617
Reply.text: I'm going to cross the Desert of Death.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000618
Reply.text: My God, why? Even the most technically advanced expeditions of scientists do not risk going there!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000619
Reply.text: It's a long story.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002223
Reply.text: Okay, I'm not going to talk you out of it.|Now I have everything I need, and I'm starting work right away. I'll have everything ready in about 12 hours. In the meantime, go take a walk.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002224
Reply.text: I think it's about time to see Ben.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('d_chehol3'); TakeQuest('TalkBeforeDesert'); RemoveQuestItem('quest_komp_splav'); RemoveQuestItem('quest_chehly_box'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_rem_thing', 'quest_komp_splav'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_rem_thing', 'quest_chehly_box'); AddHistory( 'r1_Before_Desert_00' ); AddFadingMsgId( 'fm_history_got' ); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002215
Reply.text: How's it going?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002216
Reply.text: There was no composite in the Colosseum.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002217
Reply.text: That's not good. To tell you the truth, I don't know any other places where you could at least theoretically find it. I haven't seen this material in decades.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002218
Reply.text: Decades... I've been hearing that number all too often lately. Can you tell me exactly who ordered your work with this material in the past?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002219
Reply.text: I'm not supposed to do this, but who would consider keeping secrets from twenty years ago. Okay, let's see. The customer's initials are I.G., and the source of the materials is his own. The type of work is armor plates for the cabin. Well, that's not much to go on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002220
Reply.text: Say no more, I know exactly who to ask about this material.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002225
Reply.text: Take the job!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002226
Reply.text: Thank you. I hope you got all the bolts tightened firmly.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002227
Reply.text: Sure! Good luck in the desert.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002228
Reply.text: Thank you. Well, there's no reason to wait, I have to go. Lisa, get in the cab! And I think we should stop at Sowth before the desert.

Reply.name: Fighter1_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Well, what a hero! Do you want to fight and win?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000606
Reply.text: I'm only interested in the reward. If only you had a composite...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000610
Reply.text: Let me think... No, I've never seen anything like that.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000611
Reply.text: What a shame...|Where should I look for him now?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002589
Reply.text: I don't know about that... But you can still fight me, since you came here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002591
Reply.text: Why not. To the arena!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002590
Reply.text: I'm not interested in arena fights. Good day to you.

Reply.name: Fighter2_hellodlg0
Reply.text: What do you want? You want to fight me in the Arena?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000607
Reply.text: Yeah, I don't mind, except I'm interested in the prize. Do you have the composite? I'm ready to fight for it!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000608
Reply.text: You're not a real fighter if you're only interested in the reward. You can ask that warrior woman over there, she's won a lot of battles... Maybe she's got one.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001565
Reply.text: Can I talk to you for a minute?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001566
Reply.text: What do you want?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001567
Reply.text: Why so rude? I want to offer my help.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001568
Reply.text: I'm sorry, I'm having a bad day. What kind of help?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001569
Reply.text: I heard you arguing with Grandma Paula. That's not nice. Why did you call her a witch? Her life is hard enough as it is, and what's more half the village thinks she's a servant of the devil.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001570
Reply.text: I honestly didn't mean to. I just need to find one person, and she can tell me exactly where to look.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001571
Reply.text: I could help you make up with her. I'll go over there and tell her that it was all a big misunderstanding, that you didn't mean to hurt nobody, and that you really want to drink her special strong tea. That's a necessary condition. Otherwise, you won't be forgiven, trust me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001572
Reply.text: Eh, I guess, I'll have to do it. But I assume you want something in return?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001573
Reply.text: Exactly. 1000000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003232
Reply.text: Okay, here you go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003233
Reply.text: Wait a minute! How did you pay me?! You shouldn't have that much money at this stage of the game!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003234
Reply.text: Well, as you can see, I have.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003235
Reply.text: No, it's not supposed to be like that. I don't have any scripts for this scenario. I do not know how to behave.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003236
Reply.text: So what are we going to do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003237
Reply.text: Look, let's replay this moment a little bit, but this time you'll play the game normally, without any cheats or anything like that. Okay? Although, you only have one answer, so it doesn't really matter what you think about it. Go ahead, hit it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003238
Reply.text: Eh, okay.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001574
Reply.text: How much??!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001575
Reply.text: Ha-ha-ha, I'm just kidding. No, I need something else from you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001576
Reply.text: And what is it?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001577
Reply.text: There's a little village not far from Eastern, called Yar. A friend of mine, Valery, lives there. I need you to give him this package. Can you do that?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001578
Reply.text: Just a delivery? I can do that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001579
Reply.text: By the way, there's also some weird stuff going on in the fields, and the whole village is scared. Try asking around, see if they have any work for you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001580
Reply.text: Got it. I'll be right there. One foot here, one foot there.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001581
Reply.text: As soon as you get back, go straight to Grandma. And don't forget about the tea.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001582
Reply.text: Of course.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001597
Reply.text: Looking for someone?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001598
Reply.text: I want Valery.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001599
Reply.text: There's no such person here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001600
Reply.text: Look, if you tell me now that I've come all this way for nothing, I'll be very upset.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001601
Reply.text: Why do I care?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001602
Reply.text: Okay, then I'll have to tell Marco from Locus that his friend doesn't live here anymore.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001603
Reply.text: Wait, so you're from Marco? Why didn't you say so in the first place? Sit down, let's have a drink!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001604
Reply.text: Thank you, but no, I'm here on business. Anyway, here's your package, and I have to go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001605
Reply.text: Wait, don't you want to make some money?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001606
Reply.text: It depends on what needs to be done.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001607
Reply.text: See that farmer sitting over there?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001608
Reply.text: I see him, he's kind of nervous.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001609
Reply.text: You'll be nervous when that kind of nonsense is going on with the fields.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001610
Reply.text: And what is happening with the fields?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001611
Reply.text: You'd better ask him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001612
Reply.text: Okay, I'll think about it. Take care.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001641
Reply.text: What did you do to piss off the Midgard guards so much that they threw you out?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003046
Reply.text: I could not protect the caravan they entrusted me to escort. Now they refuse to pay me, and they do not share information, although they promised.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001644
Reply.text: There was an arrogant guy at the museum. I had to put him down.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001645
Reply.text: Punching him to the jaw?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001646
Reply.text: No. To the stomach.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001647
Reply.text: Not bad. A drink?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001648
Reply.text: Just one mug. I still have work to do. Although I don't think I can do anything now since the road to Midgard is forbidden.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001649
Reply.text: And what do you need in Midgard?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001650
Reply.text: Find out where one explorer lives. Ben The Throttle.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001651
Reply.text: That's it? You know how to make a big fuss! I thought you needed some tricky instruments.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001652
Reply.text: What are you getting at?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001653
Reply.text: Let's do it this way: you need to know where Ben lives. And I know where he lives, but I have some problems to solve. I think you and I could have a productive partnership.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001654
Reply.text: Time to take out other people's garbage again... Well, never mind, I'm used to it. What do you need?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001655
Reply.text: To the west from Midgard, there's a path into the mountains, and at the end of it is a secret hideout. For the time being no one got into it, but for the past two weeks it had been taken over by a gang of bandits - obviously not locals.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001656
Reply.text: You have a hideout. So you're a bandit, too. Why couldn't you kick them out yourself?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001657
Reply.text: I am not a bandit. I'm a thief. If you need to sneak somewhere, come to me. I don't kill people. I don't even have a gun on my truck, because there's no reason to - all the local criminals know me and respect me. And these guys don't seem to know how things work around here. Well, too bad for them. So, will you do it?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001658
Reply.text: Okay, I'll do it. Stay here, it won't take long.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001659
Reply.text: That was fast.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001660
Reply.text: All the invaders are dead.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001661
Reply.text: How do I know you're not lying?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001662
Reply.text: I expected that question, so I brought you a couple of boxes from your hideout. Looks familiar?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001663
Reply.text: Yes, that's exactly from it. You can't find them anywhere else. Okay, good. And now one more task.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001664
Reply.text: Man, hold your horses, will you? I already did what you wanted. I'm starting to get the feeling that you don't know a damn thing about Ben, and you're just fooling me!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001665
Reply.text: Don't get so nervous. That's the last thing I'm going to ask you for.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001666
Reply.text: It better be true.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001667
Reply.text: Go down the road, turn left at the ruined bridge and you'll get to the village of Rimskoe. There's a guy named Stryga sitting in a bar.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001668
Reply.text: Stryga? In what delirium did he come up with that name?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001669
Reply.text: Never mind, it's a very long story. Stryga is an old friend of mine who used to be a contraband smuggler, but now he's legalized as an honest businessman and runs caravans all over the county.| Anyway, he was telling me recently about some difficulties with the merchandise. Go to him, find out what the problem is, and help him solve it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001670
Reply.text: Okay, but if I don't find out where Ben is after that...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001671
Reply.text: Save the flaming speeches for those who will listen to them. I'm not fooling you. Now I've got to get on the radio and tell him you'll be showing up in Rimskoe soon.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001672
Reply.text: And your radio can do that?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001673
Reply.text: Yes, it can. Yours might, too, if you were shopping for fancy electronics in Midgard instead of beating up museum workers. All right, now go. And yes, if you ever need the help of the best thief, you're welcome.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001689
Reply.text: Hey, I remember you!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001691
Reply.text: It's time to pay your debts, Salvatore!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001692
Reply.text: Debts? Ha-ha! You make me laugh. I don't remember owing you anything!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001693
Reply.text: Okay, now listen to this. After you kindly "helped" me find Ben, I seriously reconsidered my outlook on life!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001694
Reply.text: Oh yeah?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001695
Reply.text: Since the last time we saw each other, I have personally destroyed two evil metal crap-jacks guarding the passage to an old world supercomputer island and started and ended a civil war in literally one week!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001696
Reply.text: Well... I...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001697
Reply.text: And if you think I won't kill you if you say no, you're very, very wrong!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001698
Reply.text: Calm down. Don't yell so much! I'm just kidding! What do you want?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001699
Reply.text: I need skilled masters, but the way to Midgard is closed for me because of that incident in the museum. Something must be done about that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001700
Reply.text: Well, let me think. Technically, I could pick the lock, break into the archive, and destroy the record of you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001702
Reply.text: But you'll have to wait until morning. I need to prepare the tools, and the break-in itself is best to do at night.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001703
Reply.text: And what am I supposed to do all this time?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001704
Reply.text: How should I know? Show me your blueprint. Don't worry, I won't do anything to it.|Man, are you aware that you have composite as the main material?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001705
Reply.text: What does that mean?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003300
Reply.text: This means that you'll have to work hard to get it - the material is very rare.|You know what, while I'm dealing with Midgard, instead of sitting in a bar, go to the Colosseum. There's a lot of interesting artifacts at stake there, and you might find a composite there, too.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003301
Reply.text: That's not a bad idea. There's nothing to do yet, anyway.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001690
Reply.text: Did you hear that a fire just broke out in the Midgard archives? They say it was put out pretty quickly, but the list of undesirables in the city is completely burnt out.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001706
Reply.text: You are really a pro.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001707
Reply.text: Of course I am. If you need my help again, don't hesitate to ask. But next time it won't be for free.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001708
Reply.text: I'll think about it. And now I have to go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001642
Reply.text: You looking for me?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001643
Reply.text: Are you Stryga?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001675
Reply.text: And are you a Salvatore's pal?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001676
Reply.text: I'm not his pal.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001677
Reply.text: Whatever you say. In the meantime, I have a problem. The thing is that I sent a caravan a couple of hours ago, as usual...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001678
Reply.text: And according to your tone, the vehicle didn't come back.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001679
Reply.text: Bingo. You need to find out what happened to him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001680
Reply.text: It's going to be difficult. Where was the caravan heading?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001681
Reply.text: To Porto. It's down the road.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001682
Reply.text: Well, I think I should first find out if the caravan has reached its destination. I'll ask around the town.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001683
Reply.text: Young man, what do you want?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001684
Reply.text: I've ordered one thing from the merchant from Rimskoe. Do you know if the caravan has come from there yet?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001685
Reply.text: No. And this is very strange, usually his caravans always arrive on time.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001686
Reply.text: Do you know what could have delayed it so much? Because I had already prepaid for it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001687
Reply.text: You think the trader has deceived you? Believe me, it's very unlikely. It's more probable that the caravan was attacked by bandits. Not so long ago, a gang set up camp right next to the trade route. Poor fellows, they don't know that's no way to do business in these lands... |Maybe they had something to do with it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001688
Reply.text: Most likely. All right, I won't bother you any further.

Reply.name: NormalEndingDlg
Reply.text: You're back! Come on, tell me what happened to you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002429
Reply.text: Lisa, it's good to see you in good health! You wouldn't believe how much has happened in the last few days. To begin with what I saw in the eastern part of the desert...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002459
Reply.text: It's unbelievable! A flying Oracle, two alien ships...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002460
Reply.text: Trust me, Ben, if I hadn't seen it in person, I wouldn't have believed it myself.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002461
