Reply.text: And this choice you made... Are you sure you did the right thing?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002463
Reply.text: No, I'm not. To be honest, I didn't trust both the Oracle and the aliens. I just chose the least evil. If the aliens really wanted to invade us, they would have done it many decades ago. There was nothing we could do to stop them.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002465
Reply.text: You're right. I only hope that in the future this will not lead to the genocide of the human race.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002467
Reply.text: Yeah. I don't think we have anything but hope left.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002462
Reply.text: No, I'm not. To be honest, I didn't trust both the Oracle and the aliens. I just chose the least evil.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002464
Reply.text: The Oracle was designed by humans, which means it acts in the interests of humans. If he thinks the aliens are a threat, I totally agree with him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002466
Reply.text: Yeah. I don't think we have anything but hope left.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002468
Reply.text: All right, enough about the future! Let's get on with the present. We found Ivan. I mean, we found out what happened to him. Mission accomplished. What do you plan to do next? Go back to your homeland and live the boring life of a farmer?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002469
Reply.text: No way! I've got so used to the constant travelling that I'll never be able to settle down anywhere completely again. There are a lot of roads open for me, so all I have to do is to choose where to go. What about you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002470
Reply.text: Same. Road and explorations is my whole life. I can't just leave it like that.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002471
Reply.text: I know what you mean.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002472
Reply.text: I can't say I'm very happy about it, but I'm at least glad because you're both doing what you like to do.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002473
Reply.text: Wise words, Ben! Now let's celebrate the end of this long adventure! I'd like to propose a toast. Thank you all, my friends. Without your help, I don't think I could have done it. Cheers!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003274
Reply.text: Wow! Is that my vehicle?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003275
Reply.text: Indeed, it looks exactly as if...
Reply.scriptResult: if IsQuestComplete('BenNormalEnd') then GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount( 5 ) elseif IsQuestComplete('BenGoodEnd') then GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount( 7 ) end StartConversation('Ben')

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003278
Reply.text: Well, it's not exactly like yours, of course, but I tried very hard to make it as similar as possible...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003279
Reply.text: Wow! Really, it's no difference from the outside.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003280
Reply.text: Outside - yes. But if you'll look under the hood... Come on, Lisa, I'll show you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003281
Reply.text: I'd love to join in.
Reply.scriptResult: GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount( 6 ); SetVar('BenDwelPosition', 'LisaNewCar'); if IsQuestComplete('BenGoodEnd') then good_ending = 1 end; TActivate('NextHoursTr'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003282
Reply.text: You won't even stay for one more night?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003283
Reply.text: I think I've had enough of bothering you. All's well that ends well, but the road does not wait. Will you go with me, Lisa?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003284
Reply.text: I will go. But not with you. You were right in saying that it's over. And where the one adventure ends...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003286
Reply.text: ...immediately the other one begins. I understand. Well, see you later, Ben! I'll be stopping by, you'll see!

Reply.name: GoodEndingDlg
Reply.text: You're finally back! How glad I am that you are alive and well!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002475
Reply.text: Lisa! Very glad to see you in good health too! Come on, tell me how you got there!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002476
Reply.text: No, you go first! Your story will be more interesting.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002477
Reply.text: All right. Anyway, after you left, I went to the very east of the Desert...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002478
Reply.text: And when we got to Argen, I said goodbye to the elders, and I went straight here!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002479
Reply.text: Through the Librium? By the way, how is it now after the war?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002480
Reply.text: Better than before the war. The standard of living has risen considerably, and food is plentiful. The anti-militarists turned out to be very far-sighted politicians!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002481
Reply.text: That's great. It means I have chosen the right side.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002482
Reply.text: By the way, about the choice. I know that there's no turn back, but are you sure that destroying the alien ship was the right decision?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002483
Reply.text: To be honest, I...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002484
Reply.text: Who cares! To me, both options were risky, but you are right - there's no turn back from now on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002485
Reply.text: If only Ivan could have been saved...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002486
Reply.text: Don't blame yourself, Ivan knew exactly what he was doing. After all, you finished the job he started. If he were here, he'd probably be proud of you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002487
Reply.text: Yeah, I guess...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002488
Reply.text: What do you plan to do next? Will you continue to travel around the world?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002489
Reply.text: I don't think so. I've done what I wanted, learned about Ivan's fate, and I've had enough of all these long drives. I guess I'll go back to Krai. The bartender there offered me a house in Gugulino. I would settle there and live a quiet life of a farmer.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002490
Reply.text: Well, good choice. What about you, Lisa?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002491
Reply.text: Yes, Lisa, what are you going to do? Surely you'll find another target comparable to Ivan's search.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002492
Reply.text: I thought about it. But to tell you the truth, I'm sick of it all. The endless nomadic life, gathering of information, intrigues, thefts... I just looked at myself from the outside, and what I saw scared the hell out of me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002493
Reply.text: Is it so?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002494
Reply.text: I don't want any more adventures, I've had enough of them. I guess I'll just have to settle down and do boring stuff, too. This whole thing with Ivan has taught me that you must always be able to stop in time, or something terrible and unrecoverable might happen. And I feel like I need to do that now.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002495
Reply.text: Well, if that's the case, would you like to come with me? My lands is sparsely populated, I'm sure there will be a free house for you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002496
Reply.text: I was hoping you'd suggest that.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002497
Reply.text: That's wonderful! Now let's celebrate the end of this long adventure! A toast! Thank you all, my friends. Without your help, I don't think I could have done it. Cheers!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002498
Reply.text: Leaving already?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002499
Reply.text: Yeah. It was good, but now it's time for us to go to Krai.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002500
Reply.text: Good luck to you! Don't forget the old man!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002501
Reply.text: Absolutely not, we'll definitely come visit you on the weekends!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002502
Reply.text: One more thing. Could you stop by Locus on the way and give this package to a one cute granny?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002503
Reply.text: To Grandma Paula?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002504
Reply.text: Wow, I didn't think you knew her! Yeah, that's for her. And tell her it's from Ben.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002505
Reply.text: All right, I'll be sure to give it to her! Well, Lisa, are you ready?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002506
Reply.text: Ready! Well, we're off! Bye, Father!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002507
Reply.text: See you soon, Ben!
Reply.scriptResult: GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount( 8 ); TakeQuest('StartCalmLife'); StopPlayingCustomMusic(); AddQuestItem('Lisa_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_poput', 'Lisa_P'); AddQuestItem('quest_babka_package'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_thing', 'quest_babka_package'); TActivate('LisaFollowsUsGoodEnd'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002508
Reply.text: Who knocks at my door?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002511
Reply.text: Grandma Paula! Good to see you!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002512
Reply.text: Oh, dear, come in, don't be shy! Oh, there's more than one! Come on, come on in, let me make you some tea!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002513
Reply.text: I have a package here for you. It's from Ben.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002514
Reply.text: From Ben?! I can't believe he still remembers me! I'm so relieved! Come on in, don't be shy!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002515
Reply.text: And really, why not to drink a tea before the road.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002516
Reply.text: Here you go. Just drink it in small sips.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003241
Reply.text: It's that strange feeling again...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002517
Reply.text: It turned out delicious, thank you!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002518
Reply.text: Thank you for visiting the old one! And a special thanks for the package! I can't believe Ben still hasn't forgotten me. I should go visit him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002519
Reply.text: I bet he'll will be very pleased! Well, thank you for your hospitality, but we have to go now!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002509
Reply.text: Phew, I thought we'd never be able to escape from her place.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002521
Reply.text: What a beautiful granny!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002522
Reply.text: You don't say. Okay, let's keep going.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002523
Reply.text: Yeah, let's go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002510
Reply.text: My goodness, I can't believe my eyes! Come on, tell me what's happened to you since you left!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002524
Reply.text: It's a very long and fascinating story, Dronn! I'll tell you all about it someday. Remember when you said you had a house in Gugulino? Is it still empty?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002525
Reply.text: Yeah, it's empty. I even cleaned it up three days ago, like I had a feeling you were coming. There's plenty of space, even for two. The headman has the keys, and I'll tell him you'll be here soon.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002526
Reply.text: Tell him? The last time we talked, you couldn't even reach Zaimka on the radio!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002527
Reply.text: Those times are in the past. Now merchants from the south sell a lot of useful stuff here straight from Midgard, so we live much better now than when you left.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002528
Reply.text: That's good to hear. All right, we're going to Gugulino to settle in.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002529
Reply.text: All right, then I won't keep you any longer. But don't forget that you still owe me the story of your adventures!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002530
Reply.text: Ha-ha-ha, don't worry, I'll be sure to tell you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002576
Reply.text: No more tea for you. The time has come.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002577
Reply.text: You again!|What the... Where has everyone gone? Lisa, the old woman... What the hell are you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002578
Reply.text: That's exactly what I want to talk to you about. But we're not going to talk here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002579
Reply.text: Hey, what the...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003170
Reply.text: What would you like?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003171
Reply.text: I need these medications now!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003172
Reply.text: Yes, we have those. Wait a minute...|That'll be 11000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003384
Reply.text: I don't have that much money yet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003173
Reply.text: Here, take it.|And now hurry up to Ben!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002428
Reply.text: I have bought the necessary medicines.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002438
Reply.text: Is everything all right? Why are you alone? Where's Lisa?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002440
Reply.text: Ben, say something.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002441
Reply.text: Lisa... My little daughter...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002442
Reply.text: What happened?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002443
Reply.text: My little girl... She died... Do you understand?! She's dead!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002444
Reply.text: No... No! It can't be! I took her out of the desert! I bought medicine! She was supposed to wake up!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002446
Reply.text: How did this happen?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002447
Reply.text: She just stopped breathing and never regained consciousness. I don't think any medicine would have helped...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002448
Reply.text: No... It can't be true! Why her?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002449
Reply.text: I thought hard about all this. It's not your fault. I'm the one who taught her this "exploratory spirit" since she was a kid. And I didn't tell her the importance of stopping in time. Twenty years ago, that attitude killed Ivan. And now it killed my daughter.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002450
Reply.text: Ben, it's not your fault, you couldn't predict it!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002451
Reply.text: I've already decided what to do; you can't convince me otherwise.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002452
Reply.text: Decided what? Ben, what are you talking about? Did you...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002453
Reply.text: I have lost everything I ever loved. I have neither the desire nor the strength to go on living.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002455
Reply.text: Do you see this device? It's a detonator. As soon as I release the button, this hut will blow up. I don't want to get you killed too, so you'd better go. Quickly.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002456
Reply.text: Ben, you know that's not the solution! Don't do this!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002457
Reply.text: I have nothing more to say to you. Forgive me. And goodbye.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002458
Reply.text: Farewell, Ben.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002431
Reply.text: What happened?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002432
Reply.text: I... I don't know. Everything was fine, we were trying to find clues about Ivan's fate, and then suddenly she just passed out.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002433
Reply.text: Oh, I told her not to go to that damn desert.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002434
Reply.text: Is there anything I can do to help?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002435
Reply.text: Yes. Go to Midgard and get these medicines. They should help her. Just hurry up!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002436
Reply.text: I'll try as fast as I can.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('r4m2_LisaDieBen'); StopPlayingCustomMusic(); RemoveQuestItem('Lisa_P'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_fem_poput', 'Lisa_P'); GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount(4); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Ben_hellodlg0
Reply.text: How can I help you?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002622
Reply.text: I'm sorry to bother you, but I'm looking for someone... Ben... Ben The Throttle. He's an explorer and lives somewhere around here...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz322
Reply.text: Are you Ben The Throttle?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz324
Reply.text: Yes, Ben The Throttle, that's me... You sound very familiar... No, it can't be! Ivan?! You?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz325
Reply.text: I'm sorry, but I don't know who you're talking about. My father... my stepfather... he was killed. Before he died, he gave me this disk and this letter and told me to find you. So now I stand here and I don't know what to do next.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz326
Reply.text: It can't be... You come in, don't hesitate. I'll be right with you. I need a drink. Do you want one?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz327
Reply.text: Why not. You mentioned someone named Ivan. Who's that?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz328
Reply.text: Finish your drink first. There, that's better. Ivan is your real father.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz329
Reply.text: So this letter was written by him?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz330
Reply.text: Yes, that's his handwriting.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz331
Reply.text: Wait, how do you know all this?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz332
Reply.text: Your father and I are very old friends. We worked together in Midgard a long time ago. We were both explorers, but Ivan was much more accomplished than I was. Of course, it's in his blood. His father, his grandfather, they all worked hard to make the world a better place.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz333
Reply.text: If they were all explorers, why didn't Ivan leave me in Midgard? Why did he leave me with Peter in a godforsaken village on the edge of the world? I want to talk to him. Do you know where he is?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz334
Reply.text: No. And no one knows. He's gone missing. Twenty years ago.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz335
Reply.text: Twenty years ago... Not long after I was born... Did he tell you anything before he disappeared?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz336
Reply.text: He talked about his research. About discovering something very important. So important, in fact, that it might fundamentally change our world.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz337
Reply.text: Did he tell you exactly what he discovered?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz338
Reply.text: No. But that's what made him take you to the edge of the world. He did everything he could to make sure you'd never know where he was going. And believe me, for a reason. What he found out changed him. He literally became obsessed with it. He left you at Peter's, said goodbye to me after that, and no one ever saw him again.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz339
Reply.text: So you don't know where did he go?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_xyz340
Reply.text: No. And I really don't want you to try to find out. If Ivan chose to protect you from all this, there must have been a very, very good reason for it. Are you ready for that truth to be revealed to you?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_xyz341
Reply.text: Ben, I have nothing left now. Just a few days ago I had a house, a job, friends, even girl I liked. And in an instant, I've lost everything. I need purpose. Meaning. Something worth living for. And now you're telling me to give it all up and stay away. No, it doesn't work like this!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001740
Reply.text: I didn't expect any other answer. But there's not much I can do for you. I don't know anything about Ivan's research or where he might have gone.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001741
Reply.text: Can people of Midgard know about it?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001742
Reply.text: I don't think so. As far as I know, all of Ivan's later research was done in his home, in Vaterland. The most logical place to start searching would be there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001743
Reply.text: Thank you very much. One more thing: I didn't take it into account at first, but before my village was attacked, I met a mysterious girl in a fast car. She was looking for an object that looked a lot like this disk. She said it would help her in her search for some explorer. Could it be that she was talking about Ivan?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001744
Reply.text: Her name is Lisa?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001745
Reply.text: Yes, but how do you know?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001746
Reply.text: She is my daughter. She continues my work. Only I live a settled way of life and restore the mechanisms of the old world from books and documents, while she discovers new technologies by traveling everywhere.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001747
Reply.text: How did she find out about Ivan?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001748
Reply.text: When she was a child, I told her a lot about him. She even saw him at work a couple of times and was very fascinated. I don't know what exactly triggered her to start searching for him, but the foundation was laid when she was a child.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001749
Reply.text: I see. If she contacts you, tell her where I went. I could use such an ally in my search.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001750
Reply.text: I will. Now give me the map so I can show you where your father lived.|Here. Ask in this town. They should still remember him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001751
Reply.text: I leave immediately. Now I have hope.
Reply.scriptResult: GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount( 1 ); TakeQuest('d_FindRealFatherRoom_Quest'); AddHistory( 'r1_After_Ben_00' ); AddFadingMsgId( 'fm_history_got' ); StopPlayingCustomMusic(); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002081
Reply.text: Oh, you're back already? Did you succeed in finding the Oracle? Did he tell you where to look for Ivan?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002082
Reply.text: Ben, I'd love to chat and discuss everything that's happened to me, but I'm in a really, really hurry right now!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002093
Reply.text: Okay, how can I help you?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002094
Reply.text: Do you know where Lisa is right now? Is she here? Ben, if she's here, tell her I'm not mad, I just want the damn disk!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002095
Reply.text: Oh, my God, what has she done?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002096
Reply.text: I found Ivan's second disc and was on my way to the Oracle with it, but halfway through she stole it from me!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002097
Reply.text: I knew she was up to something! I shouldn't have told her about you going to find lvan!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002098
Reply.text: Don't blame yourself, I'm the one who asked you to tell her about it. But you could have helped me a lot.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002100
Reply.text: If Lisa isn't here, then she's hiding somewhere. I know for a fact that she passed through Pesht, but I have lost her trail further on.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002101
Reply.text: She could have gone to Librium.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002103
Reply.text: Librium. To the north of Pesht there is the city of Asgard. Somewhere near there is a tunnel through the mountains that leads to Librium. If she could go anywhere, it would be there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002104
Reply.text: Why are you so sure of that?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002105
Reply.text: She spent several years there, made a lot of contacts. She even told me that some local dictator had fallen in love with her.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002106
Reply.text: It's doubtful...|Are there other places where she can hide?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002107
Reply.text: If there are, I don't know about them.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002108
Reply.text: In that case, I'll have to look for that tunnel...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002109
Reply.text: If I'm right and you do find her there, please don't hurt her. Just take the disks! If my girl gets hurt because I helped you now, I won't forgive myself!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002110
Reply.text: Don't worry, I swear to you I'll just take the disks and that's it. Thanks again! Someday, when this is all over, I'll stop by and tell you everything I've been through.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002111
Reply.text: I hope so. And I hope you'll be with Ivan.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002112
Reply.text: So am I. Well, now I have to go!
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('LisaUBena'); TakeQuest('r1m3_ToLisaToAsgard'); StopPlayingCustomMusic(); AddHistory( 'r1_Lisa_Thief_00' ); AddFadingMsgId( 'fm_history_got' ); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002604
Reply.text: That was fast, wasn't it? Did the Midgard master take the order?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002605
Reply.text: No, there are difficulties with the material: it is impossible to find composite anywhere. But I know that someone with the initials I and G also ordered similar work and brought the material himself.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002606
Reply.text: I and G... There certainly couldn't be any mistake here! Ivan knew the place where the composite could be found.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002607
Reply.text: Ben, of the three of us, you know Ivan best. Do you have any idea where he might have found it?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002608
Reply.text: No, not at all. The scientists of Midgard know every source of even the most minimally useful resources, and composite is a material worth its weight in gold. Everything Ivan knew is already known in Midgard, except...|No, that's nonsense!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002609
Reply.text: What? What did Ivan know that was so exclusive? Ben, any information is important right now!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002610
Reply.text: A realm of eternal cold. A place where you can't see the earth or the sky. Ivan had mentioned it once, but I couldn't tell if he was joking or not.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002611
Reply.text: A realm of eternal cold? A place without earth or sky? Sounds like a fairy tale.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002612
Reply.text: But still, it's our only lead. Do we have any idea where to look for this realm of eternal cold?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002613
Reply.text: No. I know a lot of places with different climates, of course, but I've never heard of anything like that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002615
Reply.text: So let's assume that the road there must begin at the coldest point in the world we already know. I think we should start looking in Hel.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002616
Reply.text: Your words make sense. I haven't seen any road in those parts myself, but there's a fisherman who'll share any local secrets for a bottle of ananaga. He helped me find the Sea Gate. Perhaps he knows something about the road to the realm of the cold? I might try Minin, too - one of the local miners once mentioned the "Realm of Eternal Cold" when talking to me. Maybe he knows something too...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002614
Reply.text: That sounds reasonable. But maybe you shouldn't go that far. You're going to travel to the lands no one knows anything about at all.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002617
Reply.text: I don't like it myself, but I don't see any other way to find this material. Don't worry, Ben, we don't even know if this area really exists yet. Maybe Ivan just bought the composite from some wandering merchant, we can't deny that either...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002618
Reply.text: You're right, I shouldn't rush things. Anyway, here you go. It's the only book in which I could find any mention of these lands. Read it when you get a chance.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002619
Reply.text: Of course.|Okay, since our immediate goals are clear, I'd prefer to get some rest now, and then head to Hel tomorrow.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002620
Reply.text: So it's all settled. I'll stay here in case you need anything, and Midgard is close by, so it'll be easier to get what you need. So you go on your own for now, and I'll catch up with you later.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002621
Reply.text: All right, that's what we'll do. And now I'm going to rest!
Reply.scriptResult: if not(IsQuestComplete('FinalBattle_Quest')) then GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount(3) TActivate('NextDayTr') StopPlayingCustomMusic() EndConversation() end

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002644
Reply.text: Oh, and one more thing... I've heard of your contribution in Librium's war with Argen.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002645
Reply.text: I'm sorry, but I'd rather not discuss it now.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002646
Reply.text: I'm not going to discuss it. I want to thank you. You see, I have a lot of familiars and close friends in both the CIT and CD, and it was very painful for me to see them die for someone else's interests.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002647
Reply.text: But I've killed a lot of people at that war too...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002648
Reply.text: Yeah, but you chose the right side. You saved many innocent lives. You care about that people in the first place, even though your goal was to find me as quickly as possible.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002649
Reply.text: I have to admit that I didn't even think about it...I just did what I thought was right.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002650
Reply.text: And thank you very much for that.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003184
Reply.text: Speaking of which, how is Odette doing?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003186
Reply.text: She... She died. Help came too late...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003190
Reply.text: I'm sorry to hear that, she was a great person and she died fighting for a righteous cause.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003191
Reply.text: Yeah, probably...|But I have a haunting feeling that all this could have been avoided.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003192
Reply.text: Maybe so...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003185
Reply.text: Oh, she's much better now. She got treatment in time and is now recovering.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003187
Reply.text: I'm very glad to hear that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003188
Reply.text: All right, enough about the war! I'm going to rest, too.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003189
Reply.text: Yes, we all should. Tomorrow begins a new adventure.

Reply.name: Ben_hellodlg2
Reply.text: You're finally back!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000621
Reply.text: Good to see you, Ben! It's been quite an adventure, but it's not over yet. The next goal is to cross the Desert of Death.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000620
Reply.text: Yeah, about the desert...|Maybe you shouldn't go that far? I realize that this is the first time we're having clues about Ivan's location, but you all are going to go to a very dangerous lands.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000622
Reply.text: All? So Lisa's coming with me, too?

Reply.name: Ben_hellodlg3
Reply.text: And what happened in Volozh?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000653
Reply.text: It's nothing, never mind. I guess I'm just being overdramatic.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000654
Reply.text: No, I won't let it go that easy! After all, Lisa is my only daughter! Tell me what happened.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000655
Reply.text: Ben, to be honest, I don't understand exactly what it was. It's better let Lisa tell you, while I'll go to have a rest.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002203
Reply.text: Yes, I am. You got problems with that?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002210
Reply.text: Well, I thought that after what you felt in Volozh the other day, you might want to get some rest.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002992
Reply.text: That's ridiculous! I'm totally fine!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002993
Reply.text: All right, all right, whatever you say.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002211
Reply.text: Okay, but it's really not worth it at all. Even though I have no idea what it was myself. So, as soon as we crossed the mountains...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002212
Reply.text: [Go away to rest].

Reply.name: CS_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Finally, some new people in this shitty little tavern! Boy, can I offer you a glass of ananaga?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001467
Reply.text: No, I don't think so.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001468
Reply.text: Eh, what kind of people are these days! Where are your manners?! It's not decent to refuse a treat, especially ananaga.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001469
Reply.text: I'm sorry if I offended you, but I really don't want to. How about some other time?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001470
Reply.text: Well... *blurp*... Some other time then.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001471
Reply.text: I'd better go.

Reply.name: CS_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: That's what I call a man of my own! Drink up!

Reply.name: CS_hellodlg0_P1
Reply.text: Of course!

Reply.name: CS_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: Phew, strong stuff...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001472
Reply.text: Well! Grandma's recipe! You want more?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001473
Reply.text: Absolutely! As they say, there's a little break between the first glass and the second!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001474
Reply.text: What are you doing here by the way?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001475
Reply.text: Just a little business... My father let me go on a trip alone for the first time - it's kind of my birthday today, I guess.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001476
Reply.text: Oh, yeah?! Boy, this calls for a drink!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001478
Reply.text: There's the full bottle. I'll get some more, don't go anywhere!!!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001479
Reply.text: What kind of ananaga is this? Only three glasses, and I'm already boozed up.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001480
Reply.text: Well! I did it myself! And before that, my Grandma made it! This ain't the crap they serve in the Sowth! This is... what's it called... a family recipe... That's it! Cheers!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001481
Reply.text: Cheers! Can you tell me this recipe? Because I'm sick of drinking all sorts of crap they serve in every village here!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001482
Reply.text: Well, since you're old enough... Huh, you know, one smart guy here told me that in the old world it wasn't the parents who decided when their child had to go out into the world, but that everyone became of legal age after a certain period! That's it!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001483
Reply.text: What a nonsense! And what if a person isn't ready yet? Like one of my friends in Glukhoe! It's his fortieth fall, and still no mind, no responsibility!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001484
Reply.text: Let me tell you something, kid... I don't know how they were thinking in that old world... But certainly not with their heads! Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha! Cheers!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001485
Reply.text: I don't feel good...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001486
Reply.text: Hold on boy! It'll be over in five minutes!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001487
Reply.text: Yes, probably ... So what we were talking about? Oh yes, the recipe! So, are you going to tell it to me?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001488
Reply.text: I'll tell you... If you help me with one thing!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001489
Reply.text: No problem!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001490
Reply.text: There's a guy who used to come into our village. And if he only came, no one would say a word to him, but he... let's just say... he's behaving not very nice to our girls.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001491
Reply.text: How so?! And you still put up with this?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001492
Reply.text: He's kind of a member of Felix's Gang, a tough gangster. That's why everyone is afraid to say a word to him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001493
Reply.text: Something must be done about it! We have to get the bastard away from our women!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001494
Reply.text: That's what I think too, buddy! Right now is a good time, there are hardly any guards in his hiding place. I say we go in there and teach these fools a lesson! You in?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001495
Reply.text: Of course, I'm in! No one dares to offend our women! Let's go! As soon as I finish my drink...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001496
Reply.text: Hey, Dmitro! Get your truck ready! Let's go talk to that hotshot! Kid, you ready?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001497
Reply.text: Ready as I'll ever be! Let's go!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001498
Reply.text: Wow, kid, you're a brave warrior!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001499
Reply.text: This bastard deserved it!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001500
Reply.text: Of course he did. Bah, you're getting sober already! How's your headache?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001501
Reply.text: Oddly enough, but my head doesn't hurt.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001502
Reply.text: It's not odd! It's real ananaga, not Sowth's garbage! Speaking of the recipe, here you go! But just promise not to tell anyone else! And that you will not sell it! I'm going to maintain a monopoly here, you see.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001503
Reply.text: I swear - only for personal use! Well, maybe I'll treat a couple of friends, but nothing more.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001504
Reply.text: Thanks for everything, kid! Drop by sometime, maybe we'll smash some more bandit camps.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001505
Reply.text: As soon as possible. All the best!

Reply.name: WorkGiver_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Hey, driver, there's a job to do!
Reply.scriptCondition: not(IsQuestTaken( 'WorkGiver_Quest1' )) and (GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() == 0) and not(IsQuestComplete( 'TalkWithFather_Quest' )) and IsQuestComplete('Buyer_Quest1')

Reply.name: WorkGiver_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: Of course I'm talking to you! I saw you talking to Sergo. I have something to do with him before he leaves here for good, but I don't have the necessary papers with me.

Reply.name: WorkGiver_hellodlg0_2
Reply.text: Stop playing fool! Boy, you take me to the gas station, which is near the bridge, I pick up the documents, and you take me back. Deal?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001454
Reply.text: I don't have time to carry your body, I have other things to do.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001455
Reply.text: Well, go to hell then, just wasted my time!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001456
Reply.text: What a polite man...

Reply.name: WorkGiver_hellodlg0_P1
Reply.text: You talking to me?

Reply.name: WorkGiver_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: So, what does this have to do with me?

Reply.name: WorkGiver_hellodlg0_P1_2
Reply.text: Deal! Get in the cab!

Reply.name: WorkGiver_hellodlg1
Reply.text: What, you changed your mind? Too late, that ship has sailed. I made a deal with another driver! Get out of my sight!

Reply.name: WorkGiver_hellodlg1_P1
Reply.text: But I was just walking by...

Reply.name: WorkGiver_hellodlg2
Reply.text: Damn, what a piece of junk your car is! I'm surprised we made it. You know, I'll find another vehicle to drive me back. Get lost!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000558
Reply.text: What about the money?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000559
Reply.text: Money? What money? Did I say one word to you in the Sowth's bar about money?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000557
Reply.text: No, but…

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001452
Reply.text: That's it! Now go take a walk! I still have to prepare the documents.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001453
Reply.text: Damn it! Fooled me...

Reply.name: Medik_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Hey man, interested in easy money?
Reply.scriptCondition: (GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() == 0) and not(IsQuestItemPresent( 'quest_medicine_box' )) and not(IsQuestComplete( 'r1m1_Botanik_Quest' )) and not(IsQuestFailed( 'r1m1_Botanik_Quest' )) and not(QuestStatus('TalkWithFather_Quest')==Q_COMPLETED)

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000561
Reply.text: I'm all ears.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001434
Reply.text: There's an abandoned hospital in the surrounding area that I'm sure has something valuable. In fact, I even know a man who would be happy to buy any item you find there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001435
Reply.text: And you will gladly share this information with me if I pay you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001436
Reply.text: Absolutely. 250 coins. And no bargaining.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001437
Reply.text: That's suspicious. Why don't you go over there yourself? Since it's so easy money.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001438
Reply.text: Man, I don't even have a truck! I'm just a country boy who sells information for a living. If you don't want to, don't pay, I'm not forcing you to!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001527
Reply.text: I don't have that much.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001440
Reply.text: No, it's too dangerous. Look for another fool.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001443
Reply.text: I'm offering a dandy job, and you're looking for a trick in it. Which one of us is a fool?|Well, anyway, have a nice day. I'm out of here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001444
Reply.text: So long.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001439
Reply.text: All right, you got me. Here's your 250 coins. Tell me about it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001441
Reply.text: Do you know the village of Troitskoe? Well, there is a path next to it that leads to the hills. Go straight ahead and turn right at the crossroads. If you don't get it wrong, you'll come to a huge ruin. That's the abandoned hospital. Just keep in mind that the bandits know about this place too, so stay alert. You can sell what you find to the hermit who lives on the mountain near the road to Vaterland.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001442
Reply.text: Got it. And it better be true.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001445
Reply.text: I swear on my honest name!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001446
Reply.text: All right, goodbye!

Reply.name: Oldsolder_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Hey, rookie! Don't you want to hear an old soldier's tales? And buy me a drink while you're at it?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001526
Reply.text: I would, but I don't have the money.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000573
Reply.text: There is no time to listen to your stories!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000564
Reply.text: Why not? Bartender, give this old guy a shot of your special drink! I'll pay for it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_000578
Reply.text: Well, listen to this. My partner and I used to work as drivers on a loaded commercial vehicle. You know, the one with the trailer. Although you shouldn't know, there's no such thing in these lands. Anyway, we drove all day long, and in the evening we were very hungry. So we found some village near the highway, bought some corn there and a jar of canned stew. So, here we are, sitting and eating.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_000579
Reply.text: And what's next?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001447
Reply.text: My mug is empty!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001449
Reply.text: Well, then go to hell with your stories.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001448
Reply.text: Bartender! Do it again!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001450
Reply.text: Well, here we are. We're sitting there eating, and a Lorry parks right in front of us. Cab light turns on, and there are two of them, a man and a woman. They started to undress slowly, we thought they were going to sleep, but then we looked and there they were already indulging in carnal pleasures. Boy, I've seen a lot in this life, but this...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001451
Reply.text: What? Tell me more!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001457
Reply.text: My mug will not fill itself.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001459
Reply.text: Forget about it. I already know where you're going with this.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001458
Reply.text: Oh, yeah. Refill it, bartender! More!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001460
Reply.text: That's another thing. Well, like I said, I'd never seen anything like that before. How he spun her, both ways, in and out... They must have been tumbling for half an hour! I'll tell you the truth, watching it, I almost grabbed my partner and... But never mind, forget it. So that's how it ended... You know what to do.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001464
Reply.text: Your stories are crap, I'm out of here.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001462
Reply.text: Anyway, they had enough of each other, got dressed quickly, and left. I had lost all appetite, so I got out of the car to find a local chick, and I saw that our trailer had all four wheels screwed off! What a bastards! Not only did I spend all the money on new tires instead of girls, but my employer refused to compensate me my expenses. That's the story, kid.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001463
Reply.text: And what is the moral?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001465
Reply.text: Moral? I don't know. You asked for a story. Here's a story. Make up your own moral!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001466
Reply.text: Okay, thanks anyway. All the best to you!

Reply.name: Botanik_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Hello, stranger! I rarely see new faces! How did you even get here?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001507
Reply.text: A guy from Zaimka told me that you buy all kinds of rare stuff.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001509
Reply.text: That's right. And what have you got?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001520
Reply.text: Nothing so far.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001510
Reply.text: That's the box with the red cross on it. I don't know what it is, but it looks pretty valuable.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001506
Reply.text: I suddenly realized that my father and I used to drive by your house all the time, but I never got a chance to stop by. I decided to make up for it today.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001508
Reply.text: Well, you're welcome. And I must inform you that you have stumbled upon another trader. Only I'm not buying potatoes, I'm buying a variety of rare things. If you find anything around here that looks valuable, show it to me. If it's really valuable, I'll pay you handsomely.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001519
Reply.text: Okay, I'll keep that in mind. But so far I don't have anything like that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001521
Reply.text: In that case, I won't interrupt you any further.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001522
Reply.text: I need to explore the ruins around here. Maybe I'll find something.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001511
Reply.text: Rarities, you say? I was recently in the ruins of the old hospital and found a package like this. It looks valuable.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001512
Reply.text: Let me see. Well... It looks like a first aid kit. It's worth a lot of money, but unfortunately I can't pay you at the moment. I can offer you one valuable gun that I recently finished restoring. It's in perfect condition, but it's unlikely you'll be able to mount it on your car.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001514
Reply.text: Sounds interesting, but no. I might need this kit myself someday...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001515
Reply.text: As you wish.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001516
Reply.text: See you later.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001513
Reply.text: Ok, give it to me.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001517
Reply.text: So we have a deal.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001518
Reply.text: I hope I won't regret it.
Reply.scriptResult: TakeQuest('r1m1_Botanik_Quest'); CompleteQuest('r1m1_Botanik_Quest'); RemoveQuestItem('quest_medicine_box'); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_rem_thing', 'quest_medicine_box'); AddPlayerItemsWithBox( 'vector01', 1, 0, CVector(2141, 361, 2742)); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001523
Reply.text: Greetings again. Did you find anything?
Reply.scriptCondition: GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() > 0 and not(IsQuestComplete( 'r1m1_Botanik_Quest' )) and not(IsQuestFailed( 'r1m1_Botanik_Quest' )) and not(QuestStatus('d_FindRealFatherRoom_Quest')==Q_COMPLETED)

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001525
Reply.text: Nothing so far.

Reply.name: Buyer_hellodlg0
Reply.text: I'm listening, young man. Is there something you want?

Reply.name: Buyer_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: Ah, you must be Peter's son. How is your father? Did he willingly let you go alone on the trip?

Reply.name: Buyer_hellodlg0_2
Reply.text: Yeah, about the next deals... Unfortunately, today is the last time I'm in the Sowth. You and your father will have to find another trader.

Reply.name: Buyer_hellodlg0_P1
Reply.text: Good afternoon, Sergo. I have this package for you. Regular delivery from the Glukhoe village.

Reply.name: Buyer_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: Frankly speaking, I still can't believe it myself. He's doing well, his housekeeping is all good. Not much has happened since the last trip. Our village is in the middle of nowhere, nothing really happens.

Reply.name: Buyer_hellodlg0_P1_2
Reply.text: But why?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001378
Reply.text: Travelling south is proving to be quite expensive. "The Northern Way" has decided to stop them. Today is the last time I'm here to finish all of my business.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001379
Reply.text: I'm very sad to hear that. You have always offered the best price. Am I correct in assuming that only traders from the south will be staying in our area from now on?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001380
Reply.text: Yes. It's much easier for them to get here, and bandits attack less often. Don't worry, there's a lot of fertile land in these areas. Everybody needs food, so there will always be people who want to buy your products.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001381
Reply.text: All right, if that's the case. Thank you for your cooperation and have a nice day.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001382
Reply.text: Thank you and your father, too. Give him my regards. And don't forget the money for the goods.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001383
Reply.text: Oh, yes, it completely slipped my mind. I'll be sure to pass that on. Have a nice day.
Reply.scriptResult: SetRadarUpgrade(1); AddPlayerMoney(200); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_rem_thing', 'quest_potato'); RemoveQuestItem('quest_potato'); CompleteQuest( 'Buyer_Quest1' ); AddBook('r1_book_the_mask'); GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount( 1 ); TDeactivate('ZASADA_1'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Buyer_hellodlg1
Reply.text: You helped me a lot. Say hello to your father for me.

Reply.name: Buyer_hellodlg1_P1
Reply.text: I'll be sure to tell him.

Reply.name: Father_hellodlg0
Reply.text: You haven't left yet?

Reply.name: Father_hellodlg0_P1
Reply.text: Not yet. I thought I'd stop by the workshop and see if I could buy something for our truck.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001245
Reply.text: And how's that going?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001246
Reply.text: No chance, everything is too expensive. I only have 100 coins. Since prices are so high in our village, I can't imagine what they would be like in the city.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001340
Reply.text: No wonder, because your survival in this chaotic world only depends on the vehicle.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001342
Reply.text: You know, I don't feel like going anywhere. Let's, as usual, pay for the ride to Vasily.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001343
Reply.text: That's true. I don't know what I was thinking. It's not worth the risk, after all, you're my only son. Here's 60 coins. Give it to him, and he'll do the rest.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001344
Reply.text: Yes, I'll go right now.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest( 'Buyer_Quest1' ); TActivate('trZapretGluhoeStart'); AddPlayerMoney(60); TakeQuest('TalkToVasily'); AddBook('r1_book_the_mask'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001341
Reply.text: No way, you won't scare me this time. I've always dreamed of making the trip alone.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001345
Reply.text: I'm not trying to. We don't have many bandits, and the ones we do have are barely dangerous. Just keep your eyes open.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001346
Reply.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. And no talking to strangers. Especially not to women-strangers. I never understood why, by the way. You always wanted grandchildren.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001347
Reply.text: Ha-ha-ha. You're always joking around. All right, just go. I'll see you in two hours.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001348
Reply.text: I'll manage one and a half. See you later!

Reply.name: HaveBigBoom_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Do you want something?

Reply.name: HaveBigBoom_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: How do I know you're not lying?

Reply.name: HaveBigBoom_hellodlg0_P1
Reply.text: The bartender at Sowth heartily asks you to pay off your debt. With a gun.

Reply.name: HaveBigBoom_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: The fact that I know about the debt and the gun isn't enough?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001413
Reply.text: The whole neighborhood knows about my debts. But with a gun, it's hard to guess by accident.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001414
Reply.text: You can go to Sowth and ask him yourself. Just keep in mind that I don't have time for all this clownery, so either you give me that gun right now, or...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001415
Reply.text: Wait, wait, no need to overreact. Someone tried to contact me on the radio this morning. The voice really sounded like my comrade from the Sowth. And now you show up and ask for a gun. Okay, I'll believe you. Storm or Kord?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001416
Reply.text: What is it?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001417
Reply.text: Never heard of these? Surely, you don't see such weapons in these lands. Let me explain. The Storm is a shotgun. It's a powerful weapon, but you have to shoot at close range. Kord is a machine gun. It's a better gun than yours, but you can't expect it to kill your enemy by one shot. You got to aim it from a distance. So, what are you taking?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001428
Reply.text: All right! Guys, load this box into the back of his truck.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001429
Reply.text: Perfect. Soon the killers will be punished.

Reply.name: HurdTrucker_hellodlg0
Reply.text: What happened?

Reply.name: HurdTrucker_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: Oh, my God... I saw a pillar of smoke from behind the mountains, but I thought it was just the burning of the leaves after the potato harvest...

Reply.name: HurdTrucker_hellodlg0_2
Reply.text: Yes, of course, it will be done within a few days.

Reply.name: HurdTrucker_hellodlg0_P1
Reply.text: Glukhoe... There was a terrible massacre. No one survived.

Reply.name: HurdTrucker_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: I buried everyone I could find, but there are still many people left under the rubble. Once the flames have died down, will you go there to bury the rest? I don't want to go back there again.

Reply.name: HurdTrucker_hellodlg0_P1_2
Reply.text: And now I would like to get drunk. Got any ananaga?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001384
Reply.text: Sure. Don't worry about payment: it's on the house.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001385
Reply.text: I appreciate it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001386
Reply.text: Listen, I guess you don't have a place to live now. I have an empty house in the Gugulino. How about if you settle down there for a while, and then we'll find you a job.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001387
Reply.text: Thank you, I'm very grateful. But right now I have a slightly different goal.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001388
Reply.text: And which one is it?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001389
Reply.text: Before he died, my... my father told me about Ben The Throttle. The explorer. I need to find him.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001391
Reply.text: I've never heard of such a man. He's definitely not around here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001392
Reply.text: So I'll have to look for him.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001393
Reply.text: There are only two roads from here: to the north and to the south. I think you'd better start from the south.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001395
Reply.text: Merchant Sergo, you know him, is a member of the Northern Way. I often had conversations with him, and he told me about many interesting people. But I haven't heard a word about this Ben of yours.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001396
Reply.text: That doesn't mean he's not in the north.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001397
Reply.text: It doesn't. But Sergo knows almost the whole north. The explorers in particular. Where would the probability of finding Ben be greater?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001398
Reply.text: In the South. You're right, as always. Thank you for everything. One last drink. I'll stay here and head south in the morning. What's the best place to start?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001399
Reply.text: Try the Eastern. It will be the first big town on your way. The people there aren't very friendly, but I know a farmer from there. He spends all his spare time in a bar. Tell him I sent you, and he'll help. Probably.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001400
Reply.text: That's what I'll do. Thanks again.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001401
Reply.text: Oh, and one more thing. I didn't want to say this, but I think I know who attacked your village.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001402
Reply.text: Why didn't you tell me right away? Who was that?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001403
Reply.text: A local gangster authority, Felix. I saw him and his fighters passing in the direction of Glukhoe.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003003
Reply.text: Felix... I ran into him near the big stone archway as he was coming back from Glukhoe. Yesterday I had helped a stranger girl to go around all the local villages, and he didn't like it very much. He demanded a fee from me, and I had to give him the money. Maybe he was the one who attacked my village before that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003004
Reply.text: I don't know... Felix is a dangerous man, of course, but he's never destroyed a village before. Especially because of such little issue...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001404
Reply.text: Felix... I ran into him near the big stone archway as he was coming back from Glukhoe. Yesterday I had helped a stranger girl to go around all the local villages, and he didn't like it very much. He demanded a fee from me, and when I refused to pay, he attacked me. I managed to overpower him, but he said he would have his revenge.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001405
Reply.text: And he will keep his promise. The man never forgives offenses. But he has never destroyed a village before. Especially because of such little issue...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001406
Reply.text: It doesn't matter. He's dangerous, and I need a release. Tell me where his base is, and I will kill them all. This will be my farewell gift to the people of these lands.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001407
Reply.text: Don't be so hot. I want to get rid of him myself, but it would be suicidal to go there alone. Especially without the right weapon.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001408
Reply.text: And what do you suggest? Let him get away with killing innocent people?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001409
Reply.text: Once again, I have very little faith that Felix had anything to do with it. But you don't seem to be interested in my opinion.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002595
Reply.text: Okay, if you say so, I'll believe you. He really doesn't look like a merciless murderer.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002596
Reply.text: I'm glad you changed your mind.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002599
Reply.text: And my father also told me before he died not to obsess about finding those who did it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002600
Reply.text: Your father was a wise man. I spoke to the mayor, and he promised me that he would increase the security of all the villages in the region, so that if your father's killers ever come to our land again, they won't get away. We'll take care of everything. And you go south and look for your Ben The Throttle.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002601
Reply.text: I don't have the words to describe how grateful I am to you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002602
Reply.text: And remember: if you get tired of adventures, you are always welcomed here. Now go get some rest, because it's not right to go on the road like that.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002603
Reply.text: Thank you so much. I don't know if we will ever see each other again, but I will always remember my homeland.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('BenSouth_Quest'); TakeQuest('BenEast_Quest'); AddHistory( 'r1_Felix_Not_Dead' ); AddFadingMsgId( 'fm_history_got' ); TActivate('trSwitchInfectionBelong'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001410
Reply.text: Watch what you're saying! That's my father! And dozens of innocent people! The killers must be punished!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001411
Reply.text: It's impossible to talk to you! Let me put it this way: I will give you a powerful weapon, and with it you will go to smash Felix's base.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001412
Reply.text: Powerful weaponry? For nothing?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001421
Reply.text: No. Think of it as payment.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001422
Reply.text: All right. Where can I get it?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001423
Reply.text: At the Zaimka. Ask Quentin. He owes me a little debt, so he'll pay me back with a gun for you. But he probably won't believe that I've sent you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001424
Reply.text: Then what should I do?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001430
Reply.text: I'll try to get him on the radio, but I don't think that's going to work. Try to talk him down somehow. I'm sure you can do it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001431
Reply.text: I hope so. All right, now I'm going to sleep. Tell it to get my room ready. And tomorrow I'll go see your friend.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002597
Reply.text: Everything is already done. Go and get a good rest. You'll have a hard day tomorrow.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002598
Reply.text: Thank you for everything. Felix will be defeated.

Reply.name: HurdTrucker_hellodlg2
Reply.text: I'm glad you're alive.

Reply.name: HurdTrucker_hellodlg2_1
Reply.text: So, what now? Are you going to keep looking for the killer?

Reply.name: HurdTrucker_hellodlg2_P1
Reply.text: You were right, Felix had nothing to do with the destruction of Glukhoe. I didn't kill him, but he won't bother you anymore. Thank you especially for the weapon. I wouldn't survive without it.

Reply.name: HurdTrucker_hellodlg2_P1_1
Reply.text: I don't know. My father's last words were about not letting hate rule your actions. But Felix told me that the only witness of the Glukhoe attack had gone north. I could follow her and find out who is really to blame.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001419
Reply.text: Your father was a wise man. I spoke to the mayor, and he promised me that he would increase the security of all the villages in the region, so that if your father's killers ever come to our land again, they won't get away. We'll take care of everything. And you go south and look for your Ben The Throttle.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001420
Reply.text: Yes, you're right. Thank you again. I don't have the words to describe how grateful I am to you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001432
Reply.text: And remember: if you get tired of adventures, you are always welcomed here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001433
Reply.text: Goodbye! I don't know if we will ever see each other again, but I will always remember my homeland.

Reply.name: Lisa_hellodlg0
Reply.text: Excuse me, could you help me?

Reply.name: Lisa_hellodlg0_1
Reply.text: I'm looking for someone who may, supposedly, be in one of the local villages. The problem is that I don't know the area very well. Could you...

Reply.name: Lisa_hellodlg0_2
Reply.text: Yes. Don't worry, I'll pay you for your time.

Reply.name: Lisa_hellodlg0_3
Reply.text: Eh, that's what they all say. And no one dares to help a person in need.

Reply.name: Lisa_hellodlg0_4
Reply.text: Sure, let's do it. Maybe I can persuade you that there's nothing wrong with my request.

Reply.name: Lisa_hellodlg0_P1
Reply.text: Of course, girl, I'll help in any way I can.

Reply.name: Lisa_hellodlg0_P1_1
Reply.text: Show all the local villages?

Reply.name: Lisa_hellodlg0_P1_2
Reply.text: Honestly, it's all kind of suspicious.

Reply.name: Lisa_hellodlg0_P1_4
Reply.text: Listen, why are we standing on the road? Let's discuss it in the city bar.

Reply.name: Lisa_hellodlg0_P1_5
Reply.text: I have to finish one thing before that, but it won't take long.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001354
Reply.text: Okay, I'll meet you at the bar then.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001355
Reply.text: Awesome, I'll be right back.

Reply.name: lisaBar1
Reply.text: Hello again. I thought you wouldn't come.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001356
Reply.text: It took a little longer than I had planned. But I'm here though.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001357
Reply.text: I'm glad to hear it. So, will you help me? My name is Lisa, by the way.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001358
Reply.text: Nice to meet you. Tell me about the man you're looking for. Maybe I know him.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001359
Reply.text: I don't know much about him. All I know is that he is elderly and lives in one of the villages here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001360
Reply.text: Hmm, every other inhabitant of these lands fits your description. Even my father.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001361
Reply.text: Does your father happen to have some sort of disc-shaped, shiny object with a hole in the middle?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001362
Reply.text: I haven't seen anything like that at his place.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001363
Reply.text: Well, that means I'm not looking for your father. That's something.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001364
Reply.text: I guess it's not the person you want, but this object you described?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001365
Reply.text: Both. I need any information that can help me in my work.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001366
Reply.text: And your work is...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001367
Reply.text: My life's work. I am searching for one legendary explorer, and this disk probably will help me a lot.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001368
Reply.text: So you want the person who has the item you described, with which you will find that researcher? What's his name?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001369
Reply.text: I... I don't know. Not much is known about him at all.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001370
Reply.text: How can you look for him without even knowing his name?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001371
Reply.text: Somehow, like I always did. Look, I'm glad to chat, of course, but I don't have much time. What's the result? Are you gonna help me or not?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001372
Reply.text: Yeah, why not.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001374
Reply.text: All right, then. Here's 250 coins in advance if you need anything for your car. You'll get the other 250 coins when you show me the last village.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001375
Reply.text: Thanks. I'll meet you at the gate.
Reply.scriptResult: GetCurNpc():SetSpokenCount( 1 ); CompleteQuest('LisaAtSouth'); AddPlayerMoney(250); TActivate('LISAACTIVE'); AddHistory( 'r1_Yes_Lisa_History_01' ); AddFadingMsgId( 'fm_history_got' ); TActivate('trZapretGluhoeStart'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Vasily1
Reply.text: Oh, hello! Let me guess - a trip to the Sowth and back on your father's wreck. Look, it gets more and more damaged every day. So this time, it's 100 coins.

Reply.name: Vasily1_P1
Reply.text: 100 coins?! What the hell for?!

Reply.name: Vasily6
Reply.text: Oh, my God... Where did these trucks come from?!

Reply.name: Vasily6_P6
Reply.text: I guess that's the end of us...

Reply.name: Vasily2
Reply.text: For unforeseen risks. Look for yourself - this bucket is about to fall apart. What if it happens on the road?

Reply.name: Vasily2_P2
Reply.text: Yes, I agree, this scrap metal is by no means in the best condition. I'll pay you.

Reply.name: Vasily3
Reply.text: Wait, no haggle?

Reply.name: Vasily3_P3
Reply.text: No. My father would probably bargain for 25 coins, but I won't.

Reply.name: Vasily4
Reply.text: All right. Should I move out right now?

Reply.name: Vasily4_P4
Reply.text: Yes, that would be nice.

Reply.name: Vasily5
Reply.text: Wait...|Hear that? It's rumbling. Sounded like heavy equipment, coming from the east.

Reply.name: Vasily5_P5
Reply.text: Hop in the car. Let's check out that noise.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest( 'TalkToVasily' ); TDeactivate( 'triggerExitToMap41' ); AddFadingMsgByStrIdFormatted( 'fm_player_add_poput', 'Vasily_P'); AddQuestItem('Vasily_P'); TActivate('SpawnAnalDestroyers'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002546
Reply.text: Man, you got here just in time!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002547
Reply.text: What's wrong? Why is everyone running around like crazy?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002568
Reply.text: Intelligence reports that the bandits have gathered very powerful weapons and are about to attack our town.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002569
Reply.text: Wouldn't the turrets be able to defend the town in the case of an attack?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002570
Reply.text: You don't know what kind of power we are talking about, pal. If they get to the city, they'll destroy all the turrets in a few minutes.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002571
Reply.text: It's a tough situation. But you have a plan, don't you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002572
Reply.text: Yes, I do. We need a volunteer to deliver materials for building pillboxes to our two strongholds, and then help us fight off a bandit attack. So far, no one has dared to do that - they're all afraid to stick their noses out of town.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002574
Reply.text: I am ready to do it. I can't allow nasty bandits to rule my homeland!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002573
Reply.text: Well, I hope someone agrees, but I have to go. Good luck with that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002549
Reply.text: Truly our whole town is grateful to you. After such a beating, the bandits won't come to our land for a long time. Here, take this reward, you've earned it!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002550
Reply.text: Good luck to you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003264
Reply.text: Oh, here you are! Remember me?
Reply.scriptCondition: QuestStatus('FindBenMZ_Quest')==Q_COMPLETED and QuestStatus('d_FindRealFatherRoom_Quest')==Q_COMPLETED and QuestStatus('TalkToBarmenBeforeDesert')~=Q_TAKEN and QuestStatus('DefendSowth_Quest')~=Q_TAKEN and GetCurNpc():GetSpokenCount() == 0

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003265
Reply.text: Of course I remember. I see you've decided to take my advice and come to our land.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003147
Reply.text: So it is! And you have no idea what a gold mine this is! I've never seen so many potatoes, I drive back and forth almost every day. And it's all because of you!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003148
Reply.text: Most importantly that you are satisfied yourself.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003149
Reply.text: I'm so satisfied! I haven't made as much money in my whole life with Stryga as I have in a couple of trips here. Here, take it as a small gratitude from me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003150
Reply.text: No, you shouldn't.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003266
Reply.text: Take it, I say! It is a matter of honor to thank a comrade for saving my life.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003267
Reply.text: Thank you. Well, I have to go now. See you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002592
Reply.text: Give the money to Felix?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003106
Reply.text: Now you've seen everything. Do you still have any doubts?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003155
Reply.text: Sergo... He lied about coming to the Overlord after the crash... He was there when it happened, wasn't he?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003156
Reply.text: Yes. That's why he can't go through the last stage of spiritual transformation: the Overlord's influence has enveloped him too much.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003157
Reply.text: What do you mean by "the last stage of spiritual transformation"?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003158
Reply.text: You have to deny the last thing that connects you to this world. Deny the symbol of the new humanity.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003159
Reply.text: Take off the mask...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003160
Reply.text: Exactly. I can't do it myself: I'm too old and the memory of the traditions of my former life is too strong in me. Even if I take off my mask, it won't change anything.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003161
Reply.text: I see. I feel like I'm ready. But before that...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003162
Reply.text: Of course, take your time. What do you want to do?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_003163
Reply.text: There is a picturesque place in Hel. I want to see it. For the last time.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_003164
Reply.text: As you wish. We'll leave when you're ready.
